Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amotz1
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 5 days at the k+k - had a great time. The hotel staff are very hospitable, the rooms are very nice and breakfast was great. The location is in close to everything,. Recommended. amotz

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Stay”
Reviews.Author: bostonstm
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a property. Francois and Claudia at the front desk deserve extra kudos for their great attitude and recommendations! The property itself sits in the Latin Quarter - an easy walk to the L'Ouvre and the Orsday, as well as many great restaurants and boutiques. Make sure to take time to explore the neighborhood, you will not be disappointed! The rooms were spacious - make sure if you are traveling with 3 you request an executive versus just a standard triple. The difference in size is well worth the price. Every square inch of this property is spotless, which was a big hit for my family seeing as my daughter is asthmatic! The breakfast was a delight with subtle changes day to day on the menu for those of us staying multiple nights. The workout room was very nice and I was the only one using it each morning of our stay! If you are looking for quiet in a great location, this is the place! Friendly attentive staff with high standards...you wont beat this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: EastYorkshireCouple
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel last February with a group of females. We arrived at the hotel and where greeted by friendly staff the rooms are excellent with lovely views. We chose this hotel as it included breakfast and we was not dissapointed it was a lovely selection and cooked just right. Although we didn't use the bar it was available but since we only visited for 2 nights there was lots to explore. I would stay here again it was simply wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “What a delight!”
Reviews.Author: mogirlatheart
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently had the pleasure of staying at KK. It was well-located for sight-seeing, catching the train, shopping, and had many delicious eateries within 3 blocks any direction. But, it was the staff that truly distinguish this hotel from many others. We were greeted with bright smiles, fluent English, and a willingness to accommodate our every whim. As there were three of us, one being an 18 year old boy, I had worried about the room being too tiny. While it was not large, it had been expertly designed to maximize every inch. The only negative was Wi-Fi and internet connection which were troublesome. We had been told that certain areas of the hotel had internet reception difficulties and this was certainly true. Eventually, we had to work out of the hotel lobby computer area. The room was comfortable, clean, well- appointed and quiet! The price was on the high end but worth every penny! Our trip took us to other locations and other hotels and more than once we found ourselves saying "Oh, we wish we were back at KK!".

Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: scillystuff
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 4 night stay in Paris at K&K Cayre. We had a standard room on the 2nd floor, overlooking a little courtyard. It was plenty large enough for our needs and very quiet. The beds were comfortable, and the bathroom spacious and re-equipped every day. There was free wifi throughout the hotel and we were able to print off our boarding passes using the computer in the lounge area. We had breakfast included in our package. It was good quality, there was plenty of it and an excellent variety. One of the best things about the hotel were the staff. They were excellent, very helpful and spoke fluent english. The location, as many have mentioned, was brilliant, with easy access, by the metro over the road, to all of the main tourist sights. Several are also within easy walking distance. This is a really good hotel which we will use again when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a Paris base”
Reviews.Author: Headhunter1951
Reviews.Content: A great hotel to stay in for a sight seeing and shopping trip to Paris. As others have said the location is brilliant, less than fifty yards to the metro. A large number of the main tourist sights are within easy walking distance. The hotel was nicely understated but immaculately clean throughout. She staff were excellent, very helpful and spoke fluent English, breakfast was good and lots of choice. What was really fantastic was free WiFi throughout the hotel,which makes a nice change from being ripped off by most hotels. Really good hotel and I'd happily go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MeginOz
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay at the K&K. Had a triple room, which was fine for three traveling ladies. Third sofa bed was very firm, but that was fine for me... good for the back! Bathroom plenty spacious, loved the little balcony. Room was freshened up each day and fully stocked. I was pleasantly surprised by some of the little niceties: fleur de sel caramels one day, fresh flowers another. Truly made the hotel experience feel more like home. Concierge was helpful in setting up an evening outing. Breakfast was delicious each day and the staff was kind and accommodating. The icing on the cake is the hotel's location. Right at the Rue du Bac metro station -- super convenient. Easy walk to Musee d'Orsay, Le Bon Marche, and the Seine. Several good cafes within a few blocks, many open very late and with a nice selection of meals. Wonderful stay. If I return for longer than a few days, I will rent an apartment but this hotel can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: “Oh La La!!”
Reviews.Author: Ihearttravel218
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel for a first European trip. This hotel was perfect because I was afraid of a very small space. This hotel was very modern and the staff spoke fluent English. The staff and very helpful and knowledgeable. A lot of attractions were walking distance and the metro was right at the corner. Plenty of restaurants to choose from in the neighborhood. A great bonus of this hotel was the buffet breakfast that was offered every morning. That was rare for most Hotels in Paris. The room was comfortable and a good size. My only dislike was the smell of the towels. I think it was just their detergent because each day the towels smelled the same. This trip overall was great. Just bring comfortable shoes/sneakers and plenty of cash as the American dollar was weak.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough”
Reviews.Author: rpmcestmoi
Reviews.Content: A nice if undistinguished hotel in a ver dull corner of the 7th arrondissement. Nice staff, nice rooms, nice furnishings. When nice is enough.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in all respects...”
Reviews.Author: wclegends
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent a four nights at this wonderful Paris hotel. We could not have been more pleased. The front desk staff is fantastic...helpful, gracious, polite, and very engaging. The breakfast is awesome. The room was a very nice size, as was the bathroom. Very clean;daily maid service. Locate within a few feet of the metro stop. Wonderful place to stay while in Paris. We will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in central Paris”
Reviews.Author: ggabi
Reviews.Content: Good location, nice building, rooms are rather small but fully equipped and comfy. Nice, helpful staff, subway station just in front of the building, relatively quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: 7n1dwarf
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel in Paris I stayed at that I didn't book myself since this I stayed here for a business trip. As soon as I found out the hotel I would be staying at, I checked Trip Advisor right away and was delighted to find out it had excellent reviews and was in a great location. Check-in was a breeze. The staff are accommodating and friendly. My room was very clean and, despite being in a fairly busy area, very quiet. Since I like my room temperature to be on the cold side, I was pleased to discover that it could be brought down to 12 degrees Centigrade (or about 54F). I've stayed in hotel rooms in Europe that were too warm, especially during the winter, so it was good to have the option of temperature control. The bathroom was very clean and water pressure was very good. Breakfast was not included in the room rate and at 28 euros, was a bit steep so my companions and I opted to eat at the nearby cafes. There's a cafe half a block away that has a very good International breakfast (tea/coffee, orange juice, croissant, bread, and omelette) for 15 euros. Laduree was also within walking distance (about 10 to 15 mins, depending on walking speed) so it was yet another good breakfast place to go to. I normally stay at hotels on the Right Bank but should I ever have to stay on the Left Bank, I would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: Ally83
Reviews.Content: We just got home, and I have to write before I forget. First of all my Husband and I decided to go to Paris for his 30th birthday, we had to go at half term as I am a teacher. This hotel was very reasonably priced. The hotel was quite easy to get to from the eurostar and the metro was right outside. The Staff were just so polite at this hotel. They started speaking to us in French. We quickly used one of our only French Phrases to ask if they spoke English and they did perfectly! We stayed on the 6th floor. The view was very pretty and we had no street noise. It was small but not cramped and it is in central Paris so what we expected. The bathroom was spotless and the towels were huge white and fluffy! Breakfast was lovely, huge selection including Cereals with a selection of nuts, yogurts, hot scrambled eggs and bacon, pastries, smoked salmon, salad, fruit, breads, cold meats etc etc. We had the best time in Paris and this hotel made our trip so complete. One tip we found it helped to try to use some basic French even if you know none like we did, it is good manners and it gets a much better response.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate”
Reviews.Author: Dee A
Reviews.Content: I did alot of homework before choosing K+K Hotel Cayre. If you are looking for modern, well kept rooms with immaculate bathrooms, K+K Hotel Cayre is your place, not to mention the warm and helpful staff. Other pluses are there are two computers for the guests in the lobby, Rue du Bac Metro literally is a few steps out the front door and if you are sending anything back home, the post office is across the street. The staff at the front desk are very good about helping you get around on the bus and Metro. My only suggestion would be that they vary the breakfast menu. My thumbs up to everyone at the K+K Hotel Cayre, I hope to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Egon_Rosie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from 3 to 6 February. It was very nice, clean, comfortable and in an amazing location. We walked around the area with great ease, firstly up to the Montparnasse area then down to the river and across to the Louvre. Great seeing the Place de la Concorde Obelisk and big wheel to the left and Notre Dame to the right. Lots of shops, bars, restaurants in the area too. There was a metro station pretty much right outside the hotel (Rue de Bac). We got a direct train from there to Montmartre (Abessess) and back again, from Pigalle, going past our stop up to Montparnasse. A handy route. We did the Red Bus open top tour (brrrrr freezing cold). Not the best I'm afraid. The driver sat at stops for ages with nobody getting on or off and the temperature was around -8 C. Other tour buses went past us and the service was supposed to be every 10 minutes. Anyway, we survived. Back to the hotel...breakfast was very nice, continental with hot scrambled eggs and crispy bacon as well. Lots of baguette, croissant, pain au chocolate, bread, fresh fruit, fruit salad, yoghurt, cheese, cold meats, cereal, fruit juice, coffee, tea, hot chocolate. Really nothing to complain about. There is a small but well stocked bar in the foyer area, where coffee as well as alcohol is served. There is a limited menu, I you want to eat in the hotel in the evening, but there are so many eateries close by that are worth investigating. We went to La Fregate, right by the river at the foot of Rue de Bac, the street which runs down from the hotel across Boulevard St Germaine. It was lovely inside, with friendly staff. The food was average unfortunately. We'd had better steaks in Scotland, but the menu was extensive and the wine delicious (every cloud...). The other place we ate in was Cafe Le Flores, round the corner from the hotel on Rue de Grenelle. A bustling, warm and inviting bistro bar, with a good looking menu and wine list. We preferred the food here as well as the ambience. We'd go back. Roast chicken tasted like chicken should and the veal with Morel mushroom and cream sauce was well cooked and very tasty. The only issue in the hotel, in my opinion, was the other clientele slamming their room doors, most unnecessarily. Oh I also liked the shoe polishing machines on each floor. Simple things, but necessary when we were there because of the salt on the pavements to melt the ice. My boots were always cleaned on return to the hotel. We had a room on the third floor (315) which was overlooking the street. No real issue with street noise. This was classed as an executive room. Not massive but a decent enough size with a nice bathroom. Toiletries provided (shower gel, shampoo, body lotion, soap bars) which were replenished each day, whether used up or not. Hair drier in the bathroom seemed adequate enough. Although I didn't use for my hair, it quickly cleared the steamed up mirror after a shower. Wifi access available, which was really only of use in the business area in the foyer, as the signal wasn't strong enough on the 3rd floor. Business area included 2 computers and printers, so we accessed the BA site to check in and print boarding passes. Laptop connections available in the room when wifi was weak. All in all, a very enjoyable stay and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, perfect location, highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: SLasn
Reviews.Content: Located within walking distance of all major sights and directly opposite a Metro station. Staff were very friendly, always polite and spoke very good english. Breakfast was super, wide selection of food and brilliant service. Stayed on the 5th floor in the smallest room available which was still a good size and very clean. Wellness area contains a lovely sauna which is available after 16:00. Would highly recommend and will stay again when visiting Paris next.

Reviews.Title: “would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: on-the-road-againX2
Reviews.Content: Upon check-in for our six night stay in December, we were given a room on the second floor directly in front of the elevator. Thought the location to the elevator might present an issue, but it didn't at all. We loved our (Classic) Room: it faced the street, which was very quiet, and had a quintessential Parisien street view; it was surprisingly large, very warm and cozy, and clean. Thank you, Cedric, for offering us this room. In general, staff were pleasant. Some front desk staff at times appeared rather serious, but very busy and dedicated. We seemed to interact most with Raluca, who was particularly approachable. All front desk staff were very gracious!! Breakfasts were excellent and served in a warm, inviting room. Although hot items included only bacon and eggs, there was a large variety of cold items which was filling. Delicious smoked salmon was offered every second day. The coffee was excellent and the croissants were the best I've ever had, anywhere! Unfortunately, the dinner menu and the one dinner we had (offered in the bar area), were disappointing, especially in comparison to K & K hotels in other cities. As mentioned in one of Rick Steves' Christmas television program, Christmas in Paris is rather understated. And, it certainly is. We were in Paris two weeks before Christmas, and only a handful of cafes/shops were decorated. Our hotel was not decorated at all. The 'huts' at the Christmas Markets were a rather cold white and blue color, as opposed to the cheerful colors elsewhere in Europe; did not see true handcrafted items for sale. The lights along the Champs Elysees (which are apparently different each year) were disappointing; according to one front desk staff, many other people thought so as well. However, the huge Christmas tree under the beautiful stained glass dome at the Galeries Lafayette is worth a visit. Apart from the 'must see' city attractions, one of particular interest was the Sunday morning market on Rue Mouffetard in the Latin Quarter (a long, but do-able) walk from the hotel. From 9 am to 1 pm on Sundays, at the lower end of this market in the Pere Medard Church square, a couple play an accordian and sing, and people (locals and tourists, alike) dance. Aso, the Opera House is stunningly beautiful both inside and outside. Memorable (simple) meals include Au Pere Louis for the cassoulet and french onion soup, the Creperie des Arts for crepes, and Angelina Tea Salon for croquet monsieurs. Favourite macaron was Ladouree's salted caramel. We don't usually visit the same city twice (too many other places to see); in this case, we would like to return to Paris and in particular to the K & K Cayre Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: BigPanther
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located next to the blv St. Germain and in front of a Metro station with rolling stairs. The (standard) rooms are clean, quiet but too small as the TV set. Service was not really friendly but present and competent. Don't expect a nice and tasty breakfast (buffet with croissants, baquette, chese and ham) - unfortunately and at my surprise the coffee was not fresh. I don't think that I will return to this expensive place.

Reviews.Title: “A classy establishment in a great part of town”
Reviews.Author: TraderPatrick
Reviews.Content: Close enough to walk to all the must see parts of Paris - but far enough away such that all the local bistros and cafes are very French. The staff were outstanding and full of local dining and shopping tips. Rooms are warm, quiet, and spacious enough. I'll be back

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: B-Mane
Reviews.Content: This was an awesome hotel, rooms were great. The bathroom tiles were heated. Staff were very nice except for one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! Can't be better than this gem in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: FlyingBrandy
Reviews.Content: Location: Fantastic. 10 minutes walk to most of the great locations, nextto Metro station, in probably the nicest area of Paris. Service:Superb. Frank in particular delivers personalised serice beore arrival via email, during and after. Clean, great technology, gym, bar and breakfast! Ask Frank for a recommendation to restaurants and he will send you to the best little French restaurants in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ixia416
Reviews.Content: If you're going to Paris and are looking for a place to stay, you can't go wrong with this one! It's just steps away from the Metro (literally) and walking distance to several key attractions (Musee d'Orsay, Louvre, etc.) and a wide variety of restaurants. The staff had great dining recommendations, and were friendly and helpful throughout the stay. My package included breakfast (there are several packages to choose from on their website), and it was always fresh with a good selection. The room was on the small side in general, but a decent size for Paris. It was tastefully decorated and the beds were very comfortable. The washroom was clean with decent counter space. There were a couple bonus features that I really appreciated, and these were free wi-fi and a free business center offering a few computer terminals (unlimited, 24-hour availability) and a printer. I will definitely return to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, friendly professional staff, overall a great experience”
Reviews.Author: rymetymeuk
Reviews.Content: I went to Paris with my now fiancee, and we stayed here for 2 nights. I had researched fairly extensively and I found this hotel to be exactly as described by other reviewers. The room was a little small, but to be expected in Paris, but very comfortable. I staff were very helpful and friendly, and overall I felt it fairly good value for money. The location was great, very easily walkable to the Lovre and other attractions. I would recommend staying here, and I will do so if I come to Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a First Visit”
Reviews.Author: Edge4syn
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable rooms in a boutique hotel. Except for the occasional siren rooms were quiet and well-appointed. Staff was friendly and helpful. Great location, directly across the street from the Metro (Rue de Bac), and far enough away from the tourist areas to remain quiet. The Louvre is only about a 15min walk away. Would stay here again if I was in town.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, reasonably-sized hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Pomonan
Reviews.Content: Our 4-night stay in June 2011 was a return visit. The rooms are not the largest (this is Central Paris, the same would be true at this level in London and especially New York for a hotel at this level), but perfectly usable, and clean and light. What you are buying is the location, and the Cayre delivers this in spades. With a Metro station virtually outside the front door, you can get anywhere, but there are so many interesting shops and restaurants within an easy walk that we rarely ventured underground. Breakfast is moderate, and unless your rate includes it I would recommend heading out to a cafe. Our main bugbear with Paris is the train ride in from CDG (and no, Eurostar isn't a better option for those of us north of London), otherwise we would visit more often - and certainly stay here if we did.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sgm1
Reviews.Content: Nicely located within walking distance of most attractions. Friendly staff, Clean and modern rooms by Paris standards. Breakfast staff can, however, be a little rude to English-speaking guests and slow with the coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: enixmatix
Reviews.Content: I was slightly concerned about staying in another K+K Hotel following a rather disappointing experience in their Prague property. The Hotel Cayre, however, delivered on most accounts. By Paris standards the price was quite reasonable, location was excellent (just south of the river, away from the tourist mob) and obviously within walking distance from several metro stations. This hotel is not flash and doesn't quite live up to the "boutique" tag to which it likes to brand itself. That said, my room was very comfortable, quite spacious for Paris and featured a kettle + tea/coffee in addition to all the usual trimmings you expect to find at a 4* hotel. There was no view, though, which I didn't mind on this occasion as it kept the room quiet from street noise. Free fast wi-fi is another great plus. I also found the reception staff very polite and friendly (not to be taken for granted in Paris, or any other big city for that matter). The breakfast was OK, nothing special. With all the cafe options around the hotel, I wouldn't splash out if not part of the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “This has become our regular stay in Paris now.”
Reviews.Author: FrequentBizTraveler9
Reviews.Content: Incredible location! Solid rooms. Friendly staff. Best value for money in St Germain de Pres.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Tabbywest
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice and both times found the hotel to be comfortable and the location to be great for exploring Paris. It is located right across from a metro station and in a lovely neighborhood where you can stroll from the wine shop to the cheese shop to the chocolate shop to get your supplies for sitting on your balcony and looking out at the city in the evening. Both visits we had a spectacular view. With the doors to the balcony shut you cannot hear the traffic noise below you. The rooms are fairly large compared to the average european hotel room and there is storage in the closet so you do not trip over your luggage. The bathroom also has space for all your toiletries on shelves so you don't have to fight for space on the counter. Yes, the king bed is two twins but again that is pretty normal. The room is immaculately cleaned. The hotel staff is very helpful and friendly. While sitting at the bar one evening I listened to the desk staff help many people with directions, instructions on how to use the metro, where to take their kids for dinner. The hotel breakfast is not extensive but the eggs were good and coffee is plentiful! I know this is a business hotel but there were lots of families and couples about.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Lawrence C
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the K+K 6 nights. Was on the top floor with spectacular view. I believe I was upgraded though noone told me so. Room was fine size, bathroom tiles were loose and some place paint was chipped or off wall. Maid twice forgot to leave me a bathmat. People were incredibly friendly and helpful-could not be nicer. So why not five stars? The hotel lacks any charms at all-it is very much like a chain hotel. Nothing wrong with that, just doesnt get you to the 5 star level

Reviews.Title: “Four stars? Non!”
Reviews.Author: WnnaBTrvlWrtr
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel thinking we were getting a good deal on a four star hotel. We were disappointed to find that, although this is a pleasant and very clean hotel, it really is not a four star hotel. Our room was on the top floor at the end of a hallway that has some of the ugliest carpet I have ever seen. The room, situated under the eaves, was very small and decorated in a very basic style. The bathroom was very clean and well furnished with toiletries, but their quality was not what we have experienced in other four star Parisian hotels. The towels were very nice but the bed linens and pillows were not the best. There was no way to adjust the heat (other than to open the window) and there was no ventilation in the bathroom. The need to leave the key, which actually was some sort of magnetic block, at the front desk whenever one went out was annoying. We did enjoy the buffet breakfast, which had a good selection of quality dairy products, meats, breads and pastries and was accompanied by coffee served by a very pleasant server who knew just when to offer a refill. We spent very little time in the hotel -- we were in Paris, after all -- so our disappointment did not adversely effect our visit to the City of Light. This hotel's location is excellent, within walking distance of the Musee D'Orsay, the Louvre and lots of Left Bank restaurants and shops. I would recommend this hotel so long as you book with the understanding that it is more like a nice three star property than a four star hotel -- and pay a commensurate rate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Jknkk
Reviews.Content: Great staff and location...you won't regret booking this hotel. We didn't purchase the breakfast buffet ($$). We enjoyed all the cafe's around the hotel instead. Only complaint is we got a room near a service elevator...noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Out of this world!”
Reviews.Author: bajanwoman
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Hotel Cayre and we know exactly why we returned. The hotel and its staff are truly amazing. Franck and Denis were so lovely. Helpful, great sense of humour and easy to chat with. The location of this hotel made for easy access to all of the favourite must see items on our list. The breakfast was yummy, the room very clean and well appointed. We were sad to leave and are already planning our next vist.

Reviews.Title: “real hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: dal2n
Reviews.Content: A real efficient hotel.Clean,confortable and with people who cares about the guest well being,and after all,in one of th best areas of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BCJ J
Reviews.Content: Outstanding location-close walking distance to the Orsay and Louve museums. Great breakfast buffet-eggs, bacon chocolate croissants, fresh fruit etc, Exceptional customer service from the breakfast, front desk and housekeeping staff. Metro across the street to use for farther tourist attractions such as Eiffel.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Paris, the best staff in a hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Vickio62
Reviews.Content: Big call I know, however I can't think of a group, no team of staff more friendly and efficient in all the hotels I have stayed in the world especially Paris. Have stayed at La Grande and Normandy in Paris before with less then positive staff. Whilst the rooms are smallish, (it is Paris!) they are stylish and spotless. The Metro is across the road and most Paris attractions within a walk any way. The Cafes near the hotel are also fantastic. My wife and I will always cherish how the staff looked after us.

Reviews.Title: “Very well situated hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Sheila H
Reviews.Content: My husband & I had several nights in K&K Cayre mid October 2011 and found the position excellent. Not far to walk to the Seine and then to all the tourist sites and well known districts. The Metro and the bus stops are virtually outside the door which makes it easy to get around if you don`t feel like walking, The staff at the front desk are so helpfull and speak excellent English that asking directions or booking tours or dinner etc is not at all difficult. Close also to the Hotel are many restaraunts and Patisserie`s. We found the room small but adequate, had a good bed and although the bathroom was also small, well appointed. Breakfast was very good lots of healthy choices and again pleasant staff. We would not hesitate to reccommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent mid-range hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: kahkityoong
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at K+K Cayre on two occasions, each lasting a week. Located in St Germain des Pres it's location is just about ideal. I have also stayed at hotels in Vendome, usually regarded as the most central location, but found K+K slightly better as a base to take in all the sights of Paris, not just Concorde and the Louvre, which are closer to Vendome. There are at least 3 Metro stops within short walking distance. Rue du Bac is the closest of these, right outside the hotel facade. I felt like a gopher popping out of a hole every time I surfaced from the Rue de Bac station, as it was so close to K+K. I've booked through the hotel website both times. On my first visit, I arrived at around 7am but they were able to check me in and even received an upgrade to a suite which was excellent. The second time, I was in their basic room, which was very good for Paris - modern, clean and quite spacious. The free internet worked well. Breakfast is quite good for a 4 star hotel, consisting of mainly cold cuts, cheese and fruits. There is a limited selection of hot food. As good as the rooms and amenities are, it's the hotel staff that make this hotel. All speak English very well, anticipated our needs well and the concierge did a great job at arranging dinner reservations for us.

Reviews.Title: “Paris was paridise because of hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Diane G
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here the first week of October celebrating our 35th anniversary and we were in heaven!! We had a lovely street view room with hugh windows that opened for us to pop our head out and get great photos that were postcard perfect!! Our room number 112 was comfortable, spacious and clean. The bathroom was gorgeous but small. The buffet breakfast was massive and had loads of healthy choices.The most impressive thing for us though was the front desk employees!!! They were always there to help with ANYTHING - no matter!! They were friendly and spoke English as well as other languages. They helped us in numberous ways and always in a pleasant manner. Everything you need is here in this hotel right in the center of Paris within walking distance to everything. The subway is right outside the front door and you could get everywhere one would want in a manner of minutes. There are cafes and shops all around and the river is only a couple of blocks away. We loved this hotel and would go back in a heartbeat!!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: hopebh
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location surrounded by great restaurants and walking distance to many attractions. The Muse de Orsay and Seine was a 5 minute easy walk. The service impressed us and we were treated very well considering this is a 4 star hotel. Everyone in this part of town knew enough english to converse with you which made going to restaurants very pleasant. There were a lot of Americans in the hotel, which can be good or bad, depending on how you look at it. When we arrived to our room we received a personalized note and a bag of chocolates. The folks that worked the breakfast buffet were very professional and always wore a smile. They provided the basic buffet foods with eggs and bacon as the only warm items. The bartenders were also very nice and helpful and the bar area was a very comfortable place to just relax and hang out in. The room included the only tub of our trip and was a welcome sight. The bathroom floors was heated and the bed was comfortable. The room was extremely small, but was adequate for the two of us. The bed was a little hard, but we found that to be true in all the hotels we stayed in. The internet was fast and included in our rate. This hotel was our very favorite of the 3 city trip. It was an excellent value and we will definately stay here on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “The ideal place to stay”
Reviews.Author: crsmithy
Reviews.Content: K + K is the perfect place to stay. My wife and I and infant son stayed there for a week in mid October. The location is ideal. You can walk to almost all the favourite sites in half hour or less and for those sites further afield there is a metro right outside the door. Just down the street is trendy shopping and many excellent restaurants are close by. The service was great and the staff was very helpful. The rooms were super clean and comfortable and quiet. The breakfast was very tasty and the room service we ordered one night was pretty good too. We especially loved the fresh flowers and the heated tile floor in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: nfordandjford
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the K+K Hotel Cayre in Paris for 4 nights this Sept. 2011. We had a classic double room and found the hotel to be very comfortable, quiet, and clean. Our room was fairly large by Paris standards and the bathroom is as well. Little touches like fresh flowers in the room and lobby areas, nice linens, and helpful staff make staying here a lovely experience. Their breakfasts are ample and well done (and they were included with our rate), so even without a restaurant on the premises, the breakfast service in their breakfast room is more than adequate! We were happy that we could walk to major museums and sites, (many are 10-15 minutes away) and that there are a number of good places to eat nearby. There is cab stand across the street, and the metro and bus stops are close too. We will stay at this hotel again when we are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here 3 years ago and still a great place to stayb and if I go again I will stay here.”
Reviews.Author: ozandy
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location. Only minutes to walk to the Louvre, D'Orsay, Notre Dame, Luxembourg Gardens, Invalides and the Pantheon. Breakfast is great and this always gives you a great start to the day. Staff were great. Rooms are a bit small but this is pretty much the norm for Paris particularly in conversion of some of these older buildings into hotels. In saying that it was no great hassle as we basically only washed and slept in the room for the 6 nights we stayed. Metro within 30 seconds of the front door and plenty of great little cafes and bars around.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Dave C
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 days in Paris and trip was made wonderful with the help of this hotel. The hotel staff was very helpful with all our questions and for dinner reservations. Hotel is located 10 minute walk from one of nine stops for the hop on hop off bus route ( I recomend) or 15 minute walk to the Louvre. It was very quiet and the breakfast was very good. We had a great view of Eiffel tower which made our stay the best. I would stay in this hotel again for the value and service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very Good Service, Way Overpriced, Not Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: BKEpicure
Reviews.Content: American levels of comfort have not reached critical mass in Europe, and this hotel is a prime example. The location could not be better for walking, museums, restaurants and cafes, but the beds are too short, often comprised of two small beds pushed together (when will they learn that king-size beds are not that expensive, and everyone sleeps together?), and the bathrooms uncomfortably undersized and unconducive to a relaxing long hot shower. The staff are accustomed to an international clientele and all speak English. They'll tolerate your poor French, and even accommodate it. Requests are taken seriously and addressed as such. The price is not worth the product, location notwithstanding. It's just overpriced, relying on the location to justify the rates. There are better options for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room - fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: travelingmom53
Reviews.Content: My daughter and i decided on a spur of the moment trip to Paris last month for a long weekend. Hotel prices were ridiculous and lots of places were full but my daughter found a last-minute deal at the Hotel Cayre that included breakfast. What good luck - this was a small lovely hotel, very friendly, spotlessly clean, with a fantastic location on the left bank. Still pricey but this is Paris, after all. Walk to the best shopping in Paris, the Musee D'Orsay, across the street from the Rue du Bac metro stop. Breakfast was beautiful with a lot of choices.

Reviews.Title: “accommodating property”
Reviews.Author: Shi Hu
Reviews.Content: I've always felt if you read enough comments, you do get a feel for a property and I would lhave to agree with most of the critiques. This is a facility in which most Americans would be comfortable. The hotel is in a convenient location, in the vicinity of the d'Orsay and the Louvre, and near the metro and a taxi stand. The staff is well-trained, pleasant and helpful. The breakfast would please most tastes - yogurts, fresh fruits, tasty fresh carbs, cheeses, cereals, ham, eggs and bacon. Coffee is refreshed frequently and with a smile. We needed to have the in-room AC controls in a quiet room with adequate bedside reading lights. In our "executive room", we connected to wifi on a spacious desk surface and robes and slippers were provided with an in-room safe and a large enough closet and drawers for a 7-night stay. The bed was comfortable enough but the bedding was certainly not luxurious with the uncomfortable, small pillows. Not having found wash cloths in most European hotels, I now bring my own. They are provided here! I do want to say, from my perspective - staying at the K & K is not a luxurious experience. The hotel itself and the rooms are homely; there is no charm, but there is convenience. Also, we did not find a satisfactory selection of restaurants in the neighborhood. Several were, indeed, recommended to us but they were rather mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good position”
Reviews.Author: cebazat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and were very happy with our choice. The welcome at the check-in desk was friendly and informative. The room was clean and bed comfortable. Breakfast was buffet and all that one could wish for. We also ate in the Bistro one night and found the food delicious and the service excellent. The hotel is in a good position, within walking distance to many attractions and opposite a Metro. All the staff were helpful and friendly. We would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just as wonderful second time around”
Reviews.Author: andricScotland
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to this particular hotel and once again it ticked all the right boxes. if anything the staff were even more efficient, helpful and polite than before. The room was still as comfortable (although no view of the Eiffel Tower this time around). The breakfasts were still of consistent high quality. The location cannot be improved on. So all in all, keep up the good work KK!

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming staff and wonderful accommodations”
Reviews.Author: LULU06_10
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Paris, this hotel is in the Saint Germain des Pres area, on the Left Bank across from the Seine and Tuileries . Very upscale and near to everything!!! We could walk to most of the major attractions but still we felt removed from the "touristy" ambience. I can't say enough about the staff as they were so accommodating, friendly and helpful. Very comfortable room and a full breakfast buffet that was great. There is no doubt where we would stay again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at K + K Hotel Cayre, Paris”
Reviews.Author: beckyjack
Reviews.Content: I had stayed with a girlfriend at this hotel in 2005 and just stayed Sept.17 thru Sept. 23, 2011 with my husband and another couple. We thoroughly enjoyed our 6-night stay. The staff at the reception desk were always so helpful, cheerful and accomodating. Franck saved us from going to the wrong train station for our trip to Normandy! The rooms were great, the breakfast, sumptous and all staff extremely friendly, remembering how we take our coffee in the morning to remembering our favorite evening drink. Fresh flowers, fresh smiles, great location, a great accomodation - made our Paris trip a dream vacation.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Boutique Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ira G
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 8 great days at this well situated Left Bank hotel. Located across the street from the Rue de Bac Metro and in walking distance of the Seine, d'Orsay, the Louvre and the beautiful buildings of Blvd. St. Germain. The staff was most accomodating and was eager to assist us when we asked for help. Breakfasts were buffet style with anything one might want to start a day. The room was well furnished with a most comfortable bed and room to sit and rest...but who rests in Paris?? WiFi is present in this hotel as is the use of computers and printers. The location of this hotel is great! Don't pass it by.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HelinaFelina
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the Hotel Cayre. What really set them apart is the friendly and helpful front desk staff. They truly went out of their way to make us feel special and welcome. Our room was very comfortable. The weather was very warm. We like to sleep in a cool room, and we appreciated the air conditioning that we could turn down at night. We would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: TheEnglishTourist
Reviews.Content: We went to Paris for our wedding anniversary and definitely chose the right hotel. Well positioned close to Rue de Bac metro station and within easy walking distance of The Seine and across from The Louvre. Facilities were what I would expect from an up market hotel and the service was excellent. ALL the staff were courteous and could not have been more helpful. The room we had was on the top floor and not really with a view, apart from looking across the rooftops towards the Montpanasse Tower, but that really didn't matter. The buffet breakfast had a good selection, as you'd expect. There really is only one hotel where we'll be staying on our next trip to Paris - It's a no brainer..!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeNewJersey32
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at this hotel was very good. The location is central to most of the places we wanted to visit. The front desk staff were extremely helpful and a pleasure to interact with.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PucksterColorado
Reviews.Content: Location in 7th Arrondisement, near Eiffel Tour, Louvre, etc., is perfect. Easy walking to all big sites. Hotel has inner court yard, which means our room opened up to nothing but quiet, or the sound of rain on the windows in the middle of the night--bliss, given the chaos that reigns in Paris! Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful, all with great English skills. An international mix of guests, but not many French--if that's important to you. Breakfast was fabulous. Room was very nice; we'd opted for a junior suite just for more space, and we were happy with that choice. Price was more than fair: didn't pay exorbitant rates, but good rates for a better than good hotel. I will definitely consider staying here again. And, right across the street from the Rue Bac metro station. Bar was nice at night, and bartender a great conversationalist, if you want.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Staff, Fabulous Location, Great all-around!”
Reviews.Author: megreen1971
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a fantastic 5-night stay. This property was recommended to us by a friend and I am so glad we chose the K&K. The staff is by far the best I've ever had the pleasure of working with. From honoring our room requests (choose high-floor with a view and balcony), allowing a very early check-in, arranging for flowers and wine in our room upon arrival for a birthday celebration, to assisting with restaurant recommendations and reservations....these employees are top-notch! The property is immaculately clean and well-maintained. While some have commented that the rooms were small, I felt that we had more than enough space and realize that European rooms are smaller in general. The location couldn't have been better and we enjoyed walking along Rue de Bac and Saint Germain or easily hopping on the Metro. We had a package that included the breakfast buffet and we thoroughly enjoyed the wide selection and friendly service each morning. It was a great way to start our days! We highly recommend and hope to return some day!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: K_Turner217
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent! We only stayed 2 nights because we also visited another area of france, but I wish we could have stayed much longer. The hotel was located near all the attractions that you would want to see. Also if your not in a hurry, get a water taxi, it was a lovely peacful ride. The staff was extremely friendly, and helpful. The rooms were clean and very spacious considering most hotel rooms are on the small side in Europe. The breakfast they offer was very nice had a vast selection of anything you could possibly want for breakfast. It was worth every penny we spent. I will absolutely stay here again when I return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Tres Bien!”
Reviews.Author: Ann R
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a fabulous week in Paris at the K+K hotel. Convenient Left Bank location. Small boutique size. Nice modern decor. Great breakfast buffet. Easy access to the Internet. But the best part of the property, and the reason we can't wait to return, was the friendly, charming, professional and knowledgable staff. Reservations, directions, money exchange, you name it - they did it, and always with a smile and style!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but rooms are tiny”
Reviews.Author: HighStandards_AA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic neighborhood. It's very lively, but not touristy. There are plenty of shops, restaurants, and even a supermarket nearby. Plus, the metro is literally across the street. This is the type of neighborhood you want to live in. Hotel rooms are very important to me, and I was disappointed in the room at the K&K Cayre. It was tiny (think cruise ship) and minimalistic--not in a chic way. Not even one ounce of luxury. Maybe my expectations were too high, but I thought I'd get a little more considering how much the room cost. On a positive note, this hotel is very clean and well taken care of. The breakfast is decent, but not spectacular. We found a few bakeries within walking distance and enjoyed those meals much more than the hotel's breakfast. Overall, this is a fine hotel for business or small families, but not great for couples looking for romance and luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our family needs”
Reviews.Author: IDFSNotts
Reviews.Content: We took the family to Paris to celebrate our Golden. This included four youngsters 7 - 16 and the adjoining rooms were perfect. The back office could not have been more helpful answering all our queries before our arrival. In fact all staff were very helpful and friendly and this together with the beautifully comfortable rooms and amazing breakfasts made for a perfect time on this very special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Locatiom”
Reviews.Author: Nvts
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the location and the great reviews on tripadvisor. We were not disappointed and highly recommend this hotel. The location can't be beat - walking distance to many Paris attractions as well as being across the street from the Rue du Bac Metro station. Great neighborhood and a short walk to the fabulous Grande Epicerie de Paris. The staff were very friendly and accomodating. The rooms were very clean, pleasant and, most importantly, comfortable. Our room was on the 4th floor and even though we were overlooking Blvd. Raspail the room was very quiet. Loved this hotel and would stay again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: Randy L
Reviews.Content: This is our second year staying here. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Paris.The service is very friendly and professional. They will help you with any reservations and information. I speak French and spoke it whenever I could, but all staff speak English. The breakfast has a good selection of eggs, meats, cereals, fruits, nuts, bread/croissants. Very comfortable location, near shopping and restaurants. The location is across the street from the Rue de Bac metro station. The rooms are quiet and have a large window. We have stayed in three different rooms (we left to travel for a couple days and returned). All were on the Blvd Raspail side. Bedding is comfortable, bathroom has tub/ shower, closets are ample. Above all, I would complement the staff. All desk staff who were here last year are still here. I've seen them interact with different types of people and they are always very patient and kind--Raluca, Franck, Serge, Jean-Pierre, you are the best!!!!! Randy and David

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Formula1Champ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in September of 2010 and enjoyed it. The staff was very friendly, room and bathroom was nice (typical 4 star) and clean and the location was fantastic. You can easily walk to Louvre, Museum O’rsey, Army museum and even Eiffel tower. There is parking and very nice shopping nearby. The only suggestion I can provide is get softer high count linen.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Caring Staff.”
Reviews.Author: LaBugga
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at this hotel for our honeymoon. We're both young professionals in our 20's. For some perspective, this is my second time to Europe for pleasure and our trip was approximately two and half weeks through many parts of Europe. We stayed at the K+K for three nights. K+K was definitely our best experience of any of the hotels we stayed in. First, we booked a classic room with the "romantic" package-basically it was their classic room with an included Seine River Cruise. We were surprised to find out that we had been upgraded to a larger room with a balcony and overlook of the Eiffel Tower and Les Invalides' dome. The staff had provided a letter congratulating us on our honeymoon and provided a nice box of chocolates. Later that day we received a knock on the door with a complimentary bottle of champagne! Room: The room was very clean and nicely furnished. We had some trouble with the bed (wood pieces under the bed had become disassembled), but I was able to quickly repair the problem myself and thus never brought it to the staff's attention. Internet was complimentary and provided in the room (this is a BIG deal to me. I would have a hard time rating any hotel in this price range a 5 or higher w/o complimentary WiFi). They also provided a fixed Cat 5 line for those customers wishing for a more stable connection and better transfer speeds. Staff: The staff was extraordinary. Of the other non-English speaking countries we visited, the staff at the K+K was equal only with our hotel in Rome in their excellent command of the language. Also, unlike many places we visited in France, the staff here did not make us feel unwanted for not speaking French (although we did try as we felt it was right to try-we suggest this for any American in France). When they didn't understand something they very politely smiled and laughed with us as both parties tried to reason through a problem. No smirks, no side conservations, no laughing (yes, this did happen in some locations). One of the male staff members (I do wish I remembered his name) helped us our first day. We saw him at a local convenience store one day and he was sure to identify himself, smiled, and said hello. Really everyone was very warm and friendly. Location: Excellent location in the 6th arrondissement. Near shopping and several restaurants (although all were pretty touristy). The hotel is literally 25 meters from the Ru Du Bac Metro station. Unfortunately this is on line 12, which really doesn't go to any of the major tourist destinations by itself. You'll need to make transfers at Concorde for the Louvre or Arc de Triomphe. Take the line to Pasteur to transfer to line 6 for the Eiffel Tower or RER Line C. Building: This is a big deal for us. I get sort of sketched out by any location that looks shady. The front of this hotel was impeccable. Very nice. Looked to be in a very safe area. Due be careful of Paris at night, especially the roads and alleys immediately behind Boulevard Raspail between the Invalides and Eiffel Tower. Paris has perhaps the worst lit streets I have ever encountered in a major first world city of its size. My wife and I got caught out after midnight one night and thought we'd walk back (reasonable distance) given what we perceived would be relatively ok streets and neighborhoods. It was a bad idea, even for people like ourselves who have experience in some shady locals (personal and job related). Be aware of what is behind you, watch dark alleys, and practice very good situational awareness. Ladies: Under no circumstance would I walk alone after dark in Paris-anywhere. We had multiple experiences that reinforced this point, even in this excellent area, but they're not appropriate for elaboration here. Summary: Excellent hotel. Excellent, friendly staff. Large(r) hotel room and good amenities for it's class in Paris. Top notch and worth the Euros.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Front Desk Staff of the Trip”
Reviews.Author: jrp01778
Reviews.Content: We found this left bank hotel on Trip Advisor. It deserves the excellent reviews received. The location is excellent -- less than 50 feet from the Metro, easy walking distance to the Louvre and the Musee D'Orsay. The rooms are modern and clean and quiet, albeit small but how much time do you really spend in your hotel room? The included breakfast is excellent. Most importantly, the front desk staff, who also perform concierge duties, were the best of any hotel we visited on this European trip. They offered excellent restaurant recommendations (places we never would have found otherwise) and secured reservations with a smile. Franck deserves special mention for his good humor.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Vic-anne
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with my mother and had a great time. We arrived early and our room was ready (always a good start!). Room no 705 on the top floor, spacious with a lovely view of the Eiffle Tower. Breakfast was included in our deal and was well stocked and had a good variety of items which included; scrambled egg, smoked salmon, bacon, cheeses, ham, pastries, cereal, fruit and ,of course, champagne. Location was great, within walking distance of many attractions and metro just outside. Staff very helpful and friendly and would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Koen67
Reviews.Content: Without any doubt the best hotel in Paris I ever stayed in. Rooms are very nice (not very big, but the opposite would be a surprice in Paris, breakfast is nice, no complaints whatsoever. Service is superior : my son got sick during our holidays ; we asked the reception whether there was a doctor in the neighbourhood and within half an hour they arranged a doctor to come to the hotel. Location is also great : a lot of highlights are within walking distance, and a metro station is just in front of the hotel. We had a wonderful time in this place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: FeeFee44
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last weekend for 3 nights. The location is fantastic, I could walk with easy to all the tourist spots you would hope to see in a weekend to Paris. We stayed in an executive room which upon arrival looked like any standard room however the view spoke for it's self and made the room! The hotel was clean, the bed was very comfortable and although the breakfast room as small and the choice wasn't vast, you couldn't ask for anything more from this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely LOVED it!!! One of the best hotels of the 3 we stayed”
Reviews.Author: Tim0te0
Reviews.Content: By far the most professional, helpful and resourceful staff we encountered. The desk manager spoke fluent english, was friendly and knowledgeable about every attraction or event we asked about right down to the what bus to take if using the bus/metro. Breakfast was very well prepared, good quantity, great coffee, staff super friendly and almost every staff member we spoke to had a very good grasp of english so we didnt have to struggle through our broken french. I can safely say their goal was to make every minute of our stay memorable and enjoyable. Located only a 20 minute walk from Notre Dame, Louvre but don't waste your time walking to the Eiffel Tower, a taxi was only 7Euro and well worth it taking you right to the base. Bus 69 will take you there or 63 down to the latin corrider for shopping. Multiple busses are a 1 minute walk to the corner of Rou de Bac. Check the numbers on top of the bus stops along with the maps. Had no problem with the public transportation but note that when they get to the block at the end, there is a 15 minute turn around time. Adapters for power plugs were at the desk and checked out to your room upon request. Free internet although had a problem on the wi-fi strength in our room but plugged into the LAN and BOOM! We were flying! WIFI in lobby excellent and also had 2 computers available for business center. Printer too but did not use it. I had emailed the contact email address about our reservation 48 hours before we arrived and recieved a detailed reply within hours setting us up for a great experience. Cannot say enough about the staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel would sooo return,LOVED PARIS SO SURPRISED!”
Reviews.Author: nylike2travel
Reviews.Content: We came to Paris due to a wonderful ad. The hotel was charming and clean. The location was close to the metro. The hotel came with breakfast which was delicious with much variety .The views from the bedroom was sooo Paris, huge windows, flower boxes soooo pretty. I would return to Paris and this hotel in a heartbeat. The only downside ( it did not ruin our vaca) was that there was not much storage in the rooms for clothes. Both of us used the luggage racks and lived out of our suitcase. I felt for the amount of time we were there it was fine, if we were there for a few weeks it might have been annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Paris was Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: MoeOntCanada
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely.The rooms were very clean but small.Breakfast was included each day.You could even have champagne if you wished.We were able to walk most places from this location.The Seine River t,he Louvre, Notre Dame,The Eiffel Tower, Shakespear and Company St.Chappell just to name a few .Also it was walking distance to th RER station which we took to go to Versaille .A warning though pickpockets are present in the subway stations so guard your valuables.We saw one in action

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in central location with super friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: montyjen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the K & K Cayre hotel with our 16 month old son, my parents and my brother and sis-in-law for my mum's 70th birthday celebrations at the end of July 2011. We met at the hotel on the Friday lunchtime and spent 3 lovely days and nights in beautiful Paris. The hotel was ideally located directly opposite the Rue du Bac metro station - although we didn't actually venture onto the Paris metro as the hotel was close enough to walk to St Germain de Pres/Blvd St Michel and the main busy areas on the left bank. We also walked to La Louvre and from there it's a nice stroll through the tuileries gardens to the champs elysee or along the seine. The hotel itself is boutique in style, with modern decor and immaculately clean. The reception staff were exceptionally helpful and friendly, remembering our room number when we asked for the key (you have to deposit the key before leaving the hotel). It was our son's first trip abroad and whilst we had our reservations about a city break and particularly in paris (which does get a bad rep for how children are received) everyone who worked at the hotel made him feel so at home, ensuring he was settled into the promptly provided high chair at breakfast or talking to him and playing peekaboo whilst we adults enjoyed the tasty continental breakfast. The cot and bedding provided was clean and comfy and the baby slept well each night. Our beds were also comfy and all our rooms on the 5th floor were quiet as they were set off the main rue de raspail. There are a few steps on the 5th floor corridor but we were allocated rooms at a secondary elevator which meant we did not have to navigate the steps with the pram which was helpful - not sure if this was by accident or design but nevertheless appreciated. Cannot think of any negatives, other than I wish we had a longer stay both in Paris and the K & K - was very sad to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: Lynniepest
Reviews.Content: I just can't fault this hotel. The rooms were spotless and the staff totally professional and friendly. I thoroughly recommend the breakfast which had an amazing choice which was slightly varied each day and included wonderful cheeses and cold meats, cakes and pastries, all types of fruit-whole fresh, fresh fruit salad and dried etc. Different breads and spreads, a good range of fruit teas etc.etc (not forgetting the bottle of bubbly). This hotel is in a fantastic position with the metro just across the road. A word of warning if you pop into the petrol station next door to their well stocked shop-try not to walk across the forecourt as it is very slippery. I very rarely stay at the same place twice but would at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and nice service”
Reviews.Author: ronl1
Reviews.Content: K & K Hotel Cayre is a left bank Hotel which is somewhat modern rather than the many typical traditional 3 star hotels you find in the area. I was on business so I was not looking for history or romance but if you are, then this may not be the one for you. The people on the desk are very helpful and indulged my French very patiently and politely and willingly continued in English if it was geting complicated. That was nice. The location is very good as it is in the very heart of the more glamorous left bank area and rignt beside the Rue du Bac Metro on Line 12 which is more than handy for getting around. Breakfast is lovely and the dining room also has a very user friendly feel. They bring you coffee as soon as you sit down and do not have to be chased to refill it. The staff are most attentive. If I have a criticism it was probably with the room which is small (not unusual for Paris hotels and I have stayed in smaller) and a bit spartan, and although it was summer, it was coolish and I found the covers were inadequate. Otherwise it was fine without much romance or excitement.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, simple hotel.”
Reviews.Author: scarlett81
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in the spring and we really liked the location of this hotel. Its within comfortable walking distance to many attractions, yet it located off the path on a quiet street. Its right near the metro entrance which is a huge plus in Paris. It had your pretty basic, simple amenities. Very comfortable beds, of course the typical tiny Parisian rooms. But it served the purpose for a week of sightseeing. The staff could be a bit icy from time to time, but thats also pretty typical of Paris so I won't fault them too much...however it did bother us occasionally. All in all, great location where you can easily access pretty much any area of Paris from.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: londonlover58
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel K&K Cayre Paris in July for six nights. Very convenient location, just across the street from the Rue du Bac metro station. Room was small, but comfortable and very clean. Had small balcony with great view of the city, include Montmartre. Staff was helpful and friendly, and the breakfast was great. This was the second leg of our recent trip to Europe which also included a stay at the Hotel K&K George in London. Our experience was great at both locations. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “French Civility in the Best Neighborhood in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Casablancalily99
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a mother-daughter trip to Paris. This is my second stay at the wonderful Hotel Cayre (the first with my husband two years ago)....both visits here were excellent. The hotel is located in a spectacular part of Paris (the 7eme), surrounded by excellent restaurants and boutiques and a short stroll to the Seine, the Louvre, the d'Orsay, etc. The staff is exceptionally nice -- for non-French speakers, their English is perfect. They are helpful and ready to arrange restaurant and tour reservations, call taxis, and in general, answer any questions you may have. Rooms are impeccably clean and comfortable. The bar area is small and intimate, perfect for a night cap of cognac or champagne. The exercise area and sauna are spotless, and the sauna, especially, is a nice way to unwind at the end of a busy day touring. The breakfast buffet has something for everyone: cheeses, meats, granola, fresh fruits, smoked salmon, yogurts, baked goods, etc., which provides for a lovely start each morning. All in all, an excellent place to stay while in Paris -- I will return here again without hesitation on my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at the best location!”
Reviews.Author: GuiMC
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a wonderful trip to Paris and I must say that Cayre Hotel was part of it. The locations is the best in Paris (I´ve stayed in other locations in other times, and this one is unbeatable), easy walking to almost everywhere and the metro station Rue de Bac is STEPS away, just across the street. The room was big, modern, clean, comfortable and had a nice view of the tour Eifeel and the Dôme (we stayed at room 601). The bathroom was nice as well. Staff at the front desk very friendly too. And the breakfast was delicious, a nice way to start the day! The only problem is the wi-fi connection in the rooms, really poor. ** if you are brazilian, try to book at decolar.com , we got the best price there **

Reviews.Title: “LOVE IT--GREAT LOCATION!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: wiggygailTX
Reviews.Content: Best location for easy walking everywhere. Lots of shops/restaurants right outside the hotel. Also bank nearby and the metro stop directly across the street..so convenient. Rooms are done in super modern theme..very clean and a/c worked great. Would definitely stay here anytime I am in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great service”
Reviews.Author: candicaneadventures
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 6 night stay in paris at the K & K Hotel Cayre and we had a fabulous time. You can not beat the location of this very nice hotel, as it is minutes walk from the Louvre and the Musee D'Orsay and so easily accessible to great attractions and cafes on the Blvd St. Germain and Rue de la Seine. The metro stop Rue de Bac is right across the street. When we booked our trip, we didn't have too many options because we needed a room that would accomodate 3 people and the Cayre was one of the only ones especially as everything was booked up for June. But I was so happy with the hotel and I am usually a fussy person. It was very clean, a great location and the staff could not be nicer and more helpful in english and in french. I especially appreciated all of the great advice on restaurants and tours etc from Jean Pierre and Valentin. All of the men at the desk always had a smile for us and we really had alot of laughs together. A special shout out deservedly goes to Nathan, the bartender, who greeted us every night with a smile and entertained us while we sipped champagne at the bar. He was quite charming! More importantly, however, the room was very clean and although not super big, it was comfortable for the three of us. A desk/ bureau separated the king size bed from the couch/bed where my teenage daughter slept. The room was kept very clean by the lovely housekeeping staff and while the bathroom may have been sort of small, it had ample shelf space for eveyone's toiletries. K & K Cayre is not a luxury hotel, but it is by all means very homey and very upscale. The breakfasts were very good, and always fortified us for the long day of touring ahead so that was a bonus and the coffee was flowing with very polite staff. There is also free wifi in the room and computers are available in the lobby. I would definitely return to the K & K Cayre on my next trip to Paris because as I said, you can not beat the location and the service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: travelerllz
Reviews.Content: Stayed at K&K in mid-June. Nice, clean, modern hotel and in a great Left-Bank location. Did not realize how good the location was when we booked it. Walking distance to Eiffel, Louvre, D'Orsay, Blvd Saint Germain with all sorts of cafes and restaurants. Room was nice, if a little bit tight for 3 women in same room. But worked out fine for the time we spent in it. Good beds, clean sheets. Breakfast was good. Desk staff very accommodating and spoke English. Friendly, helpful. Would definitely stay here again, and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the neighborhood in St. Germain - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: luvsmoutarde
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. You can easily walk to many attractions in Paris like the Louvre, Orsey, Notre Dame, St. Chapelle, Rodin, and Napolean's tomb. If walking is not an option, the Rue de Bac metro is right across the street from the hotel. I also like it because it is in a neighborhood and not a major tourist area. I would say the hotel is a mid-sized hotel, modern in style, very clean with a very nice and attentive staff. Rooms are small but modern and clean. I have to say the staff is exceptional. I would like to name names, but I don't want to leave some people out. The bartenders will come to your room and open wine for you or bring you a glass of wine in a matter of minutes. Same thing if you need and extra pillow from housekeeping. The front desk knows your room key number within one day and haves it waiting for you as they see you coming through the door. All of the staff greeted us with a smile each day and asked sincerely how we enjoyed our day. I would have an afternoon glass of wine with the bartender while my husband napped, and they were so sweet and genuine with me. Even if they hated every minute I didn't know it. Only four seats at the bar. The only thing I would say is don't let the guys at the front desk send you to restaurants that Americans or all tourists eat at. I felt like they wanted to send us to places that they thought that the American might want to go to so I had to be clear that I wanted to eat where locals ate, but I still don't think I got that across too well. Definitely go to La Ferma Saint Simon around the corner from the hotel. The little Cafe St. Germain by the hotel is nice for a night cap or afternoon drink also. Good place for people watching. We also did not have our breakfast included (27 euro per person is high when you don't eat a lot in the a.m.) so we would either walk to the market down the street (opens at 8) and get a pastry and yogurt or La Grande Epicerie, a gourmet market behind Le Bon Marche. What a beautiful place. I haven't been to a place in the U.S. that I could compare it to. Maybe a Whole Foods on steroids. One day we went there and got sandwiches, a fruit cup and some divine desserts then walked to Hotel des Invalides for a tour and picnic lunch, but I think Luxembourg Gardens might be even nicer to picnic. If you love mustard as you can see I do, don't miss La Boutique Maille at 6 Place de la Madeleine 75008. You can also buy several flavors in tubes at the gourmet shop and they are easier to transport. Stop by the Barthelemy cheese shop near the hotel also. Yum.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: philap
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderfully situated hotel convenient for the Musee D'Orsay and the Louvre. We even walked back to it from Sacre Coeur and to Opera Garnier. The metro station is right outside the hotel. The rooms were on the small side but the best aspect of the hotel was its staff. They advised about restaurants, made table reservations and even advised taking a bus to the Moulin Rouge which worked exceptionally well. This was all done in English although they appreciated our stabs at French. No French rudeness here, quite the opposite.

Reviews.Title: “Paris per foot”
Reviews.Author: Schwerdti
Reviews.Content: The Hotel with his beautiful architecture in the centre of Paris invites you to discover Paris per foot. All sightseeings are attainable in an hour.

Reviews.Title: “A little pricey, but comfy place to call home for a few days.”
Reviews.Author: Karakriegs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the K+K for 3 nights and really enjoyed our stay. It is centrally located, very clean, and the service was helpful and friendly. We landed in Paris very early in the morning and we were able to use their sauna room and showers to freshen up. The hotel is pretty modest. It's a nice, modern, quiet place to call home while exploring the wonders of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: MarcieKathyRyan
Reviews.Content: Very nice eclectic hotel. Room sizes are small but comparable to other European Hotels. Great location, comfortable beds and linens. Helpful staff in guiding you as to how to get around town. Metro stop 30 ft from hotel entrance, although Paris metro system is cumbersome and confusing as trains and subways can transverse same stops. Would recommend hotel as its look and feel was very contemporary, clean and safe. Delicious breakfast and fast wifi service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ngozi23
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful. The staff was nice and helpful. The breakfast was delicious every morning. The neighborhood was quaint and charming. The Metro (Rue de Bac) is right across the street. Also, the post office is across the street and an ATM machine. The rooms were absolutely charming and so Parisian. I enjoyed the balcony and the view. The hotel room was very bright and airy. I enjoyed coming back to the room and resting my feet. The bathroom was small...definitely one person at a time. But that's the only issue I had with the room or the hotel. The lobby was inviting. The Internet was free!! Did I say breakfast was delicious? I would definitely stay at this hotel again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Contemporary hotel in an excellent location!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelEL
Reviews.Content: Can't wait to go back. The location couldn't be better, across the street from the metro and around the corner from a cute little cafe. The rooms are tiny, but no big deal. Breakfast was included and very yummy. The bartender at the bar was superb, very attentive for our group of 12. It seemed this is a place many Americans stay, as we heard a lot of English being spoken. The area is full of great little bars, cafes and restaurants. If you're looking for a good tiny bistro try Les Botanistes at 11 Bis rue Chomel about 3 blocks from the hotel. Did I mention the shopping, wow, tiny little stores to Rue St. Germain with all the big names!

Reviews.Title: “Good base for seeing Paris - worth paying”
Reviews.Author: Thebarnhamtwo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and found the hotel to be very well situated. Easy walking to The Louvre & River Seine, a close Metro stop and a selection of cafe's nearby. The rooms are well appointed and cleaned each day. The staff are friendly and helpful. Nice buffet breakfast too.

Reviews.Title: “Don't miss this hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: Papa_and_Toto
Reviews.Content: My wife and really love this hotel. We have been to Paris many times over the past thirty years and so have stayed in many different hotels. We stayed here because we were looking for a change from our last visit, have now been here twice and will definitely be back the next time we’re in town. It is reasonably priced by Paris standards, very clean, and is nicely located on the left bank. The staff is exceptionally friendly; the barman, the desk crew, the concierge, and everyone in the breakfast room in the morning. We booked one of the mid-priced rooms (an executive double) and found ourselves on the 5th floor facing the Blvd Raspail with a nice view and very little noise. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Favourite hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: TravellingEpicurean
Reviews.Content: Over the years I've stayed in upwards of a dozen different hotels in Paris and this one comes out tops for me. Perfect location on the corner of Boulevard St Germain with a Metro stop outside the door and various bus stops close by. Within walking distance of every major sight/attraction on the left bank and about 10 mins walking from the Louvre. Also close to Bon Marche and the Grand Epicerie the best food store in Paris.
