If you're driving (as we did) there is a nearby underground car park (although it's not cheap). Rooms were very modern and had comfortable beds. Room included coffee/tea making facilities with, crucially, free wifi access in the room and throughout the hotel. Service was excellent with everybody willing to speak English. Breakfast was a proper feast with great scrambled eggs, bacon, fruit, cereals etc. All in all a top hotel and one I will return to again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and super friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Lovemygirltime
Reviews.Content: Friends recommended this hotel to us based on the fact that it had triples for my three children and was in a location where we could walk to almost everything. I hesitated because it really seemed like a buisiness hotel rather than a quaint french hotel. I decided to follow their advice and I am so happy that I did. I was so impressed with every one of the guys behind the check in counter. Every time we arrived for breakfast or walked in the front door we were greeted so warmly that they made you feel like you were the most important people in the hotel. They assisted us with meals and tours even when the front desk seemed really busy. After one day they knew our hotel room numbers before we mentioned them as we went to pick up our keys at the end of a long day. The host at the wonderful breakfast was so helpful with our family of five and knew my daughter wanted hot chocolate before she even had to ask. It is the employees at this hotel that made our stay so special. We left Paris to go to Copenhagen and our hotel there was competely different. They need a K and K in Copenhagen!

Reviews.Title: “Another reliable K&K hotel”
Reviews.Author: adanacsim
Reviews.Content: Kudos to K&K management. This is the third K&K hotel we have stayed in and like the others (Prague, Vienna), this hotel offered excellent value and location. For those of you who feel that service in Paris is unfriendly or uncaring (we do not), try this hotel next time. We found all of the staff to be uniformly polite, gracious and helpful. We requested, and were given, a room on the top floor with a great view. It was in the back of the hotel and as a result it was also very quiet. It was spacious by European standards, as have been the rooms in the other K&K hotels where we've stayed. Our only minor quibble is that we would have appreciated a table or shelf in the bathroom to keep our own toiletries. This might, however, have been a peculiarity of the bathroom in our room because we were on the top floor and the ceiling was very sloped.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for seeing Paris”
Reviews.Author: jlnmw
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for its St Germain location and easy walk to the Louvre. Nice quiet street, lots of restaurants in the neighborhood. Very nice and helpful staff. Very nice, clean rooms. Great breakfast. A great base to see Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: MamaFleisch
Reviews.Content: Great find in Paris! Excellent location; small but well-designed room; tasty breakfast; pleasant staff who made great restaurant recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Agree with other positive reviews”
Reviews.Author: tmjm
Reviews.Content: Absolutely agree with all of the positive comments about this hotel. Location is excellent! At the intersection of St. Germaine Blvd, Raspail, and Rue de Bac. About a ten minute walk to the heart of St. Germ, Musee dOrsay, and the Seine. We took the Air France Le Cars bus from CDG to Gare Montparnasse -then a taxi (about 8E) to the hotel. Our room was available when we arrived at 10am. We were on the 6th floor...with a perfect view of the Eiffel Tower - such a wonderful surprise. Our room was a double - be aware that it's two twin beds pushed together and made separately. So if you are expecting a queen or king you will be surprised. Very comfortable beds. Relatively small room but enough for two of us to maneuver comfortably. Doors opened onto a small balcony and very welcome as the room got a bit warm Small bath with shower and nice tub, Nice large towels and heated floor. Very clean. For a boutique type hotel I would have hoped for some premium bath product. Not to be. And be prepared as there is only shampoo, no conditioner. Lovely buffet breakfast complete with eggs, bacon, cereals, breads, yogurt, coffee, juices...and champagne. Nice bar area for cocktails. Don't believe any other meals served beside breakfast. Front desk very helpful and always available. Small fitness room and dry sauna. Internet access just off lobby. Our hotel package included tickets for the Seine tour boat which we really enjoyed.

Reviews.Title: “K+K is "A O.K.!"”
Reviews.Author: mtk28
Reviews.Content: Mu husband and I traveled to Paris and stayed at the K+K. We found it comfortable, and clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The metro and bike rentals are located right outside the door, along with a pharmacy, grocery store, post office, good restaurants and shopping all within a block of the hotel. Free Internet and business center available. The breakfast buffet was great too!

Reviews.Title: “You'll be very glad you stayed at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jacbalt
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located near the St. Germain de Pres corridor on the Left Bank. It has easy access to much of Paris. The Rue de Bac metro is literally in the boulevard median in front of the hotel on the line that goes to Montparnasse and Montmartre. It is walking distance to the Musee D'Orsay and the Quai along the Seine, a few blocks from the tony shops and famous brasseries where John Paul Sartre and friends made their own. If you're interested in the Open Top "hop on-hop off' bus tour (there's a bus stop 1.5 blocks away). We found the bus tour to be a good way to see things we might not have seen on our own. Staff at the hotel were friendly, helpful and enthusiastic to make our stay as pleasant as possible. They went out of their way to help our 83 yr old parent traveling with us in every way they could. They helped us figure out local bus lines, restaurants, etc. You'll be pleased, if the excellent breakfast buffet is included in your stay, because it is a good value in comparison to the price of simply coffee/juice/croissant at a local cafe. It is connected: Internet in the room; wireless in the lobby; 3 computer terminals for use by guests. Overall: The Hotel staff made a wonderful trip to Paris even better for us.

Reviews.Title: “So pleased we picked this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KJHCheltenham
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews and found a great flight+hotel deal with British Airways, we opted for this hotel and were so happy with our choice. As mentioned in many reviews, the location is ideal for exploring all the major sites either on foot or by Metro, St Germain is a lovely area. We found the staff to be very welcoming and helpful and were thrilled when we received an upgrade to the 7th floor where we had a comfortable room made special thanks to the wonderful view of the Eiffel tower. Breakfast suited us just fine, it was included in our deal so we made the most of it. Would definitely return to the Cayre and to beautiful Paris - would love to see it in summer although the lack of tourists in Feb was a real bonus! Btw we had a great dinner at the small Italian "La Bocca della verita, in 2 Rue Sabot" and a lovely albeit expensive pizza lunch at "Pizza Chic on Rue Cassette". I'm vegetarian so struggled with most of the typically French menus . Would recommend you call ahead to book any restaurants you are keen to visit as we missed going to 2 that were on my list due to unavailability (Les Papilles being one of them)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a Paris vacation”
Reviews.Author: ccrevival
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel based upon TA reviews, price, and it's location and was not dissappointed by all three. Ultimately, it was the excellent service we recieved from Raluca, Frank, and Denis that made our stay even more enjoyable. The desk staff provided print outs of maps, phone numbers and times for our dinner reservations they recommended, and our room was ready when we arrived early in the morning. Ever request was answered with a smile, clever joke, and immediate action. We generally prefer hotels with modern furniture and clean lines so we really liked the room they provided us (#201). The bathrooms were small, but were spotlessly clean. We will definitely come back to this hotel the next time we visit and highly recommend them to all Paris visiters.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ang062
Reviews.Content: Hotel was excellent in every way - location, cleanliness, rooms and comfortable beds. The staff couldn't have been more helpful they were very accomodating and put themselves out to help. Even arriving in the very early hours one morning after having taxi problems the guy on the desk was very jovial and pleasant. The breakfast was superb with the option of a champagne breakfast for those who wished! I will definitely return to this hotel if I visit Paris again

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Location, Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: chris_mayes
Reviews.Content: I would Definitely go back without ANY question to K+K Hotel Cayre, We caught the High-Speed Eurorail up from the South of France to Paris and it was so easy to get from the Main Station in Paris to the Hotel (6 Minutes in total) The staff on arrival were just sensational, gave us the opportunity to go straight to the room to recover some energy and finalise some paperwork for our stay later on during the day! The Room was a decent size which had great facilities and excellent room service. The Hotel's position i though was in a perfect location with easy access to everything from the Eiffel Tower (15 min walk), to the Louvre (5 min walk). The City Tour Red Bus Stop was just around the corner as well. The Front Desk Staff's experience and knowledge was just brilliant, always happy to help with everything including even the simplest of things. Nothing was to much trouble and their advice of 'what to do' and 'what not to do' worked well for us. The Hotel provided a great breakfast every morning with a great afternoon / evening bar in the main foyer that had a great menu for food as well as a nice drinks menu. I would highly recommend K+K Hotel Cayre if your Travelling to Paris, brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely stay with attentive friendly desk staff”
Reviews.Author: LaurieLC
Reviews.Content: THe hotels's staff was delightful -- our keys were handed to us each time we walked in -- they were on top of who everyone was. Our dinner reservations were printed out with maps without us asking. The rooms were clean, the beds very comfortable. My niece got food poisoning and was out for the count to 30 hours -- the desk staff was very concerned and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A superb, high quality hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jandg16
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a three nights stay at K+K Hotel Cayre which we'd booked to celebrate our 38th wedding anniversary. Whilst It was our first trip to Paris, we've travelled extensively in the USA, South Africa, Asia and other parts of Europe and I can say quite clearly that the hotel more than lived up to our expectations. We'd booked the stay through Airmiles and when we arrived, we were delighted to find that we had an Executive Room on the 7th floor with a view of the Eiffel Tower and the Eglise du Dome of Les Invalides. Both the bedroom and the bathroom were fine. Some of the other reviews of the hotel have been critical of the staff at Reception. I disagree completely with those reviews. From the moment we checked in through to check out, every member of the Reception team could not have been more attentive: we were addressed by name every time we passed through the Reception area and the team couldn't have been more helpful when we had a problem with a planned visit to the Eiffel Tower (the Tower was closed due to strike action followed by snow/rain!). Also, whilst the breakfast buffet was 27 euros, my wife and I both thought it was good quality (if you're staying in an upmarket hotel and don't want to pay the price, perhaps you should stay somewhere else). All in all, a great property in an ideal location .... yes, there's a metro station immediately outside but we didn't need to use it as we were able to walk everywhere (including the Eiffel Tower, Notre-Dame, the Louvre and Musee Rodin). The hotel is also ideally placed for strolling along the Boulevard St. Germain. I'm sure we will return to Paris in the near future and the K+K Hotel Cayre will be the obvious place for us to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Easy”
Reviews.Author: nycfashionlover
Reviews.Content: Great location, right next to metro and close to every sight seeing place. i have stayed twice in this hotel. Room is spotless. a bit on the small size. Price is high but i would definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique, nice hotel base for Paris”
Reviews.Author: Wolch
Reviews.Content: Traveled with my sister and aunt; my sister and I had an executive room on the 6th floor with a view of the Eiffel Tower, my aunt on the same floor with a view of Sacre Coeur. I was disappointed upon booking to find that we were not on the 7th floor as we were supposed to be, having booked directly, but the rooms are quite nice and 6th floor till had views. Modern, not spacious nor claustrophobic, nicely appointed, and even the beds and linens were comfortable. The bathrooms are even better -- modern shower and sink, heated floors. The front desk tended to be very helpful, and breakfast (included in our package, not worth the 27 Euro they wanted to charge my aunt) was sufficient though nothing special. Internet was free on downstairs computers, and I believe the entire hotel was non-smoking. Noise at night was a bit of an issue -- street noise not wholly blocked out, the in-room heater suffocated us at night and made some non-white noise itself. It's right near the Rue de Bac stop on the Metro and also an easy walk to the populous, popular St. Germain area. K&K was neither overly professional like a five-star Champs Elysees hotel nor overly friendly like a lesser starred hotel might be, but it was welcome respite after hours of walking as well as a nice start to every day. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice.”
Reviews.Author: Steven H
Reviews.Content: First, the staff were attentive and professional making one feel extremely important. The view from the room was spectacular and the location convenient to all of Paris. Would definitely return. It is a special boutique hotel with tremendous staff.

Reviews.Title: “Lobby was fantastic, room was just ok”
Reviews.Author: kevinh73
Reviews.Content: I would say there are not too many pros and many cons about this hotel. I would probably give this hotel a 3.5 stars if the option is available. But since I had to choose between 3 and 4 stars, this hotel is definitely more of a 3 than a 4. First, the first impression of the lobby was good. Everything looked great. Until you go to your room that is.... I read some of the reviews complaining that rooms were tiny. It was alright. Having just came in from Buddha Bar Hotel in Prague, the K+K room was easily half the size. But then again, Paris is a more expensive city so I guess that's to be expected even though I'm paying $100 more per night. The ceiling was average 8' which doesn't help when you have a small square footage room. You would think that a hotel in an old building would easily have 9' ceiling. The photographs on their website made the rooms look really good (like a clean minimalist chic). But in person, it looked almost like a cheap student dormitory. The finishes were really cheap looking. Even the flat screen TV was like 19" or 21"(and 30" TV is so cheap these days!). It was just small. The bed was made of two singles so if you normally sleep on a cal king, it's kinda uncomfortable. Also the bed is really soft. The bathroom was adequate but again, quite cramped. My room had high speed internet but no Wi-Fi. The only place to get Wi-Fi is in the lobby or breakfast room. I had a Ipad so every time I want to use it, I had to get dress and go down to the lobby. The pluses: my room faces the main street but it was quiet. The bathroom floor had radiant heat so it was nice. The breakfast was included and it was fairly descent. Overall, I would not have complained much at all had my room rate being around $200-$220. But it was around $350 so to me, this is definitely not a $350/night hotel hence all the complaints. I would shop around some more if you are looking to pay around $350/night. But if $1 = 1 euro, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff make this nice hotel really good.”
Reviews.Author: IreneMike181
Reviews.Content: Stayed for six nights late October early November 2010 and agree with all the comments posted prior to mine.

Reviews.Title: “I found my favorite hotel!”
Reviews.Author: morelucknexttime
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the K&K Cayre for 4 nights, in a double room on the 7th floor, with the perfect view of the Sacre Coeur. The room is a decent size, (hotel rooms are small in Paris), with a good size bathroom with a tub. The reception desk was very pleasant and helpful in every respect. The hotel has a perfect location. Right accross from the subway station Rue du Bac, there is a post office right accross the street open until 8PM, Le Bonne Marche is a few blocks away. The hotel is a few steps from many restaurants, boutiques, close to the museums and the Right bank. I have been going to Paris 1 or 2 times a year for over 20 years. I loved the hotel and will definitely stay there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: theplanner123
Reviews.Content: Many reviews tell of the location and we agree - it is where you want to be when in Paris. I would suggest taking a different street back to the hotel each time to explore the shops in the area: everything from chocolates, seafood, small grocery store, cafes, great place to get wine and if you look hard enough you will find whatever you need. The staff at the hotel was most accomodating and helped us with all of our needs and made our 15th wedding anniversary so special. We enjoyed opening our large window with a small balcony at night and in the morning to hear the sounds on the street. We would also like to share some of our best eating spots dicovered on our trip. My wife went back for seconds to Le Sarah Bernhardt Cafe at 1 Place du Chatelet for chocolate chaud (hot chocolate w/ steamed milk) with THE BEST whipped cream for our late afternoon hot beverage, hanging out and a nice pick me up. You can also get a great crepe from the shop on the corner connected to the restaurant for that meal on the go. Not far from the Moulin Rouge on our first night we stopped at Le Lux Bar on 12 rue Lepic and received a great welcoming to Paris with enjoyable wine and a most generous plate of cheese and pork that was like a meal for only 10 Euros. After a visit to Nepoleon's tomb we had a nice dinner at a reasonable price at La Source Bar-Brasserie, 49 BD De Latour-Mauborg. The escargo was great and I tried their french favorites while my wife went for the pre-fixed meal. Put on your walking shoes and get ready to explore Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to walk around Paris”
Reviews.Author: gsmcwilliams
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect, central location in Paris to visit all of the major sights. We walked to the Eiffel Tower, Arch de Triumph, Louvre, Notre Dame, Pantheon and Luxembourg Gardens. There is also a Metro station at the nearest corner if you prefer the train. Wonderful and helpful staff! Great buffet breakfast included! Walked to dinner 4 out of 5 nights and ate amazing meals each time.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly perfect”
Reviews.Author: waterden
Reviews.Content: I will add to the praises of all the other guests...our 6 day stay this October was everything we hoped for. The room was ultra clean, nicely appointed, a beautiful street view (Rm 415) and comfortable beds. The staff, to a person, was fantastic. They were helpful, humorous, patient, and knowledgable. Their english was impecable. The Hotel location was fabulous, altho I was very aware that in spite of really putting effort into my wardrobe, EVERYONE on the street looked better than me. sigh. It is a very high end district. It doesnt hurt for your gentleman to throw a sportcoat into his suitcase and the ladies to bring their little black dress along. I've never been to the Ritz or the George V, which are more opulent, but this was as excellent as I would ever need.

Reviews.Title: “All That And More”
Reviews.Author: MsJoyce
Reviews.Content: This amazing hotel is located in the heart of the Left Bank. You can walk to all Paris attractions from the front door of the K&K Cayre. The rooms were clean and spacious - after a long and exciting day of touring Paris the rooms were spacious enought to invite a few friends in for cocktails before going out and enjoying the Paris nightlife. The buffet breakfast was a great way to start the day. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Thank you Denis at the front desk for your help in planning our route and the AMAZING dinner recommendations...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: krep
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel recently for five nights. We just loved it. Hotel is upscale boutique property located in the seventh arrondissement of Paris. Walking distance to Mus du Louvre and the Eiffel Tower. Many other points of interest within walking distance plus the Rue de Buc metro station is directly across the street. Hotel staff was terrific. Wish I could remember all the names but especially Serge and his counterparts at the front desk were especially courteous and helpful. Highly recommend this hotel for your stay in Paris

Reviews.Title: “All good, no negative surprises”
Reviews.Author: David154995
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is ideal with so many main attractions within walking distance and the Metro across the street. Many great restaurants within walking distance also. Very friendly english speaking staff. Internet works well consistently and nice selection of free international newspapers available. Excellent breakfast was included with our room. We booked through Travelocity and had a good rate (I think less than half the regular rate).

Reviews.Title: “How come it's only No 42?”
Reviews.Author: JeffStranks
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4th? 5th? 6th? stay here and it's as good as ever. This time the slight niggle of being on 1st floor (room 120) and so the trains coming and going in the metro station nearby can sometimes be heard. Didn't harm excellent nights' sleep at all, though. Clean, classy, comfortable rooms, excellent service, good location (not many good restaurant really close, but it's not a big deal for me) - I'll keep coming back. And as another reviewer recently said - I'll go back to any KK hotel. There might be 41 hotels higher in the list here, but I doubt there are much better for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Class under fire (literally)”
Reviews.Author: Kerry_NY
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this boutique hotel because of the location in the heart of the St. Germain district. While the hotel is clean and updated the rooms are a bit small (but standard for Europe). Most of the staff was friendly and accomodating with any questions we may have had as first-time visitors. Our stay became extended when the volcano erupted in Iceland and basically left us stranded in Paris. The hotel was extremely accomodating during this crisis situation and assisted with alternatives (although there weren't many) for traveling in/out of Paris. I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone looking for a clean and updated hotel in the heart of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: 4ra
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in a great location within a 5 minute walking to the Louvre. The area is very safe. We walked everywhere at all hours of the day and night to where we needed to be. The metro is right out side the front door. It was clean, bright, quiet with modern and spacious rooms. The bathroom floors were heated, which was a nice treat. The staff were very helpful and spoke english. I travel several times a year and this was definitely a gem of a find. I will be back and highly recommend it for all types of travel with business, family or friends. Try it, you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location-Outstanding Value”
Reviews.Author: tomatx
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Cayre is a fantastic value in an outstanding location. We did a lot of homework before choosing the hotel and are thrilled we stayed there. The staff is friendly and helpful. The room was large and had a magnificent view of the Eiffel Tower. Request a 7th floor room for the unobstructed, above the rooftop, view. The location is walking distance within a 1/2 hour) from many of the city's well known sites: The Eiffel Tower, The Louvre, The Musee D'Orsay, Hotel D'Invalides. We would stay there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay at any K&K hotel, anytime, anywhere”
Reviews.Author: nlgrasshopper
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the K&K in Paris in August, 2010. The staff couldn't be warmer or more friendly. The service was top notch along with clean rooms and hotel surroundings. Quaint restaurant with breakfast included in price of room. Loved this hotel and it's location. I would stay at any K&K anytime, anywhere. PS Found it on TripAdvisor!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in excellent location with excellent service .”
Reviews.Author: Margaret R
Reviews.Content: Who ever said that the french are rude or arrogant could not have been more wrong , the staff at this hotel could not be any friendlier or more helpful . The rooms are lovely and clean though a little on the cosy side . Room is well equipped , our room had a lovely large window that you could open if you didnt want the A/C on and even had heated bathroom floor .....which was well laid out and spotless . Breakfast is lovely and again the staff are always eager to help and serve . The location is great , train just around the corner and convenience store within a few minutes walk . I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in Paris .

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel! Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: sardawg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the K&K for our honeymoon and it was lovely! The staff here are extremely helpful and polite. The breakfast (although expensive) was delicious. The room was very comfortable and cozy. The Rue du Bac metro stop is just steps away from the hotel, so getting around the city is a breeze. We had a ball here and highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Best Paris hotel so far...”
Reviews.Author: luxuryhound
Reviews.Content: We love Paris and visit fairly often. Over the years we have tried a number of hotels with varied success. However we agree that the K +K is our favourite so far. The hotel is very well located - you pop out of the metro at Rue du Bac and there it is right in front of you! There are velib stations nearby too and most tourist sites La Seine, Musee d'Orsay, Louvre etc) are in easy walking distance. The rooms are not huge which is to be expetced in a Paris hotel but they are spotlessly clean and well appointed with mini bar and toiletries - they only lack bathrobes. The bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in when away from home. Our room was on the first floor and yes, we did hear the rumble of the metro as some other reviewers have mentioned, but no it did not keep us awake or disturb us in the night. It is a very faint rumble and, had I not read the reviews onTrip Advisor I may not have noticed it! The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. They recommended two local restaurants one bistro style and reasonably priced and one more 'fine dining' and more expensive however they told us what to expect to pay in both cases. Breakfast is good - bacon and scrambled eggs for the English as well as fresh fruit, yogurt, cooked meats, bread, pastries etc. There is plenty of it and something to please all tastes. There is free internet access in the lobby and the rooms also have internet access. We did not use it this time but there is also a health and fitness suite in the basement of the hotel. We will return to the K + K and may well explore some of their other European locations. It may not be the cheapest option but, as I have learned as I have got older, very often you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Philly2003
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are just back from our Honeymoon in Paris and I had to write a review because I am pretty picky when it comes to hotels. We were at the K+K Cayre for 7 nights and have nothing but high praises for the hotel. We booked the classic room, yes it is small but you are in Paris and we had plenty of room for the two of us. Since we were on our honeymoon they brought us a complimentry bottle of champagne the first night we were there. The staff spoke English, which was extremely helpful since our French was pretty poor. Everyone was extremely helpful and very kind. The room was extremely clean and when we came back mid afternoon, the room was already made up. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel since there is a pastry shop down the street we had wonderful crossiants every morning! The hotel is in a terrific location, we walked to the Orsay, Louvre, NotreDame, Rodin, Military Archive and much more! We rarely used the Metro but the location was just across the street. Many conveniences right there, little grocery store where we bought bottles of water, a wine shop, a cheese shop, a pastry shop, bars, restaurants, banks, everything you'd want in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “So wonderful we've been twice”
Reviews.Author: byrdie50
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in September 2009 on the first night of our honeymoon - booked via Expedia that time for an Executive Double room - it was fantastic and we got a beautiful room on the 7th floor with a view of the Eiffel Tower, and when they found out we were on our honeymoon they sent a bottle of champagne to the room, which was such a nice touch. We liked the hotel so much that we returned to Paris last week for my 30th birthday celebrations for 2 nights, and it was a great experience again. We booked the Romantic Seine package through their website this time, which included breakfast and went for a classic double room - slightly smaller but the bed was so comfortable and we had no complaints at all. Breakfast was excellent, a good range and even champagne for breakfast if you wanted! The staff are incredibly professional and polite. Free internet on 3 computers in the lobby. A 20 minute taxi ride from Gare du Nord for the Eurostar (cost between 20-25 euros each way). Lots of restaurants and cafes nearby - we went to La Petite Chaise - just a couple of minutes walk away, for dinner and that was lovely, 3 courses for 30 euros, beautiful french cuisine in a lovely dining setting, huge portions! I wouldn't hesitate in recommending this hotel. Its not cheap but the quality of the hotel and the staff make it very worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “This was the Best Hotel in Paris I have stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: vinetalk
Reviews.Content: Great service, great breakfast. Great location. Stay on the 7th floor great view. We had the best time because the Hotel was helpful and very very clean. I will return to this Hotel again. The O'Neills.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel--recommend highly”
Reviews.Author: sjanesjohnson
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my 12-year-old daughter--neither of us spoke French--and we LOVED this beautiful, friendly and comfortable hotel! Located steps away from a Metro stop and in a nice, quiet neighborhood, about a 10 minute walk to Louvre, Musee D'Orsay and Tuileries. Room was clean, attractive and comfortable and hotel staff were so friendly and helpful. When I asked a question about a confusing charge from a nearby cafe, the desk clerk offered to walk over to the cafe with me to straighten out the bill. We enjoyed a friendly chat on the way and he helped correct the overcharge. Lobby staff greeted us by name and helped with some confusion over shuttle arrangements. Can't say enough good things!

Reviews.Title: “excellent service, professional staff, outstanding location”
Reviews.Author: Johnnyraincloud
Reviews.Content: One of best front desks I have ever seen. Competent, curteous and multilingual. Everything they say they will do gets done. If you are apprehensive about traveling in Paris and need the support of a front desk that can answer your questions and help guide you on your trip, then this is the perfect small hotel in the best location for you.

Reviews.Title: “Smart, central and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: kewfriend
Reviews.Content: This was a return visit: the staff were a little older but as professionally courteous as ever. The rooms was modern and the double glazing cut out all street sounds. Everything was crisp and clean. Newspapers greeted you for breakfast in the morning which was simply excellent. (We had to wait a few moments for a table to become free.) This is not a cheap solution to Paris, but in the Rue de Bac it has a superb location with 'Bonne Marche' down the road and Rodin museum nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location Ever - Amazing Room with Incredible view for Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: chainmode
Reviews.Content: We chose this boutique hotel for our 1 1/2 week honeymoon getaway based on amount of excellent reviews on tripadvisor.com and the hotel's location in the Saint Germain des pres area. Let me tell you it lived up to EVERY aspect we were hoping it would. Perfect location (literally walking distance to all of the major Paris must-sees: Eiffel Tower (25min), the Military Musee (10min) The River Sienne (5min), The Louvre and the gardens outside of it (8min), all of the major shopping in St. Germain area and Le Bon Marche & the Lafeyette Shopping Malls...the list goes on!). Even better, when you go outside of the hotel, the Rue de Bac Metro Station is literally right outside and across the street, which made it easy to hop on and escape over to Versailles; we even made it over to Paris Disneyland for the day. Word of caution on the Metro riding, make sure you buy the appropriate tickets when switching from the Metro to the RER trains that go outside of the Paris "zones", when we switched to the RER train to get to Disneyland we ended each getting 35euro fines on board for not having the appropriate ticket. LAME! As far as the hotel goes, the staff is incredibly friendly, 90% of them speak very good English and were quite accommodating. The free breakfast buffet downstairs in delicious and we also had it served in-room one morning for a small 3euro fee. Our room was PERFECT! We booked pretty far in advance (+8 or so months out) and had mentioned that we were coming on our honeymoon and would love a good view, and they put us up in room 605 which has a BREATHTAKING view of the Eiffel Tower, the military musee, and the Paris rooftops in the left bank area. We even had a balcony with chairs and a table, which it didn't look like any other rooms had! Very clean room, the bathroom was a little small but still very comfortable, comfy bed, very chic modern decor--in all, the room felt like home, it was very inviting, comfortable, and spacious. Some people on here complained about being able to hear the metro running at night, from our room you couldn't hear anything at all, it was very quiet at night. I could see that maybe if you were staying below the 3rd floor or so, you may be able to hear the occasional rumble, but nothing to lose sleep over. We will definitely be spending another vacation at the K+K Hotel Cayre, it is an amazing hotel and I couldn't thank the staff enough for such a wonderful stay. If you want the best location, ease of access to most everything-Paris, THIS IS THE HOTEL FOR YOU!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel centrally located”
Reviews.Author: JVC1967
Reviews.Content: I'd stayed at the K+K in London a few years before so I had an idea of what the hotel should be like. It was clean, modern and in a great location very central to everything. The breakfast they provide is very good with a variety beyond what you'd expect. The fitness center could use a little work since it doesn't offer much, but it's not that big a deal if you're on vacation. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “So good we booked another night on sight alone!”
Reviews.Author: Ronni68
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel, great location - easy to walk everywhere. Aircon was very welcome in the heatwave and the bed was so comfortable. We had massages organised for us and the breakfast doesn't finish until 11am, so sleeping in was easy! Free internet access in the foyer and in the room (your own laptop). We stayed in the Budapest K+K too, this one was superb.

Reviews.Title: “All we hoped for”
Reviews.Author: HampshirePaul67
Reviews.Content: We had room 719 which is top floor and had the most awesome view of Paris including a complete view of the eiffel tower. Its a clean, smart, and modern. The staff are great and the breakfast is to die for and includes hot and cold. The hotel is situated in probably the best location to visit ALL major attractions on foot as we did. Its about 10min walk to river Seine and louvre and the start of the Champs Elysees, then either turn right and half hour to Notre Dame or turn left and about 40min walk to eiffel tower. We found great places to eat in St Germain Des Pres about 15min walk from hotel, try le Relais de l Entrecote theres no menu just steak which is soooo tender but watch for big ques of French people at peak times they love theire steak and frits!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, small hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: chgofilmfan
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. This is the only K+K hotel I have stayed in but would definitely consider others in Europe. The lobby is nice, not too big, but a couple of seating areas and a small (3-4 barstools a few tables) bar. The front desk workers were always pleasant with one minor exception. The rooms are small (no surprise) but clean, air conditioned with small flat screen. The beds, though low, were suprisingly comfortable. However after all of our walking, eating and drinking, I may have been comfortable on the floor! Bathroom was small but also clean. Only complaint was slow draining tub. Free breakfast buffet was good. Scrambled eggs, bacon, croissants (of course), toast, fresh fruit and juices, smoked salmon (some days) Hotel is in a nice location, literally steps from a Metro station in 7th Arr. ATM's in all directions, restaurants too. Computers with free internet in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Tres Belle hotel”
Reviews.Author: peeks28
Reviews.Content: Stayed there with husband and daughter while visiting daughter in Europe during her semester abroad in Vienna. We also stayed at the Vienna K &K and were scheduled to stay at the one in Prague as well..I don't like a large chain hotel..Was very pleasantly surprised by the boutique style, wonderful breakfasts and amazingling friendly and supportive desk staff. Internet always readily available and Rue Du Bac Metro just outside the door..St. Germain Des Pres is quite charming and so conveniently located to the Seine, Musee d'orsay and the Louvre..wouldn"t think twice about staying here again..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: mugs15
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were very nervous traveling to Paris for the first time, mainly about the hotel after reading tons of horror storiesMy wife and I were very nervous traveling to Paris for the first time, mainly about the hotel after reading tons of horror stories. Out Travel Agent recommend this hotel for American, and it was great. The front desk staff was great, Ralucca, Sergie, and Frank were top notch and super friendly. They really made the whole trip pleasurable. It was right in front if 'Rue de Bac' Metro drop, and in a very quite part of town. Just 3-4 blocks to the Louver, River, 5-6 Blocks to Notre Dame, great walking area. Rooms were spotless, great beds(king), and extremely new and clean bathroom. Room size was not an issue for us. All windows opens for fresh evening air, and hallways where very quite. We actually had to turn down the air conditioning it was so cold. TOP NOTCH... Any complaints are just from winers, who could never be happy.....We talked to many guests who stayed many times at this hotel over and over again. Good breakfast. We will stay here if we go back. MFM.

Reviews.Title: “Clean modern hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: ozitravlr
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in the K & K Hotel George in London a few times some years ago now, so chose this hotel on the basis of those positive past experiences. The location in Saint-Germain-des-Prés was good, with easy access to the sights, and a good choice of restaurants in the area. We got a package “deal” from the hotel website for 300 euros per night which included breakfast, free internet. Our executive room was of course not large, this being Paris, but it was clean and modern. It was on the third floor, but I still could hear a faint rumbling from the Métro, especially in the bathroom. The room overlooked the busy road, but the traffic noise was muted by the double glazing. The breakfast buffet had a good selection of the usual cold buffet items like pastries, fruits, cereals, yoghurt etc, and the staff brought coffee and tea promptly. The only hot items were scrambled eggs and bacon; they ran out very quickly and were slow to be replenished. The buffet opened half an hour late the morning we left, which was inconvenient on a day when time was at a premium. Hopefully this was a one-off – we were never there as early on any other morning (ie when the buffet opened) to find out. We also had an evening meal in the hotel one night when it was too wet and miserable too go out. It was quite acceptable, if not exciting. The reception staff were pleasant and helpful. I would recommend the hotel, but doubt I’d stay there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but not much happening in the neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: tmteach
Reviews.Content: Looked for hotel based on TripAdvisors reviews and this rated high. Got the room with American Express Travel so used points to pay for a night, which helped with the costs. Hotel room for four nights with breakfast was about $1,000 this way. The room was fine- had a wet bar, frig, nice tub in the bathroom (no bidet). Had a king size bed, desk, chairs, two closets. Good storage. Maid service was great. Extremely clean place. Initially, our room smelled like smoke but that dissipated by the second day. Opened the window and let in the good air. Also, Paris was hot, hot, hot and the air conditioning in the room was appreciated! Good internet access in the room and downstairs they had two computers with a printer to make check-in with the airlines easy. Very nice lobby. Three elevators! Art work was mediocre, though. Disappointed by the lack of a valet. No help with luggage into our room or out of the hotel. For this price, really felt that should have been there. They had someone who was dressed in a uniform and looked like a doorman but did not do doorman jobs. Also, appreciated the hotel lending umbrellas during rainstorm to the guests. Breakfast included champagne, fresh fruit, yogurt, cereal choices, eggs, bacon, assorted rolls, cheeses, and lunch meat. Lovely set up with white linen on all tables, newspapers in English, Japanese, German and Dutch. Hotel is literally across the street from the exit to the Rue de Bac metro stop! The hotel is in an area without a lot of things happening in the neighborhood at night. Spent all meals in the latin quarter which was very lively- half hour walk or ten minute bus ride away. (Woody Allen was filming a movie there!) This was the the only negative thing to say about the K+K. My father and his wife were in Paris at the same time we were. They rented an apartment in the Latin Quarter for the same price we paid for the K+K but they did not have a tub. They were there for a week.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ColumbiaMom
Reviews.Content: My family loved our stay at K and K. I spent many hours pouring over reivews before we made our choice, and we couldn't have been happier. My husband and I had an executive room, and my daughters had a classic room. Both rooms were modern, clean and comfortable. We enjoyed the extra space and step out balcony in the executive room, but the classic room, while small, was very nice also. We loved the location on the rive gauche. We walked almost everywhere - the Louvre, D'Orsay, Seine and Tuilleries are about 10 minutes away. Notre Dame and the Eiffel Tower were each about 30 minutes on foot. We enjoyed returning to the lovely neighborhood around the hotel at the end of each day. There are plenty of cafes and shops within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kdmc0408
Reviews.Content: The room was very comfortable & we had a beautiful view from our balcony. The staff was very friendly & breakfast was delicious. Our room was the 'Deluxe'; the king bed was actually two twins pushed together but it was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “great location-pricey”
Reviews.Author: sanlynn
Reviews.Content: enjoyed this hotel for location, safety, room size, clean.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - great location, friendly staff. What more could you want?”
Reviews.Author: Monday_Morning123
Reviews.Content: Our party of 4 thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The rooms were quiet and clean and had unexpected views over the rooftops to Sacre Coeur. Staff were polite and attentive, and breakfast was delicious. The hotel is well-situated for bars and the trendy boutiques of St Germain, and it is a short walk up the rue du Bac to the Seine and the Louvre. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very friendly”
Reviews.Author: MyMichelle78
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel out of 5 different choices that we had, I am glad we chose Hotel Cayre. While many visitors to Paris like to see Musee's, etc. this lovely boutique hotel allows you to submerse yourself in the Paris culture as it is in a local neighborhood, yet you are a short walk, cab ride or metro ride away from all of the main tourist sites. The staff was wonderful, the rooms clean, and the breakfast was very good. The staff was able to recommend several lovely restaurants and direction to boot. I highly recommend and will be staying here again on our return trip to Paris

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: LR060708
Reviews.Content: Clean room, modern, friendly staff. Had a great stay june 2009 for our honeymoon. Room small but better than expected for Paris based on other reviews. Close to metro and store next door. Close enough to walk to many tourist areas. Staff recommended a great restaurant in walking distance (apparently the first or one of the first restaurants in Paris). It was late and the staff called the restuarant to let them know we were on our way and we were warmly welcomed for dinner. It was delicious Breakfast in the restuarant was good, scrambled eggs, cereal, pastries etc

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Valerie R
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel as soon as we walked up from the Rue de Bac metro station. It was right across the street and very pretty. Welcoming lobby and the staff at the front desk were kind, friendly and helpful. Our room (#210) was right off the elevators and across from the main winding staircase (so it was easy to just walk down the two flights instead of waiting for the lift). Large solid doors and double glass french doors out to the small balcony facing the front of the hotel made it quiet... zero issues with the noise level. You can occasionally feel the rumble of the subway but it was minor and stopped running at 1am. Two twin beds put together to form the king bed as is typical in Europe, lots of storage space and a small sitting area was perfect. Bathroom was a little small but still fully functional. Breakfast in the am was perfect and we never had to wait for service. Room was always cleaned while we were away which was nice. Being close to the Metro was perfect. My husband and I were able to take a long walk in any direction and if we were too tired to walk back (me being 5 months pregnant and all...) we would just hop on the Metro and end up right back at the Hotel's front door. The staff was very accommodating and assisted us greatly in our departure to the Charles D. airport outside of Paris central. Highly Recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: eriktheviking70
Reviews.Content: Was booked here during the early rounds of Roland-Garros May 2010. As part of a tour group, I was moved apart from the others due to overbooking at the Hotel Lutetia down the street. [Historical aside: The Lutetia was some kind of HQ/hangout for the Gestapo during Nazi occupation]. No matter, I was perfectly content and at ease during my stay. Saw where Denis was mentioned in another review. He is perhaps the most friendly front desk staffer, but only the midnight guy seemed grouchy. Mostly they were great. The 2 computers in the lobby were a nice amenity, although at times could be hard to get on. The continental breakfast was fairly basic but as others have mentioned, a great way to fill up before heading out for the day. At the breakfast table, I found it helped the staff to just leave my room key facing up on the table in plain view so they didn't have to ask what room I was staying in. And be sure to leave 1 euro per person seated for tip, because the restaurant staff take away your plates and are constantly asking if you take tea or coffee. People are complaining about the size of the room, but nobody is talking about the quality. The rooms are very modern and stylish and the climate control thermostat makes the rooms very comfortable. Again, leave 1.50 euro per day on the bathroom counter for the chamber maid as recommended by Rick Steves travel guru. Be sure to pick up a few of the exquisite panoramic postcards sold down the street at the Librairie Gallimard. The photo artist is Stephane Rey-Gorrez and his amazing work can be seen at steph-rey.com. The neighborhood is fantastic w/ convenient pharmacies, cafes, brasseries and public transit. You can feel safe walking late at night and all the locals will tell you the same. The 7th Arrondissement is very upscale and well-mannered. Pros: Continental breakfast served for several hours daily, attentive staff, internet access in lobby, 2 convenient metro stops very nearby plus bus route on blvd Raspail, daily newspapers in French, English and Espanol. Cons: No "cheaper" fast-food chains in the neighborhood

Reviews.Title: “STAY HERE!!”
Reviews.Author: xntrc2b
Reviews.Content: My two sisters-in-law and I stayed at the K & K Cayre April 17-22--a little longer than planned due to the ash cloud dilemma. What a great place. A perfect location--within walking distance to many attractions and for those that are a little further away, a metro stop right out the door. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, funny and attentive. The rooms are very nice--clean and comfortable. The breakfast certainly got us on our way in the mornings. Don't forget to explore 'behind' the hotel--we didn't discover the charming streets until our last day.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: tevansen
Reviews.Content: We weren't sure what to expect at the K+K Cayre, but got a great deal using my airline miles so we gave it a shot. It ended up being a perfect location and a decent room in Paris. We had a triple room on a low floor. Not much of a view, but we didn't spend much time in the room. Bathroom was small but the space was used well. The people at the hotel were very helpful. Anyone visiting Paris should do themselves a favor and learn the Metro. It is easy, frequent, and you can get just about anywhere in the city in about 15 minutes. That fact alone makes the K+K Cayre a perfect spot -- the Rue du Bac Metro stop is about 5 steps from the front door of the hotel. Breakfast was simple, but good for free. A nice way to start each day since we could fill up without paying Paris prices. The only complaint about the room is that the third bed had almost no cushion at all. Other than that, a very convenient and comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: gmtandfunnydog
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous hotel and location! We had a triple room and were extremely comfortable. Perfect metro access right infront of the hotel. 100% perfection

Reviews.Title: “Small, even by Paris standards”
Reviews.Author: shereed
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights to begin our tour of France. We were traveling with another couple and booked two rooms through our travel agent who never gets anything wrong. She got this wrong, however. The room was so small that we had to pick up the small glass table at night and move it in front of the door in order to access the bathroom. Don't book the rooms at the end of the hall as our traveling companions had the same problem. We looked down on a small alley where the garbage was deposited at night and the noisse and odor drifted up to both rooms. I have stayed in other Paris hotels and have never seen this small of a room. It must have been a closet in a former life.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location & value”
Reviews.Author: Plavis
Reviews.Content: Found hotel to be in the middle of area of interest in Paris while also a quiet relaxing atmosphere and friendly English speaking personnel. Metro access in front and two blocks to Hop On - Hop Off bus stop. Couldn't be better.

Reviews.Title: “would come back again”
Reviews.Author: nycfashionlover
Reviews.Content: stayed twice in this hotel. very clean and nice coutique hotel. great location, next to the subway. if i have to think of one thing to complain that would be: room is a bit small.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel, great location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: JRLWiltonCT
Reviews.Content: The moment we walked in the door we were warmly greeted by the desk staff who could not have been more attentive or accommodating during our stay. I see Jean-Pierre and Serge mentioned in a few reviews and they deserve all the accolades. They were very helpful setting up tours, confirming transfers, giving directions etc. throughout our stay. We found the location great as we liked to stroll the St. Germain and it was within fifteen minutes of the Louvre, Musee D'Orsay, and some great little shops and cafes. We were on the sixth floor and had a great view of the city, Sacre Coeur in the distance, just beautiful and quiet. Very comfortable beds. Breakfast good. As to be expected in Europe rooms are a little smaller, especially bathroom, but certainly manageable. Very happy to have stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Heidi619
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel with such a friendly and helpful staff. They went out of their way to make our stay more enjoyable. This hotel is so close to the Louvre (only 4 to 5 blocks, easy walking distance). Hotel itself was very nice (bathroom has heated floors -- sounds small but was really quite nice.) I cannot say enough about the front desk and how helpful they were. My French definitely needed some work --but I tried and they were so nice and helpful. I definitely recommend staying here based on the staff, location and hotel itself. On Rue de Bac there is a great boulangerie/bakery -- Eric Kayser. They have the best chocolate croissants. The hotel is right across the street from the Rue de Bac tube station as well. Definitely recommend the subway system in Paris, it is quite easy to maneuver and takes you anywhere you need to go. I definitely recommend seeing Notre Dame, probably my fav attraction that I saw in Paris. I could have skipped the Seine river cruise though...not my favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Zuza_Zai
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, Friendly people and awesome utilities!!!!

Reviews.Title: “2nd time here -- that says a lot.”
Reviews.Author: Thincaboutit
Reviews.Content: I like trying new things, so the fact that we stayed at the Hotel Cayre again speaks volumes. The staff is super friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean and "cozy." Okay, they're not big, but I've been in better known, more expensive hotels in Europe that were the same size. They are contemporary and just fine for the amount of time we spend in the room. The breakfast buffet is great, but it's the location that I really love. Right across the street from the Rue Du Bac metro, it's easy to get anywhere. Just down the road from the D'Orsay and the Louvre. A short walk down St. Germain to St. Michel and Notre Dame. Super convenient. I'll probably stay here again the next time we're in Paris!!

Reviews.Title: “OK but too many niggles to justify the price”
Reviews.Author: CarynWaller
Reviews.Content: For me, a 250 per night price tag comes with an expectation of experiencing more than you would from a 170-190 Euro a night hotel. I don’t do breakfast so feel some frustration when there is not an option to not have breakfast and have a reduced rate. This hotel is in my favourite part of Paris, close to St Germain, and I should have been buoyed and able to cope with ‘niggles’ simply by just being there – a city I adore. However I could not and the cumulative effect of the below is I won’t be going back to this hotel unless I have to: It took the receptionist 5 minutes to recognise I wanted to check in rather than watch her surf the internet. A notice in the lift – not mentioned at check in informed me of the hotel would have no hot water from 10.00 a.m. to 9.00 p.m the next day. Of course this was no fault of the Hotel’s, being necessary maintenance work affecting all buildings in the immediate area, but they could have made this known on their web site before I booked and were not prepared to offer a price reduction. My colleague stayed at the Hotel Bonaparte, a few streets away, and when the hot water issue affected him, he was given an entire night for free. The room was perfectly good and the TV seemed to have a few more English speaking channels than French hotels usually do. A small packet of Jeff De Bruges chocolates in the room was a nice touch. Room service food was ok for flavours and quality of cooking but was cold by the time it arrived and expensive - 43 Euros for soup, boeuf bourguignon, water and a diet coke. They had obviously ran out of diet coke so gave me a normal bottle of coke and took the paper off so I would realise it was diet coke. Being a coca-cola addict their efforts failed, the coke was left unopened and the cold food eaten as I was starving. I didn’t have the energy to complain and wait for another delivery. Morning 1: up at 6.00 for early meeting, returned at 2.00 pm - my room was not cleaned. Morning 2: no early meetings, woken at 8.45 by maid knocking & entering desperate to clean. Wi-Fi only in reception, cable access in rooms, both worked well. As you can see, not big issues, so I understand if other reviewers have more positive comments. All staff were pleasant & helpful, however I still felt ‘badly done to’ with a 600 Euro bill for 2 nights (500 accommodation and 100 Euros for drinks and food). Perhaps my expectations are too high for that extra 60 Euros a night and sky high food and drink tabs? 60 Euros should mean more than a few free choccies & extra TV channels & less ‘niggles’? I suspect I will be trying the Hotel Bonaparte next time I’m in Paris on business.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Modern, and Well Situated”
Reviews.Author: surrealus
Reviews.Content: Pluses: The hotel, including lobby and rooms, are immaculate and in great condition. There is free internet service in the rooms and plenty of printing stations in the lobby. The location is very good. The reception staff are fluent in English and very helpful with both directions and French. The rooms include some deluxe amenities: slippers, safe, shampoo, body lotion, soap, nail file. The breakfast, which was included with our room, is small, but of the best quality. It included meats, cheeses, fruits, scrambled eggs, bacon, cereal, tea, coffee, hot chocolate, juices, and many types of bread. We requested and received a quiet room on a high floor. Minuses: This is not a deluxe hotel. They don't reply to emails or queries sent in advance. The gym consists of three machines. And the rooms are small. It was difficult to maneuver in and out of the shower/tub, the space was so tight. The reception staff could be more helpful. For example, we mentioned a place we planned to go for lunch. They said they were familiar with it and agreed it was a great idea. They gave us directions and even told us about how long it would take to get there; however, they failed to mention it would be closed when we got there! (This happened more than once.)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris Hotel in Perfect Paris Location”
Reviews.Author: Floridian007
Reviews.Content: Our second trip to Paris...but first time at the charming and well-located Hotel Cayre. The staff was knowledgable, friendly, and helpful. They willingly and graciously spoke English to us and were happy to help us with our limited French. The staff willingly made restaurant suggestions even though the hotel does have their own. The location was ideal -- the Metro was just outside the front of the hotel. If we did not walk we used the Metro to go everywhere all week. We never used a taxi except for transportation to the airport. We were withina moderate walking distance to the Louvre. The rooms were clean and well-appointed with all the necessary amenities. A helpful pharmacy was located across the street. The best recommendation we can give is that on our next visit to Paris we will stay at the Hotel Cayre again. Sorry that our review is almost a year late, but we felt that our experience was so positive that it would be unfair not to share our opinion.

Reviews.Title: “a very good hotel with great access to many attractions”
Reviews.Author: Billystickers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 140210 for 4 nights, having booked the day before - the Rue de Bac metro is in the street outside. Staff very helpful; modern and clean breakfast area with a good choice of food to get you underway - with champagne if you really need it for breakfast. Our room was at the back of the hotel next to a lift, which is not a problem as they are modern and quiet. Cleanliness of the room and whole hotel was very good. Although the room was small it provided all our needs for a very enjoyable stay. Would recommend it without hesitation

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Gastragnome
Reviews.Content: Travelled to Paris on holiday to spend New Year K&K Hotels are always superb value for money and are neat and clean. Staff at reception were great and helpful ( even thiough we didn't speak French ) and room was fantastic. One negative observation was the Breakfast staff needed an attitude adjustment. As a paying guest, I am not used to being reprimanded by waiters who cannot handle the pressure of a full restaurant. Otherwise a fantastic hotel that is well situated ( near the Metro and within walking distance to all major tourist attractions) and good restuarants/bistros/bars

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Freedomtogo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in some pretty dumpy hotels in Paris in the past, so this time I wanted something nicer, and the K=K Hotel Cayre fit the bill. We asked for a smoking room and were upgraded to an executive room, which was clean and modern with a big window. The bathroom was well-designed with good counter space. The buffet breakfast was excellent. My husband particularly like the lox and champagne. The hotel is located on the edge of the St. Germain des Pres area. Like most hotels in Paris, there was easy access to the metro. There were lots of restaurants in the area and high-end shops if you're in to that sort of thing. The staff was excellent, as well, although try speaking French and they respond in English, so it wasn't a good place to practice your French! We paid $375 USD per night including the fantastic buffet breakfast, and it was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “It's good but not that great!”
Reviews.Author: marwanf
Reviews.Content: The location is really one of the best things about this hotel - it's walking distance from St Germain which makes it accessible to a lot of restaurants and pubs. The rooms however were not that great - I went for the mid priced room and I was a little disappointed as I thought I'd be getting more for my money.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!”
Reviews.Author: Sucheslife
Reviews.Content: While on a business trip to Europe my wife and I scheduled some down time in Paris. Having spent a lot of time in Europe over the last year I was careful to try to find just the right hotel: great location, slightly upscale but quiet and friendly. The Hotel Cayre was the perfect choice. The hotel is located just outside the Latin Quarter. It is convenient to the subway and about a 15-minute walk from the Seine, the Louvre and the Eifel tower. There are plenty of restaurants and cafes in the area. I cannot say enough good things about the Hotel Cayre. This is the best hotel I have encountered in Europe including the major Marriotts in Rome and Zurich. The room was great. I upgraded to an Executive room and it was worth it to have the extra space. It had plenty of space for the 2 of us. The bathroom was well appointed and had a heated floor that was nice in the mornings. The king size bed was great and had comfortable down bedding with lots of pillows. Although on the main drag (Boulevard Raspail just off St Germain) the hotle was unique in that you can get a quiet room but still have a nice view (of the Eifel tower). I am a very light sleeper. Our room was on the 6th floor and very quiet. The staff was impeccable and fluent in English. Everyone we encountered was always friendly and helpful. They recognize you. There was no indifference on the part of any staff members (as you encounter in some establishments). There is some debate among travelers about the desired language skills of the staff. Some travelers want to immerse themselves in French but I have stayed in hotels where English was not even the second language and it can cause some problems. While in Paris, if you don’t speak French you will find it important to have a hotel staff that does. The restaurant was very good. We ate every breakfast there over a 4-day stay. It is open for a buffet breakfast and carried the typical European fare as well as scrambled eggs and bacon. They open early and stay open until 10 or 11am. Thereafter, they can serve on an as-needed basis and handles room service needs. The bar is small but very functional. In-room internet is free. The TV has plenty of English-speaking stations so you can catch up on the news if you want. This is best hotel I have stayed in in Europe and it will be my first choice in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: bcarma
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at this lovely hotel. Front desk staff always had a smile and were genuinely helpful. The location - in St. Germain de Pris, is excellent - very close to the Musee D'Orsay and surprisingly close to Louvre and Tuleries across the river. Our interior room had no view (none expected) but was very quiet as a result. The rooms not big but fine and well appointed. Would definitely stay there again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: karimonique
Reviews.Content: My mother, sister and I stayed at the K+K over the Christmas holidays. After the airline lost all our luggage the staff was so accomodating. We had a triple room. It was very large. The staff was helpful with everything. They made sure we had anything we needed and were very helpful with directions. The location of the hotel was wonderful. We were close to the bus stop that went to all the sites. When the airline delivered my mom and sisters luggage and informed me mine was not arriving, the staff promptly helped me locate stores for clothing and necessities. The trip to Paris was not the best but the staff at the K+K should be applauded for their excellent customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but good quality and an excellent location for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: mark_ncompass
Reviews.Content: More than we would normally spend but the location, walking distance to main sightseeing areas, makes it well worth while. Friendly staff, good rooms & service, but no parking and expensive (& crowded) breakfast. The Rue de Bac metro station entry is right outside the door (see pic) and its about 5 mins walk to Musee de Orsay across the Seine from the Louvre. Overall it was worth spending the extra to be so central.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel for tourists in Paris”
Reviews.Author: DandDToronto
Reviews.Content: There is nothing very French about this hotel (I suppose you would call it "international" in style), but for tourists to Paris it is an excellent choice. The location is very convenient and the hotel rooms and facilities are of a high standard. The staff are helpful and pleasant to deal with.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pasquali56
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed five nights and loved this hotel. Although the room was small, we know that's typical for Paris -- so no big deal. The location is ideal, the place is meticulous inside and out, the breakfast buffet is excellent, and the staff is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mimimormor
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in a convenient location, walking distance to Louvre and Bon Marche department store. At the time we were there, we had to drop off and pick up our room key from the front desk (kind of inconvenient especially when they are busy serving other customers). Other than that, everything else was up to our expectation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: LindaPArizona
Reviews.Content: I recently visited Paris and had the good fortune to stay at the K+K Hotel Cayre. The place was immaculate and the staff was outstanding. Unforunately, my husband suffered a fall while on vacation and had to be hospitalized. The wonderful employees of this hotel showed great concern and did everything they could to offer assistance to my husband and me. This was a most difficult time for me and the hotel staff made me feel like their hotel was my home away from home. I am so grateful and look forward to visiting Paris again in the near future. This hotel will be where I stay, for sure. The location is great, breakfast is wonderful, staff helpful with sightseeing directions, staff friendly and can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, friendly hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: avic999
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was clean and fairly modern. The room was adequate if a little on the small side but as we spent most of our time out and about, the size didn't really matter. The TV channels were fairly limited and the Wired internet in the room wasn't compatible with our netbook for some reason, but there is a business centre near reception so we used the PC's there. The room was cleaned every day and was very quite at night. The Staff were very friendly and only too willing to help with directions or other information. We had booked an evening dinner cruise on the river and would have left far too early if one of the staff hadn't told us when we asked him to book a taxi. Breakfast was included and was o.k. with a fair selection of cereal, fruit, cold meats, and cooked food but some mornings they seemed to run out of hot food quickly. We didn't eat at the restaurant as it was quite expensive and there were a lot of places to eat nearby. For us the best point was the fact that the metro stop was just outside the Hotel - VERY convenient !!!! The Hotel is within easy walking distance of the St Germaine area with lots of (expensive) shops and there were some lovely cafes along the back streets. We would definitely recommend this hotel and will stay hear next time we go to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmyParker
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Paris a few days ago and we stayed at K+K Hotel Cayre for a week. I had previously stayed at the hotel two years ago. The top-notch service had not changed. We upgraded our room and we received a great room (#507) with a balcony. We had a decent view of the top of the Eiffel Tower. Our room had an American electrical plug, so I did not have to receive my converter or adapter. The beds are so comfortable (many of my family members commented on that to me). The hotel staff did everything we asked of them. I had a package delivered to me and it arrived a day before I did. They held it for me and it was waiting for me when I arrived. My main form of transportation was the Metro and the fact that a metro stop was right outside the hotel was perfect. If you deal with stairs, then the metro is for you. We did three walking tours with Richard Nahem and we had a great time with him. He showed us things we probably would not have seen otherwise. Some of my family and I went on a wine tasting tour with Donna Morris one evening. Here is her website: www.bestfriendinparis.com. We visited three cavistes and had three bottles of wine at each place. It was fantastic. We had a nice progression of wines from the bubbly to the deep red (last stop). Donna is very easy-going and entertaining and provides a glimpse of how the local Parisians buy and drink their wine. I would definitely do Donna's tour next time I visit Paris. Other notable places my family and I visited were La Duree (their tea is great and they have the best macaroons - even over Pierre Hermes), Angelina's (great hot chocolate), and Le Petit Zinc (great duck). I can't wait to visit Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “NIce place to stay - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AJW40
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from a wonderful stay in Paris. We had a double executive room (40!) which was a nice size. Everything is modern & clean. Staff very helpful and breakfast was really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, okay Location, small bathroom, annoying water noises”
Reviews.Author: benjin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a long weekend in Paris. The hotel itself is lovely. The room was well-sized, nicely decorated, clean, and comfortable. The air conditioning worked great. We were on the first floor, northern side of the hotel with large windows opening up onto a quite street. The breakfast was fine. I wasn't crazy about the location. It is within a short walk of the Musee d'Orsay and the Louvre and there are some restaurant choices nearby, but the neighborhood is really quiet and boring. I really wished that we had stayed in a more central, lively area. Also, though there is a Metro stop right by the hotel, it's not on a particularly useful line - you always have to make a transfer to most of the tourist spots and to Gare Nord. The bathroom had nice, modern fixtures, and the shower was great - but it was really tiny. Definitely only one person at a time. We could hear noises all night whenever anyone above us flushed the toilet or took a shower. I'm a heavy sleeper, so it didn't matter much - but some people would find it very annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Chic and Style”
Reviews.Author: andricScotland
Reviews.Content: This hotel exudes Paris chic and style. The hotel is not furnished in a grand way rather it is classically modern, decorated in lovely calming colours. The location is ideal, close to all the major attractions, but set in a ritzy part of the city surrounded by many fine restaurants. The service in the hotel is fast, efficient and polite, without being invasive. Our room was on the top floor at the rear of the hotel. We could not believe our luck as we had uninterrupted views of the Eiffel Tower. The compromise is the low roof space, being an attic style room. The breakfasts had all the usual fair, but were of consistently high quality. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: dentalexel
Reviews.Content: I just stayed for one week at the hotel. We had two rooms. one room for my wife and I and the second for my teenage kids. We loved the location of the hotel as well as the great front desk staff. We found everyone to be very friendly and efficient. The location was great for getting around Paris. The rooms were spacious by Paris standards and very clean. i would stay here again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very friendly, accomodating staff, wonderful rooms.”
Reviews.Author: bellbookcandle
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel!! I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone for the friendly staff, great location and very nice rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: benjiMaine
Reviews.Content: The reviews of this hotel have been right on. Great location, staff was great, breakfast worth including with room. It was very hot while we were there and the air conditioning worked great, our first room was a bit small for the two of us, but they moved us to another room no problem and we just loved it. We wished that we could have stayed longer. Would go back there in a heart beat and could stay for a week or more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, fabulous staff.”
Reviews.Author: cookiemonster32
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights for our 10th wedding anniversary. The hotel is right beside the rue du bac metro stop so very convenient. Its also very close to the Musee d'Orsay which is definitely worth a trip. The staff were very friendly and helpful from the moment we arrived and we were delighted when we got to our room (a standard room) as it had a view from the balcony of the Sacre-Coeur. The room was small but nicely decorated with a comfortable bed. The bathroom was again small but clean and nice looking. There was no street noise even though we faced onto the street but we could hear the metro a little, as we were on the 6th floor it wasn't bad (and didn't affect our sleep in any way). The concierge were very friendly and gave us good restuarant recommendations, booked meals and concert tickets for us. Breakfast was good (but get an inclusive rate, its not worth what they charge if you are room only) with cereal, toast, continental style, fruit, eggs and bacon. The gym was disappointing - a cross-trainer, bike and a rowing machine that didn't even seem to work properly. But the sauna was nice. On our last day we were allowed to go down and use the showers in the gym before heading to the airport for our evening flight, which was lovely as we were hot and dusty after a long day walking around. Overall we were delighted with this hotel which helped make our anniversary trip very special.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pondyandlil
