Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in August 09, and were so very impressed with the place from the moment we walked through the front door. Large marble lobby with a bar in the corner and plenty of comfortable sofas and newspapers, even coffee. We had a deluxe room on the 5th floor with a balcony, and we were extremely impressed with the cleanliness in the room. Although the bathroom is not huge, it is delightful. Sparkling marble finish and shelves for your personal items. The bed is king size and very comfortable. The staff deserve special mention for their helpfulness and friendliness, even their sense of humour. Breakfast could not be faulted, and the coffee came fast as soon as you drained your cup. The waiter had coffee in one hand and hot milk in the other, which made for a perfect cafe au lait. Absolutely recommended for anyone coming to Paris. A word of caution though about Paris. Many small businesses and cafes close during August because of school holidays, and sometimes the streets can seem a bit desolate. So best to book in July or September to experience the true vibrance of this gorgeous city.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing choice”
Reviews.Author: kim_memphis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our 16-year-old son. Apparently it was one of few hotels in Paris that offer a triple room. We selected this hotel after someone recommended the K&K in Vienna (we stayed there on this same trip and it, too, was awesome). We could not have been happier. The hotel was lovely and extremely clean, the staff was fantastic and the location could not have been better. I had read some reviews that expressed concern with the sound from the subway stop right across the street, but it didn't bother us at all. The one night I could hear the trains it was actually quite pleasant. I still have to pinch myself to realize that we stayed at such a lovely place on our first trip to Paris. If we ever have the chance to stay in another city -- or even Paris -- with a K&K, we will definitely try to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: amalaPrinceton_Nj
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Cayre for 4 nights. The hotel was excellent as was the staff. The rooms were decent sized for Parisian standards and the AC worked well. the rooms were also very clean and we were frequently asked if we needed anything such as towels etc. The wired internet connections worked well although it would be great if the hotel was wireless. Business center was also supplied with printers etc. Take your own wire as both wires in our rooms were not working. Breakfast was also excellent and included cereals, eggs, bacon, lots of breads, cheeses, pate etc. Fitness center is small but has a bike, elliptical and a rowing machine. Opens at 7:30 which is a little late. front desk staff were all uniformly helpful. their advice for restaurants etc. was very good. Only drawback is that the location of the hotel is not on a direct Metro line to many museums and attractions. but it is right next to a stop and you can transfer within one or 2 stops. Also walking in the area is great. Lots of stores and cafes. we will definitely stay again if we go back to Paris

Reviews.Title: “Just brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: UsuallySunny
Reviews.Content: This was a superb hotel - I can find no faults, and we had an amazing stay with no problems whatsoever - in fact it was better than that! Staff were wonderful, food was delicious, room was perfect, location was ideal and we will definitely visit again, with no hesitation. Aircon was brilliant, everything was very clean and fresh, the room overlooked the street, which I loved, as I enjoy listening to the Parisian streets waking up in the morning, but the main road here is surpisingly quiet - maybe because it was August. The courtyard is being revamped, but this didn't affect our stay in any way. It was very quiet and relaxing. Definitely one of the best!

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: SnoopDogg09
Reviews.Content: Being our first time in Paris,, we didnt know what to expect. K&K hotels exceeded our expectations. The location is great, in the St Germaine neighborhood, a short 10 minute walk from the Lourve. The metro is located right outside the hotel. The staff is very friendly and the rooms are very modern and clean. There is wired high speed internet access in the room that is fairly good. The rooms are a little bit on the smaller side though. Make sure you get the rooms with the free breakfast included. This saved us a lot of money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: zorgobo
Reviews.Content: The location was great. The staff was top notch - attentive to all our needs, friendly, and ab above all, patient. I don't think we could have done any better in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: NYTravelcritic
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a 1 week trip to Paris. It was centrally located and across the street from the Metro stop. Convenient to resturants and the local grocery stores if you want to eat cheaply. Very helpful and multilingual staff. Breakfast was ok-after a week of eating the same thing, you wanted to venture out to eat something else. Would definitely stay here again. Room was comfy if not small, mattress was a little stiff but it is Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Small room, awfull view”
Reviews.Author: eMBieAntwerp
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean hotel with very professional staff that spook good English, but felt very business like and cool. Very disappointed about the size of our room (707) and view (see pictures); We payed 512€ for 3 nights and received a so called double standard room, we think this was for sure a single room in which they have put an extra pillow !!! Size <2.5m x <3.5m, small corridor not included. The view was awfull ! 2m from antoher building with a scaffold against the wall with construction workers running up and down, not quite wat we expected, no, can do better for this money, even in Paris !

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: chicago12chicago_IL
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week long stay at the K&K Cayre. Overall, the hotel was great and would not hesitate to stay there again when we return to Paris. We booked through the hotel's own website so had breakfast included. We had asked for a nonsmoking room and was initially assigned to a room on the 7th floor but had to switch to a room on the 4th floor after the first night because the ceiling was sloped in bathroom in such a way that my 6ft husband was not able to comfortably fit in there without fear of hitting his head! After explaining the problem, the hotel moved us to the 4th floor the next day without any problems. Paid for a "classic room" which was the basic room, had a queen size bed, clean bathroom and free internet service in the room. It was not WiFi but had a cable hook up, wasn't the fastest connection but it worked. Large breakfast buffet was convenient on the days we woke up late and wanted to just eat and get to site seeing. Location was great, was able to walk to the D'orsay in 5 min, Louvre in 10 min and eiffel tower in about 15 minutes. Metro stop was right across the street. Everyone who worked at the hotel spoke good english, were very polite and pleasant. We walked back to the hotel almost every night after midnight and felt safe. Great place, will stay there again if we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “good but ripped us off with bill for minibar once home which we hadn't had”
Reviews.Author: scubadUk
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel - fantastic location - nice staff......but Got bill once home for minibar things which we hadn't had -we had already settled our bill and drinks etc - this had aleady been charged to our card before they even wrote to us- I rang them and they were completely disinterested and said that I must email them with my concern. I did and they never bothered to respond to any of my emails - obviously this was a way of getting me off the phone rather than trying to sort it out. It was only 15euro for a whiskey and an orange juice but it was the principle that we hadn't taken them and they ignored us and charged the money anyway. S hame as we had a good time but wouldn't go back there as would be worried that more mistakes on their part would cause them charge us for things which we couldn't then dispute. Shame as we had had a great time but wouldn't go back after this -

Reviews.Title: “Loved the K &K - would return in a heart beat!”
Reviews.Author: where2gonexttime
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the K & K during spring break with my mom and teen daughter. We’ve travelled together before and have learned that we are most satisfied with clean, modern hotels with lovely bathrooms, plenty of space and access to the major sights. K & K delivered on all this and more. Our room, a triple on the 3rd floor, had plenty of room to house our large suitcases and abundant clothes and shoes (three women, you see!). I brought some extra hangers, and with the ones provided by the hotel, our clothes were easy to access either hanging or folded on the shelves in the closet. The clean bathroom had 3 shelves where we each stowed our toiletries. The bathroom itself was lovely – natural stone, pretty fixtures and a great shower/tub. The three twin sized beds were comfortable with feather beds (can’t remember if they were actually down or if they were synthetic) and an abundance of pillows. Each had a lamp, for reading, post card writing etc. The room was a good size – not huge – but spacious by most “city” standards. There was a TV with access to British Channels. The front desk staff was extremely knowledgeable, friendly, and polite. Their English was perfect, yet they allowed us to practice our “not very fluent” French. They helped us plan, prioritize and sequence our sight seeing – advising us on public transportation, tickets, crowds, dining, and other insider tips. There advice was on the money. We loved having access to the computers in the lobby and business center. We were able to keep in touch with family and friends while waiting for our roommates to get ready. The Rue de Bac Metro stop is outside the door; there is a bus stop across the street. Although we are not regular users of public transport, we found the system easy to use and convenient to most sights. The staff helped us map our trips, and was already with a street and metro map to help guide us. We loved being so close to the River, Musee D’Orsey and Louvre. We enjoyed breakfast most mornings next door at the Café St. Germain. Wish I could find the wonderful bread and jam at home! I would return to the K & K in a heartbeat. It is a topnotch hotel in one of the most beautiful cities in the world.

Reviews.Title: “clean and modern but lacking old charm”
Reviews.Author: 4mirfboys
Reviews.Content: After an overnight flight with no sleep, we took a restful nap in a very cozy, comfortable queen-size bed. Great comforter and pillows. The room darkening blinds were very helpful. Room extremely clean, but tiny as was the bathroom. We stayed here for 5 nights and had fresh, plush towels everyday. (a nice surprise). This was our first Paris trip and had the best time of our lives, although we were almost pickpocketed (in broad daylight outside the Rue de Bac metro). Since we wanted to see everything, we walked everywhere or took the metro (across the street). I recommend the Paris Pass if you want to experience everything. It included most sightseeing and unlimited metro/bus. Favorites were Eiffel Tower, Louvre, Army museum, wine tasting, cruise on the Seine and the Rodin. The Shell gas station next door great for snacks and drinks. Although the hotel was comfortable and convenient, it was pricey. Did not include breakfast. We found a great cafe on Granelle (few blocks away) for breakfast. Rick Steve's book was very helpful-unfortunately found out about the book after we booked the hotel. We found great cafes for dinner at Rue de Cler. We were drawn to the area and returned there many times. There were more positives and negatives. We were happy with the hotel but I wanted more Parisian charm. The hotel was very modern in style. Our room was on the 6th floor (609) overlooking the boring courtyard and plain walls. I requested a room with a view (even streetside would have been nice) but would have cost more money. Not worth it since we were barely in our room. As for the noise, it was very quiet. Barely felt the rumble from the metro. What a beautiful city!

Reviews.Title: “Very Positive Experience”
Reviews.Author: bls60
Reviews.Content: First trip to Paris, so I don't have much to compare but we had a great stay.Location is excellent-metro stop outside the front door and short walk to Orsay Museum. Had connecting rooms with our 2 teenage daughters which was nice.Breakfast buffet very good, staff bilingual and very helpful.Daughters were able to get milk for cereal from the front desk one night after midnight - nice touch.Great base camp for Paris exploration.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable hotel, perfect location, and great views of Eiffel Tower!”
Reviews.Author: 2UDFlyers
Reviews.Content: We chose K+K Cayre - for our first trip to Paris - after reading other reviews on Trip Advisor. We arrived in Paris via the Eurostar from London, and had about a 20 minute taxi ride to the hotel. The following items made our stay wonderful at K+K: 1. The staff were friendly, knowledgeable, and greeted you every time you passed their desk. They gave us recommendations for cafes and ordered taxis (which were always on time). 2. We were given 2 vouchers for a free glass of champagne at the hotel bar. 3. Our room, on the 7th floor, was surprisingly roomy and had a fantastic view of the Eiffel Tower. We sat at our window with a glass of wine every night to watch the Eiffel Tower light show. 4. The breakfast - which was included in the price of our room - offered a variety of food (from eggs and bacon to cereal and cheese). 5. Above all, the hotel is in a perfect location. Many of the major attractions are within walking distance and the Rue de Bac metro station is in front of the hotel. We would recommend this hotel to all first-time and repeat visitors to Paris. While we didn't request a room with a view, it is worth asking.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: flatbstanley
Reviews.Content: We greatly enjoyed our stay in this hotel. The rooms are pretty large and were quite clean and comfortable. We didn't care for the bedding, though, because the only covering was a thick down comfortor--no regular sheet or blanket. The restaurant downstairs offers an excellent (complimentary) breakfast, as well as some good, traditional French dishes for lunch or dinner. The location is fantastic--a beautiful neighborhood, almost all of the major sights within a 20 minute walk. There is also a Metro station less than 5 minutes away. For the most part, the staff was helpful; however, one concierge was extremely rude to us. When we requested hypoallergenic bedding, he essentially scolded us for not having notified the hotel at the time we made our reservation. This man continued to belittle us for the rest of our stay. This hotel is part of a European chain, and it feels like an American Hilton or Marriott. Those looking for a charming, off the beaten path place may want to look elsewhere. However, we found it a comfortable hotel in a good location that offers decent value.

Reviews.Title: “A few things we learned made our second stay even better.”
Reviews.Author: Voyager45
Reviews.Content: We'd heartily agree with all the favorable reviews we've read of this fine hotel. We found the hotel was even better the second time around. Three years ago, we had a standard room, which was good but a bit cramped. This time, we reserved an "executive room" and found the extra space made a significant difference that was well worth the relatively modest extra cost. (Oddly enough, the larger room had a smaller bathroom, but it was still OK.) The first visit, our room faced a quiet courtyard, which we assumed was essential as the hotel faces fairly busy streets. On the recent trip, we were assigned a room facing the Rue du Bac. At first we thought we'd have to ask for a room change. But -- surprise, surprise -- the soundproofing was extremely effective. So we had a very cheery light room (401) with a pleasant view of a charming street. Rooms facing the busier Boulevard Raspail conceivably might be noisier, but we're told they're OK too. One reason is that while the Cayre looks like an old hotel, it is actually a comfortable modern hotel built within the shell of an old hotel. Among other things, the air conditioning is effective and quiet. The modern decor is quietly elegant. Though our bathroom could have been bigger, it was quite up-to-date. The hotel gave us a rubber mat for the tub, which was quite slippery. We reserved our room on the hotel's Web site, which offers packages that the hotel says are available only on that site. Our rate included the pleasant buffet breakfast. It defintely pays to get this deal as the breakfast would be quite expensive on its own. As in the past, the hotel's service was efficient and friendly and the location is as good as ever. Of course, there is no shortage of excellent restaurants in this expensive neighborhood and beyond. But when you are trying to recover from the 100 euro "lunch special" at Guy Savoy -- worth every centime by the way -- you can eat cheaply within a few minutes of the hotel. With no pretense whatsoever, Cafe Flores on the Rue du Bac and Le Bizuth headed toward Saint Germain des Pres on the Boulevard Saint Germain serve very adequate standard fare at decent prices. Pleasant waiters too. We will defintely return to the Cayre.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Highland123
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect hotel for our first trip to Paris. We spent 4 nights here and were extremely pleased with our decision to stay at this hotel. The hotel is in a great central location in Paris with a Metro stop conveniently located across the street. The rooms were clean and comfortable, a little on the smaller side, but this is expected in most large cities. The staff at the front desk was courteous, helpful with suggestions, and spoke fluent Engilsh (which was helpful as our French vocabulary was limited). Breakfast was included in our room rate and was very good as well as the service in the dining area. Additionally, as others have mentioned, there is a Shell station just down the street which was perfect for picking up things such as drinks and snacks for the room. All in all we had a wonderful time at the K&K Cayre and would certainly consider it again on future trips to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - great location, friendly service, broadband”
Reviews.Author: terraGirlUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights & had an excellent stay. Key points: Fast broadband in the room; Very friendly staff - English not a problem, you're really well look after; Great Location on the Left Bank Side next to Metro with Pharmacy, Shops and Bistros around the corner. The room we had was great - large bed, enough room for 2. Everything was modern, clean and good quality. TV in English, German and Italian. Excellent air-conditioning. Hotel is right next to Metro "Rue Bac" - very easy to get around, and so central you can also walk or take a short taxi ride to most locations. Breakfast is great - good selection including champagne! Breakfast is until 11am or 12noon on weekends. If you book online you usually get a free breakfast thrown in. Best booked directly via company website for best rates & included breakfast. Our room faced Rue Bac - when open you got a nice feeling for Paris life, when closed it was really quiet - perfect. You do hear the metro a bit - but we were on the 4th floor so just a distant rumble and metro does stop at 12.30am. I know some reviews remarked about the lack of Parisian charm - but we needed broadband & good service which this hotel delivers in spades. Also 2 PCs in lobby if you just want to check emails. Personal tips: macroons are heaven (there's a patisserie around the corner). Bistro on the corner is friendly and good value. Going from hotel to e.g. Louvre is around 6 Euros by taxi and it's around 15 Euros to Gare Du Nord.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Mewsic
Reviews.Content: The hotel is completely modern and up to date. It’s furnished with Scandinavian type furniture (clean, plain lines) and neutral colors (grays and beiges) and would be interchangeable with any well-appointed modern business hotel, i.e., there is nothing “French” about it. My “classic single” room (518) was average for Paris but made good use of it space. The bedroom had two twin beds (pushed together), and closet and desk space ample for a single person. The high speed internet connection (at no additional cost) was reliable and fast. The room faced the inner courtyard, which means there wasn’t much of a view, but it was very quiet. As it was on an upper floor, it got plenty of natural light. The bathroom was spotless and well lit. An unexpected pleasure were the built in shelves in the bathroom that provided a large amount of storage room. The housekeeping in both my room and throughout the hotel was excellent. Try to get the breakfast included in the room price. The breakfast is the usual continental (bread, croissants, etc) plus eggs and bacon. Nice effort and the food was good quality. What raises this hotel to outstanding, though, is the quality of the front desk staff. No matter what time of day I talked with them or what I asked of them, they cheerfully and efficiently handled anything I needed. They are world-class professionals. This staff is what will keep me coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Better Location”
Reviews.Author: Bhops
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, with excellent location in charming neighborhood. Our room was tiny, with somewhat boring view into interior courtyard, but we weren't in our hotel very much anyway, and I'm sure there are better rooms. Hotel entrance is about 200 feet from metro stop. Only a few blocks from Musee D'Orsay.

Reviews.Title: “A trip to remember - for all the right reasons!”
Reviews.Author: Kirstigirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the K+K Hotel for two nights in December. My partner asked for a room on a high floor when booking for potential views of the Eiffel Tower. They said they would try their best but couldn't promise anything ( which is understandable) so we didn't get our hopes up. When we arrived at the Hotel the staff were as friendly as could be, and they supplied us with maps and information about Paris without us even having to ask. Our room was located on the top floor as we had asked, so we were extremely happy about this. The room itself was perfect! It was immaculately clean and tidy, as was the bathroom. It had a large window which you could open fully to appreciate the view, unfortunately for us not of the Eiffel Tower, but still a lovely view nonetheless. The room wasn't the largest I've ever seen, but we did extensive research before and found that the main complaint about Paris is the size of the Hotel rooms, and our was adequate for us; I'm sure it could have been much smaller! On the first night we ate in the Hotel and the food was superb; I couldn't wait to sample the breakfast! This was just as wonderful; it was clear that all of the food was fresh and even now I still crave the smoked salmon! We didn't have too much time to use any of the other facilities apart from the Sauna which was great! Again, it was all clean and well looked after. The Hotel's location worked well for us. It was opposite a Metro Station, but also a lovely short walk to La Seine, and then from there we could walk to see the sights. The Staff in the Hotel could not be faulted at all. We asked them to recommend a Restaurant for us, which they did, and it was by far the best meal we've ever had. They listened to what we wanted and kept within our budget which really helped. This Hotel is a little more expensive than what we would usually pay out for, especially as we weren't there that much, but it is most certainly worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly and very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: lunaine
Reviews.Content: Very centrally located for shopping and museums. Nice quiet room, it was not very large but that should be expected in Paris. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Good value for money. I recommend the hotel for a nice long week-end off in paris

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Time at the K+K”
Reviews.Author: ShezDC
Reviews.Content: I visited Paris for a week by myself and wanted to stay in a nice area. This hotel was perfect. Across the street from the metro, walking distance to the Musee d'Orsay, insanely close to boutiques and le Bon Marche. A few things to note: get a room on a higher floor otherwise you'll feel the trains, the gas station next door is helpful for snacks and drinks, and the rooms are small, but traveling alone made it a non-factor. Also, the staff was extremely pleasant. I definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing hotel , only upside was the location.”
Reviews.Author: Sazof29
Reviews.Content: The photos of the hotel are misleading. It felt like an upmarket Holiday Inn, nothing more than that. What we thigouth was a hidden gem was not at all , so what we thought were reasonable prices when we were booking, didn't seem like such good value afterall. Also, breakffast is not included but is at an extra cost of €26 per person which is shocking. We specifically asked for a bath when booking and were checked into a room with no bath. We then asked to move and were given a room which did not have working airconditioning, so we moved for a third time and settled for a dinghy room with a bath. We did see other rooms when checking out which were facing the street and these were much better because they had large windows and a balcony - ask for these rooms. Had terrible sleep because you hear every train that goes past (the hotel is directly above the metro station Rue de Bac). You also hear the bathroom habits of the people in the room above -every tap, every toilet flush, etc. Friendly and efficient service, clean, in the heart of St Germain, but would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it all”
Reviews.Author: TheSGB
Reviews.Content: I will keep this review short to avoid repeating all the comments on the other positive reviews which greatly influenced out decision to stay here. Previous positive comments are all true - great location, friendly, helpful staff, modern, clean rooms. We had a room with a balcony on the 6th floor with a wonderful view over the rooftops to the Sacre Coeur so do ask for one high up if possible. As has been previously mentioned the rooms are fairly small, but when on holiday you are not exactly spending much time there anyway. Treat yourself and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “As Wonderful as the First Time !”
Reviews.Author: Eve26
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a 5 night stay at the K & K , this was our second time there we have decided it is our favorite hotel in Paris. We loved it even more that the first time because it was just as wonderful,as we remembered and there had been little turn over in staff so many of the friendly and helpful individuals we met during our first stay were still at the hotel. We had a nicely decorated room, spacious by Paris standards with a small terrace we could walk out on with a view of Sacre Couer! What an enjoyable way to start and end the day! We were a party of four adults in two diifferent rooms, both rooms were clean with good quality linens and plush towels, nice tolietries. The chambermaid was attentive to what was used and quickly replaced it. There was something for most tastes at breakfast , eggs, lox, pates, meats, cheeses, bacon, assorted breads , cold cereals, fruit , juices, champagne anything could be prepared to one's tastes , the waitstaff was attentive and very pleasant. Everyone speaks English well , all requests and inquires about shops , restaurants or directions were responded to promptly and professionally. Even among this outstanding staff Cedric is exceptional - he is very knowledgeable and personable no matter what the hour ! There are several cafes and restaurants in easy walking distance. The area seems very safe at night we were comforatble strolling back after late dinners most nights . The internet access area which was free was a great way to keep up with emails and news from home . We were not able to access the free WIFI service but the hotel's access area was just as easy to use. The hotel is very well situated close to many main attractions as well as steps away from the Metro -the Rue Bac station and around the corner from a bus that will take you to the Eiffel Tower. There are even a number of nice shops and cafes in the area and a French chocolate shop and of course the service station for bottled water ! We can't wait to return!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris Base”
Reviews.Author: sosban
Reviews.Content: As has been said rooms are small, but very clean, neat and comfortable. Rooms well serviced and restocked daily. Staff are very helpful, friendly and proffesional. Location of the hotel is perfect. All main attractions walkable, lots of small interesting shops all around, cafes, restaurants and bars all close to hand. We booked throught he hotel and got breakfast included. This was a buffet with fresh fruits, juices, nice selection of meats, cheeses and breads - did I mention the champagne? We liked it alot, though would not have paid 25€ for it, as there are plenty of places around to get some breakfast, however we did enjoy the superb service at breakfast time, a really relaxing start to the day. Easy access to the internet for free. We stayed just 3 days, and the front desk staff seemed to take pride in greeting us by name and handing us our correct room keys without us telling them the number - just felt welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location”
Reviews.Author: wefirst
Reviews.Content: Just back from trip with 2 teen age grandchildren. Location exceptional, service outstanding, rooms small but totally adequate since we were rarely there. Breakfast buffet too expensive and too long (continental breakfast not an option) but surrounding cafes offered more excitement and choices and kids preferred to get out and about. Blvd St Germaine offered great boutiques, restaurants, evening strolls, and people watching. Across the street from Rue de Pac Metro which takes you anywhere you could possibly want to go. But hoofing it was easy and much more pleasurable. Definitely a strong recommendation to anyone - including business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend at K + K”
Reviews.Author: IrelandRomi
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading hundreds of reviews on tripadvisor. I booked it directly with hotel and got a deal that included breakfast - well worth it. The hotel is in a great location , walking distance to almost everywhere in Paris and for anywhere else you can jump on a metro just outside the door of the hotel. The reception staff were very helpfull and gave us a choice of two rooms. Rooms and common areas were all very clean. Hotel gave us recommendations for restaurants every night and they were all excellent. They couldnt have been more helpfull! would definalty recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tgordon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights there, and were quite impressed, especially after reading of so many hotel horror stories in Paris. This hotel exceeded our expectations. We did pay for an upgraded room. The room was not large by US standards, but considering some of the tiny places we have stayed, we were extremely happy. We got a top floor room with a view of the Eiffel tower (not all rooms are going to have that...) The staff helped us find several good places to eat, made some great recommendations, and showed us how to get around to local sights and shops. We ate breakfast at a local cafe (instead of at the hotel) - and I'll admit, the drinks in the lobby were not any where close to inexpensive. Local bottle shops (including the convenience store in the Shell station right next door) can help with that problem. Yes, when returning to Paris, we plan to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for a city break”
Reviews.Author: gchatziar
Reviews.Content: I stayed there,with my wife,for three nights,during our short city break holiday in Paris. Perfect location, you can go on foot to musee d' Orsay,musee de Louvre, Place de la Concorde,Isle de La Cite(Notre Dam).We had room 712,at the 7th floor,was an attic room,a little bit small,but with great window view to the Sacr Coeur. Very warm(individual aircon system),very clean,mini bar,LCD TV screen,safe,slippers,free internet.Well prepared breakfast,for various tastes.Metro station(Rue de Bac) just outside the hotel.Smart tip to choose a room at the upper floors(probably downstairs you will feel the vibrations of the underpassing metro trains).Friendly reception.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: djk155
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the K&K Cayre over New Year's. It was a gem - wonderfully located near St. Germain de Pre, with wonderful neighborhoods on all sides.The hotel was spotless - excellent breakfast and very helpful front desk staff. Small bar area, sauna, fitness room and business center. Contemporary, but warm and inviting. The guest room was small, but charming with a balcony and a great bathroom. Best of all, you could walk to Musee D'Orsay and fantastic cafes and shops. Metro stop right outside the front door. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Do go, and enjoy Paris at its best”
Reviews.Author: pierre131055
Reviews.Content: Read a few reviews about this hotel on your site before travelling. My wife and I have just returned from a four night stay- my Christmas 2008 present. The hotel is excellent, perfect location and as many of your reviews state, the staff cannot do enough for you! - they were great. We had requested a smoking room via our travel agent which the hotel staff said they had not received- after one night we were moved - with their help. A word of advice - our original room was on the first floor from where you could quite clearly hear and feel the metro trains from the station just outside the hotel- could be a problem for a light sleeper or any one who retires before the metro stops at I think midnight - but they do start early! We will return to this hotel and can highly recommend La Peteite Scala - Bistro Italien: a two minute walk away at 5 Rue Paul-Louis Courier - the best Pizza I have ever eaten! Paris is not cheap - but what a fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: SES7
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the K+K Cayre. The location is excellent for a sight seeing trip to Paris. We were able to walk to all the main sights and excellent restaurants. The hotel itself is stylishly decorated and immaculately maintained. The reception and the rooms are compact and the sapce is used efficiently. The staff were helpful and friendly. Would recommend to any of my friends wanting an excellent city break to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Boutique Hotel - Perfect Location!!”
Reviews.Author: exbackpacker29
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights last December and couldn't have been happier! Having been to Paris before, I know that many of the lower-rated hotels can be a bit dingy, so I decided to spring a little extra for a step up this time around. I got a great rate on hotelconnect.ca (around $250/nt including breakfast) and it was really worth it. The hotel is in a prime location on the Left Bank, easy walking distance to the Latin Quarter but also a quick stroll over the Pont Royal to the Louvre, Tuileries Gardens, Champs-Elysees etc. The room itself wasn't huge (it is Paris, after all) but it was stylish and comfortable. The breakfast was ample with a good selection of european meats, cheeses, and pate but also more American choices like scrambled eggs and bacon. Another cool factor is right across the street is a self-serve Velib bike station - you can rent a bike for one euro per day, and its a really fun way to see the city. Next time I go to Paris I'll definitely try to book this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: bambino770
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the K+K Cayre in 2006, it was a great experience. Worth every penny. Stayed there for 4 nights with my boyfriend, the room was clean, spacious with a balcony overlooking a side street. Very quiet as well. The breakfasts were amazing (got a deal where the breakfast was inclued) - very wide selection of sweet pastries, fresh fruit, fresh juices, cereals, toast, eggs and sausages, great coffee too. Also we had a complimentary bottle of water in our room every day and got selection of fresh fruit waiting for us in the room upon arrival - everything free of charge. Amazing location as well - we walked everywhere (Louvre, Eiffel Tower, Champs Elysees, walks along the Seine, Notre Dame etc). There is a pharmacy and large supermarket nearby too.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Stay in the Sixth”
Reviews.Author: Clarbeau
Reviews.Content: For years, whenever we visited Paris, we stayed in a small hotel in the Marais. This year we decided to move over to the Left Bank. The Hotel Cayre, located steps away from the Rue de Bac Metro stop, turned out to a be perfect choice for us. A friendly staff greeted us each morning at the wonderful breakfast buffet (eggs, bacon, salmon, pain au chocolat, fruit, cheese and much more). Thus fortified, we took easy strolls to the Louvre, Luxembourg Gardens, d'Orsay and Notre Dame or jumped the Metro for cross-city journeys. Our room, though smallish, was comfortable and spotless with a view over zinc rooftops and chimney pots to Sacre Coeur. We find it tough not to enjoy Paris. This hotel made it next to impossible.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: watakushi
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at the Cayre. Helpful and pleasant staff with lovely ambience. I don't know how you could ask for a more convenient location. Close (like 100' from the metro) and walking distance to the Louvre and the Seine. We couldn't be more satisfied. We'll go back!

Reviews.Title: “Upscale & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: 1FlewOver
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights at the K&K in Paris over Thanksgiving. The positive reviews are well-deserved. This hotel is in an excellent upscale location, away from the noise and bustle of the Latin Quarter. Many small boutique shopping choices and cafes (Cafe de Flore, Deaux Magots) are an easy walk as are major attractions like the Musee d'Orsay, Latin Quarter and Luxembourg Gardens. If your tired of walking, take the Metro. The Rue de Bac metro stop is literally just across the street. Taxis are also relatively cheap. The hotel staff was always very friendly and made us feel at home. The entire staff spoke English. When my wife mentioned she loved Coc Au Vin, Franck at the front desk went out of his way to make reservations for us at an excellent restaurant (A la Biche au Bois) that specialized in this incredible French dish. We highly recommend this beautiful hotel. November is also an excellent time to enjoy an intimate experience in this incredible city.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE PARIS in STYLE? You will love the K+K Cayré”
Reviews.Author: LoveBearis
Reviews.Content: The K+K Cayré is a beautiful Boutique hotel in the category 4 plus MORE. We have stayed already for the third time in this lovely designed hotelvilla in walking distance to the Louvre, the Eiffeltower and the Champs Elysées. Even in cold Novemberdays, the floor heated marble bathroom makes you feel like Louis XiV, the sunking. The friendliness of the staff members and the generosity of the room with its luxury high ceilings and beautiful interior takes you back to the times of noblemen and duchesses. This time our stay was of particular significance: We got engaged and decided to get married early next year... of course in Paris, la ville de l'amour... and of course we will have the wedding party in the K+K Cayré

Reviews.Title: “Paris with a plus at the Cayré”
Reviews.Author: devoted_guy
Reviews.Content: In preparation for a 5-day visit to Paris from our home in Toronto, I checked out the various hotel reviews for Paris hotels. This was my fifth trip to Paris and a first for my wife -- we're in our mid 40s. We wanted something better than a third floor walk up but weren't ready to tackle the "Georges V". Having previously stayed on the Right Bank, I thought it would be nice to try St. Germain and the 7th on the Left Bank. Based on the reviews, Hotel Cayré was my pick. All the most recent reviews were "dead on" -- perfect location (right across from a Metro stop). Lots to see and do in the area and found the hotel and staff to be most accommodating. Two free internet access terminals right in the lobby, easy and nice buffet breakfast, not too big a hotel, etc. Rooms were small but not smaller than any other hotel room in Paris. Heated floor in bathroom was an unexpected plus. If one does venture to the basement level where the gym is located, you can, in fact, hear the subway, but we were on a higher floor and didn't hear it/ feel it at all. Windows were quite solid so we weren't distrubed by the street noise on Rue Raspail. All in all, a perfect boutique hotel for our visit prior to heading onwards to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique hotel !”
Reviews.Author: neodoc
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I spent 5 nights here visiting one of my daughters who is studying in Paris for junior year abroad. This boutique hotel experience was wonderful in all ways ! Front desk people spoke great English and were very hepful. The room was small but typical european standard. Comfortable double bed. Smallish bathroom with great water pressure, wonderful tub, and heated floor ! TV was also good. I did have trouble with the internet connection on my MacBook. So, I used the computers in the lobby. Breakfast was very good but not worth 25 euros. That is what they charged me when I bought my daughter one day. It was included for my fiancee and I. Eggs, bacon, cereal, yogurt, fruit - yummy coffee We also enjoyed the end of the day cocktail. The bartender gave a great pour of wine or grand marnier. Now I know why I slept so well! Location is also great - easy to walk most places and the metro is right out the door. Very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: rosalbissima
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel! It's situated really in the center of Paris and only a few steps from the metro. It's so great when you come out of the metro at the right side you have the hotel. It's beautiful, a very nice building and the hall is very nice. The staff is very friendly. The rooms are cosy. The sheets smelled good and there was a kind word with some marmelade to receive us. The room has a flat tv and a minibar with a coffee/tea-maker which is excellent! The beds were confortable. The badroom was very clean but the bath had problems with the water. It was impossible two take two showers one after the other. The breakfast was excellent, there was a lot of choice!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, bad internet”
Reviews.Author: locapacow
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went here on our honeymoon. We stayed in a business class room which to my understanding is slightly bigger and had a small desk. As an american who likes his space, I recommend getting the bigger rooms in Europe. The room was very nice and we had a view over the main intersection. On a clear night in the distance you can see Disney World Paris from the angle we faced. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. The only complain is the poor internet service. My wife stayed here twice, once in 2008 and both times, the internet was slow to load up web pages and had difficulty connecting to various sites. There is zero possibility of using Skype to phone home as the connection is so poor. There is a bus stop and metro stop within a block. The shopping around the hotel is great. We walked to the Eiffel tower from the hotel and it took about 20-25 minutes. I highly recommend taking the 5 minute walk to the Poulan Bakery and sampling some of their exquisite breads.

Reviews.Title: “A Jewel on Rue Raspail”
Reviews.Author: trvln_foodie
Reviews.Content: Okay, so the review is terribly late, but we had recently passed by the K &K Cayre which sparked up fond memories of our last stay. I remember that the hotel staff was very courteous and helpful. They had offered to make dinner reservations for us, though we gratefully declined as we wanted to explore the culinary delights Paris had to offer on our own. We were conveniently located by the Le Bon Marche's LaGrande Epicerie, which is like a French Whole Foods, but better. We feasted on exotic, unpasteurized cheeses, fattening foie gras, massive carbs of baguettes and an embarrassingly large amount of Cote du Rhone wine back at our hotel room. Only problem, we didn't have a lot of space for our spread as our room was on the small side. Nonetheless, we made the most out of the space, which was enjoyable since the furnishings were comfy and quite efficient. Location wise, it was great. Walking distance to the D'Orsay, Louvre and best of all, the Metro Rue de Bac was right in front of the hotel. Also, it was just a short walk away from a daily farmer's market down Rue Raspail, near Le Bon Marche. Also, around the hotel are rather fanciful luxury shops, such as Christian Louboutin and R&Y Agousti. And just a few minutes away on St. Germain, are bountiful luxury stores and even more shopping! We would certainly recommend K & K Cayre. If you like modern, minimalist design and comfort with a charming staff to support, and enjoy luxury shopping only a few steps away, then this hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but good service and convienent”
Reviews.Author: Travelling-Ghost
Reviews.Content: I had booked the hotel and airfare through American Express 6 months ago for our honeymoon. The service spoke very good english and there were several other english speakers staying at the hotel. The hotels location was very convenient with both the metro across the street and a Shell station next door. We didn't take the metro as we loved walking Paris and looking at all the old buildings and shops. The room is small and this wasn't unanticipated. Most rooms in Paris central are tight. I had written them to note we were going to honeymoon and that my wife was sensitive to noise. They put us at the top floor for no extra charge. They also had a bottle of champagne waiting for us. The bed was very firm but yielded enough for me, but my wife thought it was a bit too stiff. Your mileage may vary. They do a breakfast buffet for 25Euros per person. Its a nice buffet but I thought it was a bit expensive. After talking to some other people, though the amount was expensive but we got more stuff and the quality was pretty good compared to other hotel buffets in the center of Paris. It included scrambled eggs, bacon, a meat/cheese tray, fresh bell pepers, cucumbers, tomatoes, a selection of breads/pastries/jams/honey, 3 different cereals, fresh fruit, 3 fresh juices(OJ, grapefruit, tomato), champagne, coffee/tea, and bottled water. Theres a sauna and work out gym downstairs in the basement. The gym is meager and I didn't try the sauna (not that it was bad just never got around to it). They also have a masseuse that you can schedule an appointment with. Breakfast room service is available but after adding up the costs, it probably just as well to go to the buffet. The hotel is about 7 - 8 stories with elevators. Elevators are small but modern. The stairway is very pretty but after all the walking in Paris, its the elevator for me. Free internet service is available (wired). They also have free internet terminals downstairs but should really get proper american keyboards since they set Windows to american english and some of the keys aren't mapped right.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the K&K”
Reviews.Author: Trekman
Reviews.Content: Spent seven nights at the K&K last month. Paid a little extra for an Executive level room in hopes for one of the higher floor rooms with a view of the Eiffel Tower and city. Instead got a room on the fourth floor with a nice view of the attractive apartments and shops across the street. The room was also somewhat smaller than the Executive rooms pictured on their website, but in all other respects was just fine for my purposes. While the rooms furnishings were not particularly upscale, the room was very clean and housekeeping excellent. The hotel's location is excellent and I found the room very quiet at night. Overall, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A marvelous stay...”
Reviews.Author: Seckel
Reviews.Content: I returned from Paris on October 14 after a two week trip to France, six nights of which I spent at K and K Hotel Cayre. Ever the skeptic, I didn't truly believe the rave reviews this hotel has received. Now, however, I have to admit that the reviews were right. This hotel is a winner! Because I spent the middle part of the two week stay in France at a week -long seminar at Versailles, my visit to the Cayre was divided into two. The first three nights I spent in a "suite" on a lower floor. The last three nights, I was in a large room on the top floor that had a fabulous view of the Eiffel Tower and the Dome of the Invalides: WOW! The rooms were decorated in an appealing, fresh and modern style. The location of the hotel is superb: about 50 feet from the Metro and the bus. It is just around the corner from the Rue du Bac and its many shops and restaurants and five minutes from the big department store Bon Marche. It's about a ten minute walk to the banks of the Seine and the Musee d'Orsay. Just around the corner is the famous Boulevard St. Germain, which leads to the Latin Quarter and is lined with restaurants and shops. Staff were excellent, attentive and helpful at all times. Even the night staff who saw me off from the hotel at six a.m. were delightful, offering to take my photograph as I sat waiting for the taxi to the airport. Even more important, the hotel is attractive and immaculate, with cleaning staff who take great pride in their work. It is no exaggeration to say that the place looked as if one could eat off the floor. I thought the breakfast was delicious with a choice of toast, breads, rolls, pastries, cereal, eggs, bacon, fruit, a selection of juices and to top it all off, ham, salami, cheese and prosciutto. Very nice to save for a snack later on. In short, I would definitely stay here again and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I loved the K&K Cayre”
Reviews.Author: patriciashltn
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Paris and stayed at the K&K Cayre. It was a wonderful experience. The staff was wonderful to us and very accommadating and spoke perfect English. We were able to exchange our USD for Euros at the front desk at the daily rate of exchange. The rooms were a little smaller than we are used to in the USA, but it was quite comfortable and soundproof. The room was very clean and looked out onto a small street (rue) that had many boutiques there. On the corner next to the hotel is a sidewalk cafe, the Saint Germaine Cafe. The staff there were extremely nice and friendly and would not accept tips because a 15% gratutity was added to our tab. The hotel is within walking distance of the Louve and Musee d'Orsay. You can take a tour bus to see all of Paris's sights and monuments and it will take you to the Eiffel Tower. The Eiffel Tower is within walking distance to the hotel if you are up for a nice hike. There are several small boutiques along this route that we couldn't resist stopping in to shop. The hotel is close to rue de Bellechasse and there you could find one of a kind handbags and other items and a Limoges shop. Everything that you could think of was close to the hotel. If you had a hankering for a cola to take to your room, there was a convience store right next door to the K&K hidden from the view of the street. We also stayed at the K&K Hotel George in London and found it to be everything we could want in a hotel. On our future trips around the world we will definately try to stay at a K&K hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This place should be much higher on this list”
Reviews.Author: nbdoc
Reviews.Content: As has been mentioned here, the location is near perfect - we spent a week with my wife and 9 y.o. daughter, and did not even use the metro for the first 3 days. Great breakfast. Our room (506) was very quiet, looking into the courtyard. Last year we stayed in Elysees Regencia, which has been close to #1 on this list for sometime. In my mind, K+K beats Regencia hands down. The clear advantages are the location (walk to Louvre, D'Orsay, Notre Dame, Rodin, even Tour Eiffel and opera), neighbourhood (leisurley stroll to St. Germaine de Pres and Odeon for dinner and shopping), rooms (real triple room with real 3rd bed, and plenty of room for people AND luggage, better furniture, desk, minibar, safe), better breakfast, and better value (Regencia DOUBLED their prices since last year, thanks to all the hipe from Trip Adv., so K+K, while still VERY expensive, is cheaper). Can't see how people will rate Regencia higher than K+K. The staff was great, their diner tip at La Petit Chaise was great, wish they knew more good restaurants in the area. One minor glitch: the hotel web site makes it certain that you get wi-fi in the room, but in fact it's only in the lobby. You get WIRED connection (no extra charge) in the room, but if you like browsing internet in the bed - bring your own X-long data cable.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location; Excellent Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: museumlover3
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in my share of small European hotels with closet-size bathrooms. K+K Hotel Cayre is a wonderful exception. Our room was spacious, comfortable and modern, with a large, marble-lined bathroom and best of all, a beautiful view of Boulevard Raspail on the Left Bank. The lobby was modern. The staff was efficient, helpful and friendly --especially Mark, the barman. We had the privilege of meeting the owner of the hotel chain during our stay, and he was warm and friendly as well as gracious and welcoming. The hotel could not be better located, in our opinion. It's an easy walk to the Louvre, Musee D'Orsay, the lively St. Germain des Pres district and the Sorbonne area. We walked everywhere from the hotel, including Notre Dame and Sainte Chapelle, and even the Eiffel Tower. We heartily recommend K+K Hotel Cayre.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Little Luxury”
Reviews.Author: coexister
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed here on our honeymoon this year, having secured a deal with Eurostar. Perhaps because of the deal, the room was smaller than you would perhaps expect from a 4*, but wow! what a place! From the moment we arrived, we were made to feel special by the staff- nothing was too much trouble, someone was waiting to help us with our luggage and was extremely friendly and helpful. Not that it should be expected, but all staff speak at least some English, which is helpful. Satff are smart, professional and well presented.The room was beautiful, high quality toiletries and fresh robes and slippers. The linen and bed were very comfortable, and noise was not a problem. Great shower, marble bathroom.There is a very attractive lounge area with two internet stations, complimentary. Lifts are not a problem - convenient and easy to use, though the broad, marble staircases are a treat in themselves for the able bodied! The hotel breakfast buffet, complete with champagne (!) is set at 25 euros PP, but this is 4*. We just explored the local breakfast serving cafes a few doors down, purely for budget reasons. Excellent location - 5 mins from Musee D'Orsay and The Seine. Wonderful little bars close by. Only a short walk to the left bank coffee shops and the old haunts of Jen Paul Satre and friends. I would recommend this place to anyone, they made us feel so welcome. Clean, friendly, luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “K & K does it again!”
Reviews.Author: Geo88
Reviews.Content: Stayed at K & K Hotel George on our trip to London last year. Was so impressed that I would not consider any other hotel for this year's trip to Paris. Well, we were just as impressed this year. Everything was perfect. Great location in a very nice area. We could walk to several of the major attractions. Nice clean rooms, great buffet breakfast. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: stefzk
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely gorgeous! With this being my first time in Europe, and the first hotel we stayed in while we were there, I had no idea what to expect and we were more than satisfied with everything! The only sight we went to in Paris that wasn't within walking distance was Sacre Ceour and the staff was more than willing to help us use the Metro (what stops to get on and off, etc). With a Metro stop right down the block, it was really easy to figure everything out. The staff was helpful, rooms were clean and the hotel as a whole was amazing and beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “Parisien Charm”
Reviews.Author: Laurence2208
Reviews.Content: I think what makes this hotel so special is the location. Saint Germain is an up-market area which has a genuine French feel to it - nowhere near as touristy as the Champs Elysees thoroughfare, but close enough to all the main tourist spots (walking distance to most) to make it a real find. This boutique hotel is fairly small, but has everything you would want from a city break hotel. The room was clean and nicely furnished, though I must say it was perhaps a little small for my usual taste but sufficient for a long weekend break in Paris over New Year. The staff were attentive and breakfasts satisfying. There really is no need to splash the cash on a more traditional 5 star unless you are planning a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: fusspots4
Reviews.Content: My 16 year old daughter and I went to Paris to speak a little french and see the sights Hotel Cayre was great . On check in the front desk advised us that they had not managed to meet our request for a room with a view on a high floor as the French Open was on and they were very busy -and sure enough a fairly dark inner coutyard room was allocated. However they also advised us not to unpack and to leave our bags in the room and they would move us the next day. This they duly did to a delightful room -thank you The breakfast was included in our booking and was very good with lots of choice. The front desk were also very helpful in advising us about good places to eat which was much appreciated. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would book again

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay on the left bank”
Reviews.Author: phoenikia
Reviews.Content: Booked a triple room through the K & K website, and had a pleasant experience. The room was one of the largest I've had in Europe, and the beds were comfortable. Very quiet room, with high ceilings, overlooking an inner courtyard with a garden. The furniture was contemporary, and the room had a very stylish feel. The bathroom was modern, spacious and very clean, with a great water pressure. Nice soft, large bathsheets, too. Thought the kettle and teas near the minibar was a nice touch. Our rate of 330 Euros included breakfast for 3, and I'm glad it did. IThe breakfast costs roughly 25 Euros if purchased separately from the room. It was the nicest hotel buffet I've had in France- similar quality to the best breakfast buffets I've found in Athens and Berlin. Fresh squeezed juices, many choices of pastries, cheeses, cereals, fruit, yogurt, bacon, eggs, etc. They even had champagne, smoked salmon and foie gras as options. Too bad I'm counting my calories. What I found most amusing were the other guests at the buffet. I seriously wondered if they were trying to get their money's worth by hoarding the cheeses and other big ticket buffet items. I cut a 1/2 inch (roughly 1/3 ounce) slice of camembert off the 5 ounce piece that was on the tray, and saw through the corner of my eye, that a 12 year old boy was in my personal space, so close that he brushed my arm. I hadn't even fully removed my slice off the tray when he stuck his fork into the remaining 4.5 ounces of cheese, put it onto his plate and walked away. A few minutes later, Cheese Boy was circling the empty cheese tray like a shark. A little while later, I saw another man with a 4 ounce piece of cheese on his plate. And then I understood why the staff replenishing the cheese tray kept the pieces of cheese on the cheese tray relatively small- to prevent customers from taking 25 euros worth of cheese in a single setting. In my 2 weeks in France, this was the only place I saw a table where each individual had taken 2 pain au chocolats, in addition to their heaping plate of bacon, smoked salmon and egg. Fantastic opportunity to people watch, if I do say so. The hotel has a business centre, as well as 3 computers with internet access. I found it interesting that the keyboards were anglophone style, as opposed to French keyboards. What was too bad, is that there was no policy suggesting that people limit their internet time if other guests are waiting. I usually try to hurry myself up if I see someone waiting. I might be getting crusty now that I'm the ripe old age of 35, but I think the teenagers surfing the net for bikes or updating their facebook should not take priority over people who have to confirm flights. This isn't the hotel's fault- I think it's more of an entitlement issue with some of the guests the hotel seems to attract. I had asked one of the gentleman working at the front desk for a recommendation for a non-touristic bistro, after he was unable to get through to the restaurants I had on my list. I walked to the restaurant he suggested, and was disappointed to see that it was indeed a tourist trap serving French onion soup and club sandwiches, overlooking the Seine on an expensive piece of property. I found something else nearby, that worked out, but I guess I've now learned my lesson- research my restaurants more carefully in advance, make advance reservations and don't ask the front desk for restaurant recommendations. The hotel staff were very courteous, and the place was immaculate. Seemed to be a very popular place with Brits, Americans, Italians, etc. So much so, that I almost forgot I was in Paris when I was inside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at K&K Cayre”
Reviews.Author: SussexMark
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and booked direct with the hotel after seeing other positive reviews on this site. Great location, (next to the Rue d'Bac Metro station), excellent hotel with friendly and helpful staff. We had a classic room on the 7th floor, which wasn't large but perfectly adequate for our stay, with rooftop views across the city. Room was well appointed, furnished in boutique style and very comfortable. Our room rate with the hotel included the buffet breakfast which offered great variety, and compared to the rack rate of Euro25 per person per day well worth booking. All in all it surpassed expectations and we would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bodoglimt
Reviews.Content: We have previously stayed at the London K&K which is great. The level of service at the Cayre though was excellent. I made several requests via e-mail which were responded to promptly and also with positive results. I could not fault our stay at the K&K and would recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Don't go, just don't”
Reviews.Author: nede1234
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights. I've known this place for a while. Stayed here in 11.2006, also stayed in the Hotel's branch in Budapest. Was always quite happy with it, nice styling and atmosphere, but I guess all good things must come to an end. First, they don't tell you that being infront of a metro station has its problems. The rooms shake when the trains go by, and they do that all day. I thought it was just my room last time, but being in 2 different rooms in 2 different floors I can safely say: the hotel vibrates. Secondly, don't accept any room in the first floor.I did, and recieved a room which was at lower ground level, very small for more than 200 euro a night, and no light! Thirdly, I took the deal giving a free boat tour on the river. The reception didn't give me anything until I asked for it specifically. Niether did I get the "special gift" promised on the web site. Fourth, our room was not cleaned in the second day.Someone was in the room, we could have seen that, but no clean towls,no fixing the bed, nothing. We called reception and told them. In response, they asked what do we "want". So we asked for a cleaning lady to come in about an hour an a half,because we are sleeping. She came after 30 minutes,woke us up. in the check out day,we were woken up by the cleaning lady at about 08:30. She wanted to clean the room. the whole scenario was not of a 4 star hotel, but rather a 2 star one. Lastly, I recieved in my last visit a 10% discount, and was told that my data will be kept online (I was there for a week). So when reserving, I asked for my discount, quoting the exact date of stay. No,they said: send us the voucher. I had non, as I was told that it will be fine.Check your record, I suggested. They did, found out I did stay, did get a voucher. However,they insisted they cannot give me the discount without it physically. At this point I remembered I got the business card of the manager. Even that didn't help. To conclude, They were rigid and rude to a returning costumer. They did not display any sort of 4 star standard. Room was very small,with no day light. The hotel vibrates. Don't go: there are many good 3-4 star hotels in the left bank.

Reviews.Title: “Would book again.”
Reviews.Author: Leeandall
Reviews.Content: A very well presented and run hotel. We stayed in a classic room on the 1st floor, while not huge it was certainly of 4* standard. The location and feel of the place would certainly make it a strong contender should we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wecaresfo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from June 13 through June 20. Bed is comfortable, room clean, staff helpful, and computer accessibility a plus. Another plus is having an in-room safe. The hotel is in a pretty quiet area and close to many attractions, including d'Orsay & Rodin Museums, as well as Napoleon's Tomb. Access to the Metro Station is just steps away from the hotel entrance. K&K is four blocks from Au Bon Marche Dept. Store where you can pick up all the European food delights. We would definitely return again. The rate is a bit on the high side but worth it. Minor downer: You can hear the occasional rumble of the Metro trains underneath the hotel, though it helps lull you to sleep. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: PhD2B
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the K&K Cayre for one week in May 2008, her present to me for finally graduating from college. We had visited Paris in 2003 and had an unpleasant experience with our hotel; on this trip, however, we were VERY pleasantly surprised...with everything. The location could not be more perfect. Located in high-end St. Germaine-des-Pres (one of the nicest districts in all of Paris we were told) and directly across from a metro station, the hotel is located in the heart of the city in a picturesque, stereotypical "Parisian" neighborhood. It is central and convenient to everything (or transportation to wherever you may want to go) but not in the middle of the madness. Again, the metro is right across the street and traveling on it was not nearly as difficult as I had expected; if you've manuevered on a subway before (or if you can read and know your colors, you should do just fine.) Also, it was a short walk (10 min.) to the Seine/Musee D'Orsay, which was a central stop for all of the touring companies. Quaint shops, upscale boutiques, and several convenience stores (tucked away out of sight) make this hotel's location ideal for any type of shopping you want to do. Perfect, PERFECT location! The rooms were lovely--recently renovated and clean with a modern decor. Our room was small but, then again, that's just how they are in Europe. GORGEOUS view from our terrace. Perfect! Also, the hotel staff was charming, friendly, and extremely helpful. They were ever-ready to provide us with information, assistance, and a warm "hello" (by name) every time we came or went. (Also, there weren't any language barriers; they gladly spoke English and introduced my mother to a little bit of French.) The breakfast menu was delicious but lacked variety. I'm a vegetarian, so the only thing I was able to eat every morning was bread and fruit. I couldn't possibly eat another croissant right now if I wanted to; eating them morning, noon, and night will do that to ya, though. (It was my choice not to eat the sliced meats, bacon, and eggs, though.) Than again, I gained a few pounds while there (despite the walking) so it must not have been that bad. We didn't have dinner at the hotel but did have dessert there on several occassions, and it was TO DIE FOR (the chocolate cake with ice cream and the apple tart, especially). Great patisserie (Dallyou) is right around the corner. We just couldn't be more pleased with this selection of hotels. Again, perfect. Our stay couldn't have been better, and we will return to the K& K when we come back. This really was the perfect hotel in every way. BTW...We felt completely safe, coming and going at all hours. And, there's FREE INTERNET in the lobby which made keeping in touch with my hubby and kids very convenient (and saved me a fortune).

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: goofy_md
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a very nice hotel. as I write this that sounds like a back handed compliment. I always look for some background on the writers so I'll give you mine. my wife and I travel a fair amount and do like to feel special when we do. we are not demanding but we do take notice of details and are probably more critical than most. This was my first time in Paris, but have traveled other placed in Europe. As others have said, great location, we like to walk and walked everywhere, but the metro is across the street. the staff was outrageously nice. would speak what ever language you prefer and set up what ever you wanted. the hotel was exceptionally clean, as was our room. But it was incredibly small. I realize this is a Paris thing, but ... We had our breakfast buffet included and it was well worth it. nice to not have to worry about how to get my 4 cups of coffee and multiple pasties in. Overall a very nice experience, but in my mind nothing too notable. but, again, this my be the Paris seen.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: HeenaH
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in June and loved it! The staff were really nice and friendly from the start. The hotel is in a great location, right opposite the metro station which makes it easy to get anywhere in Paris really quickly. Its also close to the stop for the open bus tour, which we used to travel around as the ticket was for 2 days. there are lots of restaurants and cafes along rue de bac and st germain des pres, so it was very easy to get some nice food! also the breakfast is really good. we even ordered fried eggs which aren't on their buffet and they didnt charge us extra! :) room was very nice, bathroom was very nice too. would definitely recommend the hotel and go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “K&K All the Way”
Reviews.Author: N2TravelCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the K&K was a wonderful experience. It was clean, contemporary, close to the metro, next door to a Shell mini mart, and had a great staff. John Pierre at the front desk was a joy to talk to and was very helpful in different aspects of our trip. The buffet was included in our hotel stay and it was simple but quite good. I appreciated that there were computers with internet access free to use. The location of the hotel was perfect for walking to restaurants and shopping. This was a girl's trip so there were three of us to a room and we had plenty of room to move around. When I make it back to the City of Lights, I will definitely stay at the K& K again.

Reviews.Title: “In the center of it all”
Reviews.Author: gillwill
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 5-day stay in Paris with my mother and sister. We had a fabulous time and great weather. To start, the hotel met our high expectations (we chose the K&K Cayre based on the reviews from this site!) We stayed in a junior suite and there was plenty of room for 3 adults. It was very clean and the staff was helpful. We also enjoyed the breakfast (part of our package) and the free use of the Internet. It was easy (and free!) to stay in touch with family and friends back home. Above all that, the K&K is in a great location! We did walk A LOT - wear comfortable shoes. It was easy to walk from the hotel to the Louvre, the Jardin de Tuileries, Plaza de Concorde, Musee d'Orsay, etc. We even walked to the Champs/Arc de Triomphe from the hotel. It's such a beautiful city that to really experience it is to walk it. A few quick tips/comments: 1. At this time of year, it stays daylight until nearly 9pm! 2. You MUST reserve a dinner cruise on the Bateaux Parisiens. It was simply an amazing experience. So amazing that a couple next to us got engaged while on our cruise! 3. Go to the museums (especially the Louvre) when it first opens to avoid the lines. 4. Metro is very easy to use and is a great option to get to different parts of the city. There is a metro stop right in front of the hotel. Also, we took the bus (stop outside hotel) to the Eiffel...easy. 5. Tipping is not necessary especially if the bill has "comp prix" tallied in. We learned the hard way ;) 6. Lastly, it is expensive but the wine was cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Guy12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in 2006 and returned again in 2007 and will return again next time in Paris. Even the smallest rooms are very good, clean and comfortable. Breakfast great. Location super! Its not inexpensive but no renovated central hotel in Paris is inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: DinkumMackay
Reviews.Content: Although room was a bit small, we found the staff incredibly helpful and the location very central with a Metro station at the door. Easy walking distance to the Louvre, Notre Dame, the Seine and restaurants. Breakfasts were good and access to free internet made keeping in touch easy.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at K & K”
Reviews.Author: pepysway
Reviews.Content: Thanks for the previous reviews on this hotel property. We finally decided to stay in this hotel for our first trip to Paris after doing so much research on the web. My husband had travelled extensively for business and we had stayed in many big 5 star hotels such as Four Seasons, Hyatt, Shangri-la, Sheraton, Le Meridien, etc in other countries. We pick K & K Cayre for its relatively reasonable price for a 3-4 star hotel because everything is so expensive in Paris. K & K did not disappoint us. The hotel meets our expectation in term of comfort. It is clean, modern and well equipped with daily essentials. Lodging is important for us because we really wanted a comfortable place to relax after every long sight seeing day, not necessary luxurious but comfy enough for a tired day. Room is a little small as expected for Paris. We got an upgrade room and the size is okay for us, enough space for two of us and our baggages. No toothbrush and bathrobe in the room but you could request them at the reception. A little nice thing....there is a shoe polisher close to the elevator. Hotel staff are very friendly and speak fluent English. We were given a room facing the court yard. That's what we requested for its quietness. It did not bother us too much that the rooms facing us are quite close when we open the window. Maybe should ask for a room facing the main street without facing close building but may need to deal with some street noises during the morning. The location is pretty quite in the nite, but we feel very safe to walk around. There is a Shell station with a mini mart next door and a small supermarket just around the block from the hotel for any essentials that you need. We bought our drinking water from Shell which costed us 2 Euros for 6 bottles (1 Litre each); very good deal. Few brasseries around the corner. A short walking distance is one of the best restaurants in Paris; L'Atelier de Joel Robuchon. If you have a chance, try this restaurant. You will really enjoy but just a little pricey. Hotel staff helps to make reservation but was fully booked throughout the week. We went there one evening to check it out and we were able to get a table within 10 mins due to some cancellation; lucky us! There is a post office is across the street. A metro station, Rue du Bac, is also just in front of the hotel. We used metro as our main transportation because it is so convenient to get to anywhere. You can get a five days unlimited pass for 27.50 Euro. That pass covers the metro, RER and buses within Paris city limit. You can also take bus route 69 at Rue du Bac (bus stop at the corner of the hotel) to take you to Eiffel Tower. The only down side that I could comment about the hotel was the in-room internet access. It was free but not wireless. You had to ask the front desk for an ethernet cable. Overall, we had a very pleasant stay at the K & K Cayre and Paris which is such a interesting city. We had indeed enjoyed our first trip to Paris and will definitely return again soon!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Lovely Staff”
Reviews.Author: pieboy4
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend and found the location of the hotel ideal. Jumped on the the eurostar and was was in Paris in unbelievable time. It was a few stops on the Metro. Next to the hotel is a really convinient petrol station that has all the regular stuff you need like water, snacks etc. Also there is a really nice Cafe literally seconds from the front of the hotel which was nice just to stop at and catch your breath. There is a taxi rank across the road which was convinient for when I needed to get to dinner appointments. Also within 10 minutes walk is the Seine. Felt instanty at home. The area is quite at night and its nice to stroll the roads feeling pretty safe. The staff are really friendly and keen to help. There is convinient 24hours internet access in the lobby which is good for all us insomniacs out there and guy at the desk can tell a good story - in perfect English of course. Good clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed”
Reviews.Author: APhi
Reviews.Content: We picked the Cayre based on the reviews that we'd seen on Expedia and Tripadvisor.
