We were looking for a hotel that was central to all of the main attractions and Cayre certainly ticked all of those boxes with the Louvre, Musee D'Orsay and Pompidou centre all being a short stroll away. There is also a Metro stop right at the front door of the hotel, which made life easy for going farther afield. The room was small, but the light decor meant that it didn't feel oppressive or poky. In fact, it was surprisingly comfortable. We had a room on the sixth floor with views to the Sacre Coeur. The hotel staff were excellent getting us dinner reservations on both Saturday and Sunday evening when we'd left it rather late to book, which meant phoning around. We went to the Cafe St Germain for breakfast - which was 9 euros a head for a continental and is only a few yards from the hotel for those who don't want to pay the hotel prices for breakfast. All in all, we'd definitely go back. I honestly can't think of a negative aspect.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: Eml012881
Reviews.Content: I found the K+K Hotel Cayre to be a perfect choice for my trip to Paris. For starters, the location was amazing. It was right off St. Germain and literally across the street from a metro. I loved the cafe almost next door and ate breakfast there every morning. The Staff was wonderful to work with, very friendly. They even helped collect ice when I twisted my ankle! The rooms were quite comfortable with a double bed. I enjoyed the modern decor of the room. I was traveling alone so the smaller size of the room did not bother me at all. My room was on the top floor and I could see Sacre La Coeur out my windows! The heated bathroom floor was a big plus as well. I wish the water pressure in the shower had been greater. It was a bit weak for my taste. I never tried the breakfast in the hotel, deciding that 25 euros there versus 9 euros at the cafe was too expensive. I also was in an unique situation of needing to use the laundry services at the hotel which while extremely convenient caused me a small fortune! I would easily recommend the K+K Cayre to anyone traveling in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the K+K Cayre!”
Reviews.Author: swisscub
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with my boyrfriend for a weekend in Paris...it was fabulous! It is about 30 seconds walk from a metro stop. Close walk (5-10min) to the Musee D'Orsay and Tuileries Park. We had a room with a balcony overlooking a quiet streets After an evening out, we would enjoy a French wine on the balcony! Super clean, large bathroom, amazingly comfortable bed!! Perfect for a nap after a tiring day of sightseeing! Other than the excellent room, the staff was also extremely friendly and helpful. They gave us recommendations for restaurants each night and even reserved for us (as our French was fairly limited). Definitely eat at Le Petit Chaise which is within walking distance, delicious French food and cozy atomosphere. We loved Paris and loved our stay at the K+K. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for our first visit to Paris!”
Reviews.Author: sc_family4
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at the K+K Hotel Cayre during our first trip to France. The hotel staff was wonderfully helpful! The free computers in the lobby and the free internet access from the room was a great feature as well (I brought my laptop). The rooms were typical size for Europe, and very nicely decorated. The bathroom floor was even heated! Our room faced the side street, and was very quiet. Breakfast was good, with the typical European fare (cold cuts, breads, yogurt, some cereals) and was included with our hotel fare. The hotel was in a great location - right by the Rue de Bac Metro stop and across the street from the Post Office. Lots of local shops and dining within walking distance. I would certainly recommend this hotel to others!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - great service”
Reviews.Author: busouki
Reviews.Content: My husband, 16 year old son and I stayed for four nights at the K&K Cayre and truly found this hotel to be excellent. Service was always friendly and the staff went out of their way to accomodate our requests. Lot's of attention is paid to detail, rooms are well designed, and the location is central to many sites. We had a "triple" or junior suite with a view of the courtyard and it was spacious and comfortable for the three of us. The breakfast buffet was included in our room rate and it was very nicely laid out and each of us found items that we were pleased with. There were two computers in the lobby with free internet access but my son also brought his lap top and we had free internet access in the room. Rue de Bac had just about every type of shop we were looking for. The Shell station was like an American 7/11 and was convenient for snacks, etc. It was also a good landmark for cabbies. It's not an area with a lively nightlife scene, but St. Germaine is an easy walk, if you're looking for that. Also, we did walk to the Hotel Lutetia which has a very cool bar with jazz/piano if you're looking for more mature entertainment. It's just about 4 blocks down Blvd. Raspail. I booked this hotel based on other reviews, so thanks to all. The reviews were on the mark. I would definitely book this hotel again. It was a very good value and a very well run establishment. I'd also not hesitate to stay at other K&K Cayre Hotels in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: everythingflowers
Reviews.Content: I must thank everyone who has reviewed the K+K Cayre! My husband and I stayed 7 nights in a room that looks like all the pictures posted here- which is very nice to know what you are getting when you arrive. Everything was well kept and very clean. The beds were also comfortable, and in the bathroom there is a full sized tub and shower (not something all hotels have). The location of the hotel is also a great feature. It is in walking distance to so many attractions, and there is a metro station practically right outside the door. Unless breakfast is included in your room price, I’d suggest finding a little café instead because it is pricy and there is not much variety day to day. For dinner, you’re sure to find many wonderful meals. Some of our favorites were at Le Christine (1, rue Christine; metro Oden), Au Petit Tonneau (20, rue Surcouf; metro Invalides), and Sens’o (on the main road on the small island). If you are not sure if you should pick this hotel because it may be a little more than you wanted to spend (like us), I must say that we have no regrets and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: bt33107
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at K+K for our honeymoon April 2007. The hotel is nicely decorated, and the room was modern. The room was small, but that is to be expected. The modern touches included a small flat-panel tv, which we tuned into BBC in the morning while we were getting ready. The bathroom was very nice, and the floor was even heated! Our window opened to a view a courtyard pathway. Everyone who worked at K+K was very polite and helpful. There are two computers in the lobby for public use, one of the keyboards is (I assume) French (kinda tricky when you're not used to it!). The neighborhood surrounding the hotel was nice. There was a small market around the corner where we purchased food to keep in the room (the hotel charges an exorbatant amount for breakfast!!). We frequented the Shell station that was just down the block- my husband loved their panini! The Metro station (Rue de Bac) is right across the street. Most evenings we walked down to the Latin Quarter for dinner, a nice 15 minute stroll. I would highly recommend K+K for its location, friendliness, and rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: GirlNumberSix
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel; very clean, lovely rooms, perfect location, really helpful staff. Stayed here for 3 nights on a weekend break to Paris, it's serviced really well by the metro but we walked to most places. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sojo_Grrl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at the K&K Cayre in Paris from March 7-14. This was our first trip to Paris (although I have traveled extensively across four continents) and we were very pleased with our hotel stay. The hotel is as described and as pictured and we found the many reviews here at tripadivsor to be very accurate. We confirmed our reservation via email ahead of time and requested a non-smoking room and a room with a view if available. We arrived early and our room was ready for us. We stayed on the 7th floor and yes the rooms are pretty small as seems to be the Parisian standard; however, I was expecting it to be shockingly small... rather it was tight but adequate. Our queen size bed was pretty comfortable. I would recommend staying on the 6th floor because the 7th floor had slanting rooflines that cut into the room space. The rooms were well appointed and spotlessly clean with a contemporary decor. The heated tile floors were a nice touch in the bathroom and I enjoyed a hot bath every night. We used the lobby computers daily to check email, look up Paris information, etc. Our breakfast was included with our room cost and was delicious with a nice variety from which to choose. Generally the service was extremely pleasant in both the breakfast room and front desk. Americans... remember to be polite and formal, never assume anyone speaks English, don't speak so loud that the whole room can hear you, and use some basic French and you will not have any problems!! The hotel is centrally located in a quiet neighborhood right across from a not-so-useful subway line. You pretty much have to transfer once or twice to get most destinations but it is so quick it is hardly an issue. We were pros at the subway be mid-week. It’s a good walk to most locations so you will have to sacrifice fashion for comfort in your footwear ladies. If you want to be able to step out of your hotel and be immediately surrounded by nightlife and cafes and restaurants, you might want to consider staying in the Latin Quarter instead. We felt safe pretty much everywhere we went. Brace yourself for the exorbitant prices. I regret not buying a food/dining book (we only had our general Paris guidebook). We had some really excellent meals at restaurants recommended in our guide and some disappointing experiences when we randomly picked a place. It is quite depressing to spend over $100 on what turns out to be the equivalent of salisbury steak and tater tots so PLAN AHEAD for meals! The French eat dinner very late, like 8:30 pm, so we had a big breakfast at the hotel, a light snack at mid-day, and then a big dinner late. The hotel staff were happy to make reservations for us. The Shell station next door was good for snacks but if you love food absolutely go check out the Bon Marche grocery store just a few blocks away… it’s a culinary delight. We budgeted about $250 dollars a day for two to cover transportation, entrance fees, meals, a few gifts, and misc. and we even came home with some money. Our most expensive meal (with wine) was about 150 Euros and our cheapest restaurant meal (with wine) was about 75 Euros… of course street food and cafes are much cheaper and a good option for lunch. Do NOT exchange money at the hotel or at the airport the rates are truly horrible… there is a money exchange about 10 minutes down St. Germain Blvd on the left with a good rate. One last quick tourist tip, skip the ridiculous lines to go up the Eiffel Tower and instead go to the Montparnasse Tower at night for a breathtaking view of the city and a bottle of wine. Have a great trip and bring an umbrella!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: CaroleS
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed at the K&K Cayre which we love for its central location, friendly staff and clean accommodation. It is great for walking to some of the central sights such as the Notre Dame, Musee D'Orsay and L'Orangerie. It is also easy for the metro - there is a stop close by at Rue de Bac or a 10 minute walk to Saint Germain des-Pres. The staff are very helpful, each evening they gave excellent restaurant recommendations. We decided not to eat breakfast in the hotel as it seems pricey at 25 euros per person. There are several places you can walk to for breakfast such as Cafe de Flore & Les Deux Magots both on Boulevard Saint Germain. We had a small room on the 7th floor from which there was a lovely view of the Sacre Coeur. We have stayed in Paris several times and have always found rooms to be on the small side. Whilst this is the same with the K&K the quality, location and staff make it stand out as a great place to stay - we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fine, functional hotel but not memorable”
Reviews.Author: oddmom
Reviews.Content: Just returned from four nights at the K & K. We arrived at 11:30AM and as check in is not officially until 3pm our room was not ready. We left our bags with the desk and went for coffee around the corner on Blvd St. Germaine. We returned at 12:30 and happily our room was ready. The downside was that it was on the 2nd floor facing the interior garden (very small but pretty) and had no direct daylight. I asked to change to a larger outside room facing the Blvd but they said it would be 80 Euros extra per day! They told us that our room was an executive room and one of the biggest. By Parisian standards it was not unbearable but it was very small and the lack of light made it more claustrophobic. Everyone at the front desk was extremely helpful and accomodating. I brought my transformer but didnt have the right adapter so they lent me one for the duration of my stay. It was a lifesaver! I thought the breakfast was included but it wasn't and at 25 Euros per person it wasn't worth it. Lots of food and choices but we just went around the corner to a little cafe on rue du bac for coffee and croissants. The hotel is conveniently located and I walked everywhere. The Blvd Raspail is quiet with not much going on outside the hotel. There is a Shell Gas Station right next door with a useful minimart. Excellent sandwiches, baguettes, pates and wine. We stocked up on water and basics so as not to be tempted by the minibar offerings late at night. The gym was pretty useless; a treadmill, rowing machine and stairmaster. Since I must have walked for six hours a day those weren't the machines I found useful. There is a steam or sauna (unisex). They had two computer stations w/free internet which was very handy and the lounge was pleasant. Didn't eat at the hotel so cant comment on the food there. I probably wouldnt stay here again as it wasnt that special but it was certainly clean, somewhat charming and well located.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and honest”
Reviews.Author: sweetmags
Reviews.Content: Centrally located just off Blvd. St. Germaine on the left bank with clean and modern rooms. Free internet in the lobby of the hotel makes it easy to touch base with loved ones at home. Breakfast is included which, given the weakness of the dollar at the moment, saved us a fair amount of money. However we ended up spending it on the room. This place was not inexpensive and 4 nights cost us about $1200. The hotel is in a terrific area for shopping as well as night life and food. It's a 10 minute walk to Notre Dame and is less than one block from the metro. We also found the hotel staff to be extremely accommodating. They booked all of our meals for us (at our request) and went above and beyond when my husband left his cash, IPOD, cell phone and camera battery in the safe after we checked out. We simply called the hotel, they retrieved the items and held them for us for 4 days until we returned to Paris after an excursion to Italy. Certainly anywhere else these items might have vanished. We were extremely happy with K&K and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: moppenlander
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in June. With all the hotel choices in Paris, and having no real recommendations, we spent hours and hours reviewing options. We were not disappointed in our final choice. The rates were somewhere in the middle of the range of prices. The room was quite nice and spacious enough for the little time we spent in it. We did have a "balcony" but there was only JUST enough room to stand on it. We overlooked a side street which posed no noise problem. The aromas from the bakeries and delis across the street were wonderful each morning. In fact, that is where we would have breakfast and coffee each day. Breakfast in the hotel dining room was included in our room rate, but it was very disappointing. They did a poor job of replenishing food items and then when they did, there was a mad stampede by other guests to get to it! The location is great. Just a few minutes walk to the Louvre and the Orsay. We walked everywhere with the Tower and Notre Dame being a bit of a long walk, but the weather was pleasant and we don't mind walking.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel Cayre”
Reviews.Author: JKWEvergreen
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel has been recently renovated and is just beautiful; contemporary design in a restored Parisian building. The front desk staff could not have been more helpful and welcoming. The rooms are on the small side, but beautifully furnished with comfortable beds and down comforters and pillows, flat screen tv, and free wireless internet. The bathroom has a bath/shower combo. Included in the room price is coffee (delicious) or tea (also available in the room) and continental breakfast. There is a bar in the lobby, with a short menu. Room service is available, as well. The location is in 7th arrondisement, bordering the St. Germain de Pres neighborhood, within walking distance of Notre Dame, Musee D'Orsay, Ste. Chapelle, the Seine, etc. It is also directly across the street from the Metro. The neighborhood has great brasseries and cafes, lovely shopping and is on the quieter side (for Paris), which we considered a real bonus. After touring all day, with lines and crowds, it was nice to get back to our home away from home. We would most definitely stay at the Hotel Cayre, and will try the other boutique hotels in this small chain of hotels in Europre.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff, typical small rooms”
Reviews.Author: skye1111
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in general and the staff was really welcoming and willing to help in any way possible. The first room we stayed in was reallllly small and we faced a cement wall, however, we asked to be moved and got a slighly larger new room that overlooked the street and had a little balcony. The rooms were very clean and comfortable, except they were quite small (but to be expected in Paris). This was also a really great location to do all our sightseeing - right next to a stop for the Metro. There were many restaurant options and we just loved trying them out... especially those with outdoor seating. Also, down the street, there was this awesome little crepe stand that we just fell in love with... nothing as good as a chocolate crepe! One thing to note is that it is much better to exchange currency at a local exchnage place nearby instead of the hotel desk (the hotel charges more). We had an overall great experience and would recommed it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Vickibat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on a first time trip to Paris (Feb. 2007). Upon entering the hotel, the atmosphere was quite welcoming. Modern decor, but not too modern or weird. The front desk staff were extremely friendly and immediately welcomed us to Paris. My room was small, but extremely cozy and clean. It had a modern feel. I really loved the windows that opened (although my windows opened to a small, empty area that just gave me a view of 3 walls -- I appreciated being able to open the windows and get some fresh air). The bed was a dream! The bed was so comfortable - not too firm and not too soft. The sheets and duvet were as soft as anyone would want. I loved crawling into bed at night. The bathroom was an adequate size and quite functionable. Water pressure in the shower was perfect! Housekeeping did a fabulous job, as well. I had cords gallore (hair dryer, curling iron, laptop, cell phone adapter, etc.), and they would always arrange my personal items and clean the room exceptionally well. What stands out to me the most about this hotel was its staff. After busy days of sightseeing and shopping, my cousin and I would return to the hotel and be welcomed by the front desk staff BY NAME! They would call out our names, and grab our room keys (they remembered which rooms we were staying in)... Hotel keys were always left at the front desk, BTW... which was extremely convenient (no rummaging around our purses or losing the keys, since they were always at the front desk). It was so fun to walk into the hotel lobby each day and be greeted by, "Bonjour, Vick-ee!" and "Bonjour, Jenn-E-fer!" We giggled like school girls and loved the attention and oh so friendly staff. Obviously, I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not cheap but good, clean, quiet and very good location”
Reviews.Author: JeffStranks
Reviews.Content: We had stayed here before (Jan 2006, following a great stay at K&K Vienna the year before that) and had no hesitation in going back. This time we got an upgrade to an executive room - which meant a bigger bedroom but still a pretty small bathroom. The really good things: - location: close to Boulevard St Germain and Les Deux Magots (etc), only 15 brisk minutes walking to Quartier Latin, close to Musee d'Orsay too - metro station 10m away! - clean, modern and quiet rooms - excellent breakfast - staff (we have no complaints whatsoever, quite the opposite, unlike 1/2 other reviewers here) Not so good? - bathrooms a tad small (though clean and with all you'd expect) - a bit expensive (though we got an internet rate of Eu224 per night, not bad for Paris in thjis location) - nothing else. Overall: not the place if you want to be right in e.g. Montmartre / Latin Quarter activity, but excellent if you want good location and clean modern rooms near an elegant and refined part of Paris (with loads of good restaurant/bar options close by)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great location, modern & family friendly”
Reviews.Author: DHD91
Reviews.Content: The room and service were excellent given the very affordable price. Our family (3 rooms) all got what each needed including excellent internet access, a beautiful view and extra feather pillows. The bathrooms are efficient (ie small) but clean. It is more of a modern international hotel rather than the sort of romantic small boutique that some might be expecting; but the service was wonderful and the staff is very helpful in terms of restaurants (the excellent le Clarisse restaurant was a delight) and the venerable Laduree patissier is an easy morning 10 minute walk that dispels the guilty pleasure of hot chocolate and the unforgettable almond croissant . We have been to Paris many times and usually stay at smaller more typical boutiques; but we will be back to the Cayre.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Donjii
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at the Hotel. The Metro stop is now open which is great. It gets you all over the city in minutes. Hotel is was very clean and the staff was very pleasant. We are pretty low maintenance travelers. The room was small, but it what was what I would expect in a major city. Beds were kind of weird being two twins pushed together. The room had all the normal amenities. I would suggest staying off the street side of the hotel. You can hear the metro in the morning underneath and we were on the 3rd floor. Lobby looked clean, had a computer, and a small café. You are probably better off going to a local café though. The area seemed very safe and clean. A few blocks away there were some government buildings that had police around. You are a few blocks walk to the river or you can take the metro and that will get you everywhere. The shower had quick hot scolding water and I think the floor in the bath was heated. Overall I would recommend it again to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, good neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: LA_woman99
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 nights at the K and K Cayre in Paris. Hotel in in a good area, across the street from the Rue du Bac Metro station, which is due to reopen on December 18th. The Solferino and Sevres-Babylon metro stations are 2 blocks away in either direction, so walking to these stations (even in the rain!) was not bad. My room was on the 7th floor, with a great view of Sacre-Couer. Room was not as small as expected, though not big by any means. Had a queen size bed, desk, chair, closet, flat screen TV. Bathroom was small but adequate. Room was immaculately clean. Hotel staff was very helpful, and all spoke English. Wake up calls and taxis were right on time. Several great cafes and shops within walking distance. Definitely felt safe walking around the area alone. As others have mentioned, the Shell station next store is great for water, croissants, snacks, etc. I would definitely stay here again. Taxi to/from airport is 50-60 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean but not boutiquey”
Reviews.Author: spannatraveller
Reviews.Content: The K&K Cayre looks impressive from the outside with a nice lobby and friendly reception staff. Tiny but clean room with all mod cons but although clean, new and modern, this is not, as it advertised, a boutique hotel. It is in a great location very near to the shops in St Germain but it is a taxi ride away to the main bar and restaurant area. Do try Le Christine on Rue Christine for a romantic, chic, fine dining experience. Alcazar, nearby is good for a more buzzing, trendy venue. Getting taxis is difficult and booking through reception is the best option, however, the meter seems to be on 7 or 8 euros before you even set off. The breakfast set up is a joke and all 3 mornings of our stay we were made to wait for a table when there were plenty of tables available. The breakfast maitre'd was one of the rudest people I've had the misfortune to meet (and boy are there a lot of rude people in Paris)! The selection was good however and breakfast is served until 12 on a weekend. Overall, we were disappointed as we'd paid for and expected a more boutique feel and probably wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: yorkiepup
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel after much research. We enjoy walking and found it to be within reasonable , if quite long, walking distance of most attractions and museums. The location is safe and there are fabulous wine cheese shops nearby. The hotel rooms were clean and serviceable, but disappointingly bland. I had hoped for confirmation and guidance in my choice of restaurants but the staff seemed disinterested. All in all, acceptable, not great.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice for 3 lady travellers”
Reviews.Author: Spindlelady
Reviews.Content: Yet another very reliable choice in the K&K portfolio of hotels. Liked the St. Germain location with easy access to splendid shopping (lots of chicshops and delightful Bon March department store; significantly less crowded than Gallerie Lafayette etc). Convenient location for cafes and restaurants, including Flore, Deux Magots and Petit Zinc but not over busy and noisy, easy walk to Musee d'Orsay, Louvre, Orangerie and Rodin Museums. Spotlessly clean with 3 bed room for mother and 2 daughters, very spacious by Parisian standards. Very good choice for breakfast with good deal avaliable by booking on line. Helpful, pleasant and professional staff. Comfortable seating area and bar. Already planning a return visit to our favourite city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: anonrockville
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights on a combination business-vacation trip. Great location on edge of 7th district. Metro stop is across the street-however, it's currently closed for renovation. The closest station is about 4 blocks away on Blvd St. Germaine. The front desk staff are very helpful. Good buffet breakfast which was included in the online rate we booked. Room was good size for Paris and nicely done (very modern style). A bit pricy but would definitely recommend for either business or holiday travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Very good Value”
Reviews.Author: mrs-welie
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel - Executive Rooms are best as they are reasonable size for Paris. They can also fit 3 people to a room and are happy to do so at an extra fee. Rooms are clean and the service is friendly and efficient. Get a room on the uper floors to the back of the building for excellent views over Paris rooftops - Room 704 has great views. Some rooms have balconies - you must request these rooms at check-in though and they will do their best to book you into them if you ask. We didn't eat at the hotel, but did use the free internet connections - mainly we were out and about from the minute we arrived. My only gripe is that this hotel is not as central as I would like to be in St Germain. Previously we have stayed in the Rue Bonaparte area which is much more central. However, it is only a small gripe and if I could lift the K&K and move the location I would. It is a very good friendly hotel and great value for money. We thoroghly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely delighted - very functional location , great staff”
Reviews.Author: sparkyanna
Reviews.Content: We were delighted and suprised at the quality of the hotel and staff who were more then proficient and enjoyable. This was out 40th anniversary and we have lived and traveled in other countries . We can only say that it was a wonderful stay, clean , attractive and pleasant room, excellent breakfast buffet and super neighborhood to stroll and to get to other locations.We will stay there again.Thank you KK Cayre

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: DanTColeman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in early September. This hotel offered everything that I could possibly want in a Paris Hotel. The room was small but quite comfortable and quiet. The free high speed interenet allowed us continuous Skype access. The staff was friendly, responsive and helpful. As noted in other reviews this hotel is within walking distance of markets, shops and sights. Outside the door are bicycles available for use while in the city. I would recommend this hotel and staff to any tourist or business person staying in Paris. Fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: droman120
Reviews.Content: My mom, sister and I stayed at the K&K for four nights in the first week of October. We got a triple room that was very spacious considering European hotel standards. The hotel was very clean, the service was excellent and the breakfast in the AM was more than sufficient. Location? Excellent. Walking distance to the Louvre, Orsay, Seine and right across the street from the Rue de Bac train station. I couldn't have found a better place. Definitely recommend it to anyone visiting Paris but do try to request a room in an upper floor so you can enjoy a nice view. We didn't have much of a view but then again we didn't spend much time in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Je T'Aime Hotel Cayre! Perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: StuckinNY
Reviews.Content: I don't know, maybe I just loved Paris. But I have to think staying in a place that was clean, perfectly comfortable and well situated had a lot to do with our pleasant stay in the city. We checked in too early for our room to be ready, so we walked down the block and had lunch at Cafe Flore. Came back, and were sent to Room 515 (our luggage followed b/c the elevator was too small for everything!). It was small but charming, with a balcony overlooking Blvd. Raspail. Bed comfy, lighting sufficient, working blow dryer. Didn't notice the heated floors, but the big bath towels were nice. It felt like home, not plush paradise, but home. Breakfast was included in our package. Everything was fresh enough and tasty enough, but certainly not decadent. I discovered their "Chocolat Chaud" (hot chocolate) later in the trip, but it was a nice treat every morning. We were worried about how the French would treat Americans after being warned, and the front desk help were the meanest people we met on the whole trip (which was not mean at all, but we met some fabulous Parisians!), but the fact was that they were helpful and efficient. Taxis and wake up calls came on time. We didn't hear any noise besides a bagpipe band walking under our window the first afternoon... We walked everywhere, never felt uneasy or unsafe coming back to this hotel. All in all, it couldn't have been better (maybe a little cheaper!), and we would def stay there again if and when we go back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ashley48
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Cayre for a week and loved it. We had a beautiful room on the 6th floor with a nice view. The bed was the most comfortable one I have ever had in a hotel and the breakfast was great, my husband enjoyed his smoked Salmon and Champaigne every morning! Location is excellent, right across the street from the metro station which is very handy when you come back late at night and you are exhausted. Staff was very friendly and went out of their way to please the guests. I picked this hotel based on people's review and I loved it. We will stay here again on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the K+K Cayre!”
Reviews.Author: pelbro
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at the Cayre. On the recommendation of other tripadvisor members, we requested a room on the 6th floor. We had a great view and weren't bothered at all by subway noise. The bed took up most of the room but it was very comfortable. The closet had plenty of hangers and a safe for valuables. The heated floor in the bathroom was a nice touch. The towels were big and fluffy and the slippers provided were much appreciated, since we'd forgotten our own. The staff were extremely pleasant and helpful. The breakfast selection was varied and breakfast hours were very convenient for our early morning starts. The hotel is in a great location, within walking distance of the Musee D'Orsay, the Eiffel Tower and the nightlife on Blvd Saint Germain. There are many interesting little shops and cafes on the nearby streets as well. I highly recommend the Hotel Cayre.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot in Paris”
Reviews.Author: megv21
Reviews.Content: After a sudden reschedule, we managed to book a room at the K + K Cayre during World Cup. The hotel is in a great location - within walking distance to the Latin Quarter and St Germain and a 30 min walk to the Eiffel Tower. Very close to Metro, which makes getting around the city very easy. We got a "deal" that included breakfast. The hotel was far more expensive that other places, but it was worth it. Breakfast was absolutely fabulous, although probably not worth the 24 euros they normally charge for it! Lots of fresh food, cheese, bread and coffee. The staff were very helpful - I overheard Reception helping a man send a case of wine overseas. The rooms were not too small (although not grand!), but very clean and a nice place to crash out after walking the city. We were on the first floor, with a courtyard facing room. It was very quiet at night - we could hear the rumbling of the Metro beneath us, but it was nothing to keep us awake. Overall, an excellent hotel for our Paris trip!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED THE K and K!!”
Reviews.Author: BetterU
Reviews.Content: My travel Buddy and I only had four days to spend in Paris and we planned to make the most of it. We are so happy we decided to stay at the K and K! The hotel is centrally located (Louvre, Notre Dame and Musee de Orsay are all within walking distance) with the Rue du Bac metro stop right across the street. The rooms are about what you would expect in a European hotel only better. We had two twin beds, a desk, a small table and two chairs, plus adequate clothing storage for two women and it was just perfect. The balcony was a great addition. It was wonderful to sit outside at night with a bottle of wine and reflect on the day. The staff was very helpful and suggested a wonderful place for dinner one night (Le Petite Chaize) that had a prix fix menu that was to die for. The room was spotless, the beds were comfortable and the bathroom had great storage and plenty of hot water. If I had to make a negative comment - the pillows were too soft (smile). I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a great Paris experience. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “The tiniest room available”
Reviews.Author: mechevarria
Reviews.Content: The lobby of this hotel was very nice. We encountered friendly staff during check-in and check-out. Having internet available was a double plus! After looking at the uploaded pictures, I believe we got assigned one of the smallest rooms available in the hotel. We expected a more spacious room and we only had enough room to walk between the bed and the wall. But we had a very conformable double bed. Our bathroom was poorly designed. There was no space in the sink to place any items on the counter due to the tiny physical size of the bathroom; as our room's location was on the corner of the building. Also, the water spilled out of shower every single time we took a shower, making a water mess on the floor. If we stayed here again, I would definitely ensure to get my room in a better location within the hotel. Other than that, the hotel was conveniently situated and beautiful decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hotel, perfect for our weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: M_AitaLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: While the room itself was tiny, I thought it had an efficient use of space and was comfortable enough for our short stay in Paris. The bathroom was definitely smaller than most bathrooms I've seen, but the heated floors and in-wall shelving really made the lack of space a non-issue. The beds were quite comfy, and the down comforter was heavenly! We had a corner room with no view or balcony, but we didn't mind, as we were hardly in the room anyway. What I loved most about the hotel was its close proximity to the metro, shopping and restaurants. It was a short walk down the Blvd St Germain to great restaurants (Les Deux Magots, Cafe Flore), Orsay Museum, and other attractions. They also had free internet access in the lobby, which is a small yet much appreciated ammenity. I also took advantage of the Shell gas station adjacent to the hotel for my bottles of Evian and snacks. This was definitely the way to go, as most places charge approx 5 euros for a small bottle of water or bottle of Coke. We didn't eat in the hotel, as there were too many great cafes nearby. All in all, the hotel was perfect for what we needed. No frills, small yet efficient space, friendly service, and close to the metro. We got a good deal on an air/hotel package through Travelocity, so it was also proved to be a great value too.

Reviews.Title: “Views, Service, Location AAA+ Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gary1726
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for the last night of our honeymoon at the end of August. On arrival we were presented with a bottle of champagne in our room which was worth about half of what I had paid for the room (book directly, its always cheaper)! Rooms are a little on the small side, but the service and location more than makes up for it. I had also asked for a room with a view of the eiffel tower and was not dissapointed, as we had a lovely view which made for some great pictures. Overall I would deffinatly recommend this hotel, and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: darya50
Reviews.Content: It was an excellent experience. The location and the hotel staff and everything about the hotel was wonderfull. The only drawback to the hotel is the room. The rooms are very very small. We did prepared ourselfs for it but still the size was a bit shocking. But I have to say the location and being so close to everything you wanted to see and experience in Paris make it worth to stay in a small room. I would definitly recommed this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, immaculate hotel without unnecessary frills”
Reviews.Author: walkdaearth
Reviews.Content: The room and lobby were immaculately clean. Well, the non-smoking room smelled a little like smoke, but the lovely balcony outside probably does invite smokers to sit outside, enjoy the view and smoke a few. When I say clean, it's saying something, because I am obsessive about cleanliness (read my other reviews). The service at the counter quickly thawed after the initial stone-faced moment, and immediately thereafter they were shyly friendly and extremely helpful. Excellent location, great shopping and sidewalk cafes immediately down the block, only the shortest of walks to Palace Louvre and Musee D'Orsay and Jardin Tuilerie. I would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “All was excellent”
Reviews.Author: EPellet
Reviews.Content: Exelent all except the size of the room

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fjsVancouver_Canada
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find in Paris. $ for $ the best hotel we have stayed in in Paris. Location is great - not smack in the heart of St Germain but a 5 minute walk puts you in the heart of the left bank restaurants and shopping (and tourists). Very clean, modern and stylish with helpful front desk - it actually looks like it's web site! The Metro is literally outside the front door, an bank ATM machine next door and a corner cafe for breakfast (we did not take the hotel breakfast as it was rather expensive) Some rooms look into a central courtyard which is very quiet. Others look over Rue Raspail - probably v.noisy, and others look over Rue du Bac - a charming neighborhood street with boutiques food stores and restaurants - the floors 5th and higher you can see the tip of the Eiffel Tower lit up at night - we stayed 4 nights in a courtyard room then on our return trip we had a 5th floor room overlooking Rue du Bac. Highly recommend this place if you are looking for a 'boutique hotel' type of experience.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Superb!”
Reviews.Author: DahliaFontaine
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I stayed at the K+K for a week in April. We had a lovely room on the 6th floor with a breathtaking view of Paris and Sacr'e Coeur. The hotel is incredibly clean and just marvelous! The room was tastefully decorated and had floor to ceiling French doors leading out to a romantic little balcony. The bed was very comfortable, as were the linens. The bathroom was flawless- beautiful, looked new and was impeccably clean. The room overall was an A+++++ The staff were very friendly and accomodating. We did not however have the occasion to eat at the hotel restaurant- also, there is a small bar in the lobby that looks nice. The fresh flowers that decorate the lobby and bar were exquisite! The hotel location is excellent, with the subway near by - I didn't hear any subway noise at all. Close walk to museums and everything! I loved this hotel and I recommend the K+K to my family, friends and anyone who would like to stay in an absolutely ideal hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice For Paris”
Reviews.Author: WKGTx
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a vacation to Paris with my wife and two daughters. We stayed 6 nights at the K&K, and had a great experience. This is a solid 3 star property, but not quite 4 star. Hotel - Rooms were extremely clean and well maintained. I chose to have 2 non-smoking rooms adjacent to each other, so sacrificed a view to get this request filled. No hint of smoke or odor in either room. In fact, the whole floor may have been non-smoking. As other reviewers have stated, the showers had great water pressure and plenty of very hot water. Beds were adequate. The daily breakfast buffet was included in my package. It was decent and filling, but not worth the 24 Euro price that was posted. Staff were very cordial and helpful. Location - We found the location to be ideal. Very quiet at night, but close enough to the major attractions so that travel was not a problem. Walked to the Louvre and other museums. The Metro stop in front of the hotel was great. Although not a major line, it was very easy to connect to other lines. We utilized the Metro and buses over cabs, and had no trouble at all getting to our destinations. No shortage of restaurants within walking distance. We will definitely have the K & K at the top of our list for future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: alex06
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 1st anniversary trip to Paris and we were so happy with our choice of the K&K. What we loved: The staff was personable, professional and accommodating. They happily met our last minute request for an early check-in, and our room, though tiny to be sure, was exactly what we requested upon booking: an upper-level room with a balcony and view. Although the room was small, it was very comfortable and very clean, with a large closet and a great, modern bathroom. And we loved having the french doors that opened onto the balcony. It was the perfect charming, romantic touch. We were pleased with the rates we received by booking online, and our package included breakfast, which we enjoyed each morning. The location was ideal. While its true that the Rue du Bac Metro stop is not particularly useful, short walks put you at either the Sevres-Babylone or St. Germain stops, both of which give easy access to most parts of the city. We tended to walk more than ride the Metro anyway, as we loved exploring the area around the hotel - there are tons of shops, cafes, etc all within a few blocks of the hotel, and the area is beautiful and feels very safe. Overall a wonderful visit, and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: SandyAtlanta
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the K&K was very good overall. The rooms are small but nicely decorated, no shabbiness in this hotel. One of the best things about this location is the metro (Rue du Bac) just steps from the door. The staff at the front desk is extremely polite, friendly, and willing to help. The free internet in the lobby is a nice touch for writing quick messages home (if you have time). :)

Reviews.Title: “Lap of Luxury in Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: TeamSmithski
Reviews.Content: Sophisticated luxury in prime location. Our week long stay in Paris for my husband and I was a delayed honeymoon and graduate school graduation celebration...so we wanted to spoil ourselves. We reserved a classic double room on the website after researching trip advisor one month ahead of time. Requested a room with a balcony+/ or a streetside view at the time of reservation. We were given room 610- which had a gorgeous bird's-eye view of the city from our balcony, including Sacre Coeur off in the distance! We were welcomed with a cold bottle of Evian water and candies. Our room was very quite, huge, clean, and tasteful. The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom immaculate. Free hi-speed internet and close proximity to the Metro were a plus. (Metro noise was not an issue, even from the lobby--normal big city street noise) Very safe, upscale area. Everyday, before venturing off into the city, we walked 5 minutes to Bon Marche- a wonderful fresh-food market- where we gathered sandwiches/cheeses/bread/fruit for a park picnic- Cafes, restaurants, and Parks are in close proximity, as well. We could easily walk to almost everysite in Paris- (L'Arc de Triomphe and Sacre Coeur were a little more difficult) Overall, an worthwhile indulgence!

Reviews.Title: “MixedFeelings ---some good some terrible”
Reviews.Author: Maxb
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent three nights at the K+K Cayre over this last weekend.We have mixed feelings about the experience.Firstly the good-the hotel is modern, nicely decorated and spotlessly clean.Our room was a very good size and very comfortable.Bathroom small ,but good storage and excellent shower as well as bathtub.Breakfast --lots of choice cereal, fruit ,yogurt, pastries as well as cheeses and cold cuts--all looked fresh and frequently replenished but I felt the quality was not really first rate---a bit kind of catering generic.Certainly not worth the 24 euros they charge if its not included in your deal.The hotel is located ,as others have said ,steps from Rue du Bac metro ---not the most useful line to be on.The garage next door is great for drinks and snacks.The area feels very safe but not really at the centre of things.The centre of St Germain which is buzzy and full of restaurants lovely shops etcis a 15 min walk.Around the hotel not much going on in the evenings. My most negative comments however are reserved for the staff at the front desk.They are not particularly helpful or friendly or indeed knowledgable.I really felt they were not interested in their guests or in enhancing their stay.Due to a spectacularly major screw-up by one of them we were initially left with nowhere to celebrate our daughters birthday dinner.After much upset they managed to secure us a reservation at an alternative place of our choice and ,in mitigation ,left a bottle of champagne in our room --which I felt was a nice gesture-but also that a mistake such as this should not happen in a hotel that calls itself 4*+.So bottom line -would we stay there again? No--partly because the location although "good" offers so little but mostly because the staff appear to care so little.Next time we will stay in the Marais where the rooms may be small but the district and its vibe more than makes up for this.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but no bargain”
Reviews.Author: ohioriver
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 days with my two daughters in June. The Hotel is nicely maintained and modern. We paid more for a room with three beds and I thought the room was extemely small even by Paris standards. Other than the closet there was no place to put away clothing. There is a subway stop just outside the hotel but it is a minor line and on just about any trip you will be required to make at least one tranfer. The area around the hotel has kind of a commercial feel to it. (THere is a Shell gas Station right next to the hotel which is a great place to buy snacks and water) I have on other trips stayed in Rue Cler and near the Pantheon and preferred those areas to that around this hotel. It is about a 3 -4 block walk to the main shopping areas in St. Germain des Pres. The lobby does have computers for guests use which we all used and was nice. Still the price compared to other hotels in Paris where I have stayed was much higher. If you are looking for value then this isn't your place.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: dbgjtc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 9 nights here at the end of May. Yes, the room was small, but it was the standard double so we weren't expecting a penthouse. The room was spotless, airy, had high ceilings, a terrace with a view of Montmarte, large comfortable bed, nice bathroom with heated floors and was very quiet even though we faced the street (we were on the 6th floor). The desk staff was extremely helpful and cheery. Three computers in the lobby for free Internet access (other hotels we've stayed in charged for this). As others have mentioned the Shell station convenience story is very handy for bottled water, fresh fruit and snacks. The best part is the true centrality of the hotel. As others have said, directly across the street is the Rue de Bac Metro stop which gives you easy access to pretty much everywhere. Some trips mean switching trains, but the number and letter system is pretty easy to follow once you get a sense of direction. This was our second trip to Paris. The first time we got around fairly well, but this time by the third day we were like natives. Also close by are bus stops. Busses are very easy to learn too. The routes can be a little confusing until, again, you get your bearings. Two blocks away from the hotel you can catch the #69 and it'll take you to Pere LaChaise. Interesting ride that'll help you learn the city. The hotel is also in walking distance to the Louvre, Musee de Orsay, Eiffel Tower, the Seine, Cathedral of Notre Dame...all the cool stuff. Restaurants are plentiful in the area. Some are pricy, others are just your basic bistro. It's best to discover places on your own. Go to Rue de Bourgogne (a few blocks away) and you'll see ten restaurants. We had a great, inexpensive meal at a Vietnames place called Le Lotus Blane. After you've visited Notre Dame stroll over to 30 Rue Saint-Louse en L'ile. Small, cozy, good food, good price. If you don't feel like French food and want something simple like pizza walk out the door, turn to the left, cross the street past the bistro on the corner, turn to your left again and you'll see both an Italian restaurant and the pizza parlor. Very tasty. The area is great for walking. We were out late and felt completely safe. The area is very high end. If you moved to Paris you'd want to live here. For our next visit we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern hotel, Cramped uncomfortable rooms, Poor value”
Reviews.Author: Ovid21
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the K&K Cayre for 2 nights in May 2007. This was at the end of a month long trip around Europe. We enjoyed all of the places we stayed on this trip, with the exception of the K&K. This hotel was a disappointment and (by comparison) was poor value for the money. We booked a standard double room using Orbitz.com paying Euro 245 per night ($331). Our room (#417) was very small, with barely enough room to walk around the bed. This was definately cramped quarters for two persons (probably OK for a single person traveling alone). Out of curiosity, I measured the dimensions of the room and found it to be about 10.8 m2 (116 ft2) including the bathroom and the closet. The furnishings & decor in the room were quite spartan, in keeping with the minimalist style of the hotel. The small bathroom did not appear to have adequate ventilation to remove moist air, and the room itself seemed stuffy unless the window was opened. The comments other travellers have made about the subway noise were definately correct. Even though we were on the 4th floor, we could hear & feel the rumble of subway trains passing under the hotel every few minutes until quite late in the night. The location near the intersection of Blvd St Germain and Blvd Raspail is very convenient, however, the presence of a Shell gasoline station next to the hotel detracts from the ambiance. On the positive side, the hotel is very clean, well maintained and apparently recently deocorated and renovated in a modern minimalist style. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. The hot breakfast buffet was also very nice. Our only real serious complaint was the size of the room. The hotel should be more responsible and advise those booking on the internet of the the room size so there are no surprises at check-in. We felt that we had received poor value for our money ... especially since we had stayed at another Paris hotel in the same neighborhood earlier in our trip which was very spacious and comfortable. Had we not pre-paid for the K&K room, we would have gone elsewhere upon seeing the cramped quarters.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: lizzieNyc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the K & K. Our room was modern and well-appointed. The staff was helpful with making reservations and arranging our transportation to the airport. The breakfast was wonderful! I certainly agree that this hotel is a four-star hotel rather than a three-star. We have been to Paris six times and this is, by far, our favorite hotel. We booked the K & K Cayre again for this summer when we visit with our entire extended family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Vivi28
Reviews.Content: Excellent location with the Metro station literally outside the front door. Clean, nice, good service. Nothing bad to say about this place. We even had breakfast at the hotel (which we weren't planning on doing) because it was so nice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - worthy of a higher rating!”
Reviews.Author: Alastair_Kate
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 nights as a Eurostar/hotel package through the Eurostar website and were delighted with both the method of travel and the quality of the hotel. It seems the K&K is rated a 3* on tripadvisor but at the time the Eurostar site rated it 4.5* - trust the Eurostar site - it is easily worthy of a 4* rating. The location of the hotel is excellent, set in a long leafy avenue of tall trees, in close proximity to a couple of cafes, and literally 30 seconds round the corner from a 7/11 style convenience shop. We got a good deal at the last minute, so although we stayed in this amazing hotel we were still travelling on a budget. The first night we ate out at a fantastic (but pricey) restaurant called Le Dauphin, and the second night we got some bread/cheese and wine from the 7/11 and ate in the park. The rooms in the K&K are excellent, fast working air-conditioning, large super-comfy bed and a fantastic marbled bathroom - and we were only staying in a standard double room on the 1st floor!! Unfortunately we didn't get a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower, but considering it was only a slow 30 minute (romantic) walk away that wasn't a problem for us. We had an amazing time; the customer service and check-in/out process couldn't be faulted, the cleanliness and comfort of the rooms was better than expected, and we wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anybody - romantic couples or business travellers alike. Next time we find ourselves in Paris we will definately be staying in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Al_Q2007
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the K&K Cayre for two nights May 18-19, 2007. The hotel is stylish and immaculate. We asked for a non-smoking room and initially they gave us a room that reeked of cigarettes; we went back down stairs and they grudgingly moved usto a "real" non-smoking room that was decent size, super clean, fairly new furnishings. Our rate of 260E included a very nice full American breakfast; we also used the free internet a couple of times. You can definately hear/feel the Metro very faintly, even on the 5th floor. As far asthis property's locations, St. Germain seems a bit more over priced than other parts of Paris. I think the proximity to the Latin Quarter invites "tourist gouging" - most if not all of the guests at K&K were Americans/Brits with a fewGermans thrown in. While there's easier access to the Latin Quarter and Louvre attractions from K&K, I prefered staying in the quiter less touristy rue Cler area. If you can get a package or seasonal rate at the K&K, say less than 220E, I would recommend staying here. Otherwise, you can probably find other hotels that give you more value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Everything as expected: Great!”
Reviews.Author: pcomm
Reviews.Content: Great visit. Location perfect, within walking distance of major sights, fine shopping and great food. Having a metro station across the street is extremely welcome. We had a very quiet, very clean, small but functional room. Breakfast was very, very good and plentifull, with cold cuts, cheeses, smoked salmon, bacon & eggs, etc...Service and housekeeping was top notch, and unobtrusive. We felt welcome. We will POSITIVELY visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Such a Lovely Experience”
Reviews.Author: StephaniB
Reviews.Content: I wanted to plan a girls trip away for my birthday in February and my travel agent recommended this hotel. I had done a bit of research on this hotel and just from the reviews online I went with this choice. Such a great decision. The hotel was so nice, and conveniently located to so many things. The Louvre, Musee D’Orsay, the Metro is right outside. Shopping is walking distance. I fell in Love with this Hotel and with Paris. I will definitely go back. The rooms were immaculate, and quite comfortable. I had read that all the hotel rooms in Paris are small, but our room was a decent size for two people. Two twin beds, a desk, chair, television, etc all fit comfortably inside our room. Not cramped at all. The bathroom was small, but nothing unusual. You could definitely maneuver well. There was breakfast every morning downstairs. Internet access in the business center. The staff is so friendly and extremely accommodating. I was very impressed for my First trip to Paris. I will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WellfleetBarrister
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week at the K&K on a 2d honeymoon. Overall, we had a satisfying experience. The staff were great and the entire place was immaculate. Many here comment on the room size. By American standards, our room was certainly small (Rm 504, I recall). There was a table in the room, but only room for one chair. If you both want to read the newspaper, one of you has to be on the bed. However, like many, we were out and about all the time, so it didn't make much of a difference. If I go back, I'll definately upgrade to a larger room (if there really is one). You can't beat the location. We went everywhere on the Metro. I also wouldn't worry about the comments re: the train noise. I heard it in the small fitness room on the lower level, but never in our room. The hotel recommends a restaurant, Le Ferme St. Simon, a short walk away. We were unimpressed. In addition, before we realized that tips of 15% were included in the check (it was our first night) the English speaking host conned me into leaving an additional 25 Euros. Definately soured me on the restaurant and the food was nothing to write home about. We had better meals at some of the many bistros down the street on St. Germain. Had an excellent experience at the K&K and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodations and staff”
Reviews.Author: siestagirl
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the K+K Cayre was a very pleasant experience. The front desk staff was courteous, well-informed, and helpful. Our room was a very nice size as was the bathroom. We liked the fact that the thermostat in each room was individually controlled. After a warm day of sightseeing, we looked forward to returning to a very cool room to relax. We also took advantage of the lovely breakfast included in our hotel package. The servers were very efficient and quickly replaced any foods that were in low supply. There were all kinds of choices on the self-serve buffet: scrambled eggs, bacon, cheese and meat assortments, fresh fruits, yogurt, cereals, pastries and breads as well as 3 juices and coffee/tea. Many people also enjoyed the smoked salmon and champagne which were offered as well. There was only one minor drawback.during our 6-day stay. While there was a metro stop directly in front of the hotel, it was a 15-20 minute walk to most of the popular restaurants on St. Germain de Pres Blvd. Of course, we didn't mind that as we like to exercise. However, the K+K's location was ideal for visits to the D'Orsay, the Rodin Museum, and Les Invalides. I definitely would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Paris. They will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great expectations met”
Reviews.Author: ryman001
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend in Paris with the Girlfriend. Having stopped in the K and K hotel in Prague. I thought I would try the one in Paris. I was not disappointed. Clean rooms, with stocked mini bar and a very efficient Air Con System. The staff are very friendly. Free Internet access in the Lobby. We did not make full use of the hotel since we were doing tourist stuff all weekend, We mainly just slept and showered in the room. Would stop here again We got a PARIS VISITE rail card for 3 days, ZOnes 1-5 38 euros each, go anywhere on SNCF or the metro. Location, very close to the St Germain area and only two stops from St MIchel, which is an eatters paradise. Travelled with Air France, I recommend using the internet check in and then the bag drop facity at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: johnnyutah97
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel and great value for the money. The rooms were spacious (for Europe) and the hotel staff was extremely friendly. Made my wife and I's first trip to paris a great experience and couldn't have picked a better location to tour the city. When we return we'll be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: LisaJ99
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel over the Easer bank holiday. No problems with the hotel - the staff were very firendly and the rooms were spotless although our room was a little on the small side with just a view over the courtyard. The hotel was ideally situated for all of the main parisian sights and it was just a 10 minute walk to the Eiffel tower. The weather was so good over that weekend that we didn't use the metro but rather walked everywhere. Speaking of the metro, although we were on the fourth floor of the hotel we could still feel and hear the metro rumbling beneath us. However it was only intermittent and would not stop us from staying at this hotel again. There are plenty of restaurants and bars within a short walking distance of the hotel in the Saint Germain district. All in all we had a pleasant stay at the hotel and if the price was right we would definitely use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all around”
Reviews.Author: skkansal
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed t the K & K Cayre for 7 nights this past month. It was an excellent experience all around. I'll go through each aspect separately so as not to forget anyhting. 1. Check-in was kinda painful but to no fault of the hotel. Our flight arrived at 8am and we got to the hotel around 10am. We couldn't get to our room until 2pm but they took our bags for us as soon as we got there. 2. The room was small but the bed was very comfortable. Not much storage space for clothes (or suitcases for that matter), but hey it's Paris. I thought it was worth the price we paid considering it is a 4 star hotel. 3. Bathroom was small, but again, well appointed. Large shower with good pressure and plenty of hot water. Floors are heated. Toiletries were pretty bad so bring your own shampoo/conditioner/soap. 4. Three computers in the lobby with fast internet access. They also have a fax/printer if needed. LAN and wired connection is availble in the rroms free of charge, but we didn't bring a computer to test it out. 5. Didn't check out the sauna/fitness center. 6. Breakfast wasn't bad. Scrambled eggs, bacon, various cheeses and meats (smoked salmon, salami, etc), fresh squeezed juices, croissants, champagne, cereals, yogurt, and fruit. Same thing every day though. 7. Staff were excellent. All front desk staff spoke English and were very willing to help in any way they could. 8. Location was very good with some caveats. It is located right on a subway which is a major plus. It is smack dab in the middle of all the sights - so much so that it is difficult to walk to AND from a sight. We walked to and subwayed home. Also, it's not right in the thick of it which is plus/minus. I originally wanted to stay right in the Latin Quarter...lots of action but lots of noise. Kinda happy that the hotel was in a quiet section of town but would have liked to walk two feet to find a restaurant. 9. We stayed on the 7th floor so the subway noise that others have mentioned was not an issue for us. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: JBGConklin
Reviews.Content: Wonderful experience. Terrific location,metro stop across the street. Very clean and staff very pleasant and helfpul. Breakfast buffet in am very nice- included mimosas. Great experience and good value. Would return there again or any other K&K hotel in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “An Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: malcolm40
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Cayre from March 29 -April 2. We were very pleased. The rooms are clean and the beds comfortable. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful - especially with dinner reservations. Our seven year old daughter was treated well by everyone. The small lobby bar provided a welcome respite (and an excellent house red wine "Le Dome"). This area of the 7th, at the intersection of Boulevard Raspail and St. Germain Des Pres is busy and active. The #69 bus that runs between the Eiffel Tower and Pere Lachaise cemetery (east/west) stops just behind the hotel - this is great for travel to many tourist destinations such as the Invalides, the Louvre and Notre Dame (Ile de la Cite). The Metro station Rue du Bac is located across the street. While not on a main line, you can get anywhere you need in a couple of stops. Bon Marche dept. store is 2 blocks away. My only reservation about the Hotel is the stuffiness of this particular area of Paris. While the Hotel is excellent, if you're looking for opportunities to mix with the locals, this isn't the place.

Reviews.Title: “Pokey Room 208”
Reviews.Author: LucLondon
Reviews.Content: Just returned after 4 night stay.perfect hotel and location but very disappointed in room 208 which is next to lift and it should never be classified suitable for 2 persons. you can hardly get around the wardrobe as t v tableis in front of it. Only a small window lookong over paved pathway. I wonder howmany rooms like it. Breakfast service very poor had to wait for 10 minutes for fried bacon to arrive at self serve point. On final day no hand towels were to found in bathroom. The bed very close to side tables with glass tops which could be dangerous.18" space between bathroom door and sink table. The bathroom tap modern but leaked at when used.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Henny111
Reviews.Content: Date: 26th March 2007 Reviewer: Henny111, Nottingham U.K. Just returned from a 3 night stay at the K&K Cayre Hotel, Paris. We had never been to Paris before and have had a wonderful time. The hotel was a real treat, very stylish and modern. Our room was on the small side but sunny and perfect for our needs. The street outside was noisy, but silent with the windows closed, and the air conditioning was efficient. Everything was spotlessly clean and neat. The bathroom was small but very well designed, with an excellent shower. We were on the 6th floor and were occasionally aware of the Metro passing underneath, but it was never a problem. The staff were without exception very friendly and helpful. We organised our stay through Airmiles and were supposed to present a voucher which we didn't have. It was not an issue and they treated us with the same courtesy as all the other "paying" guests. Breakfast was the usual spread of fresh fruit, cereals, pastries and cooked fayre. Fresh and plentyful. The location was fantastic, very central. We hardly used public transport as everywhere was walkable - take comfy shoes! I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough if you can afford it! We would love to return but will have to save up our Airmiles again!

Reviews.Title: “Great for a familiy,too”
Reviews.Author: BrittanyMpls
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at the K & K Cayre with our kids, ages 12 and 14. We had connecting rooms.(They got an upgrade to a very large room!) The bathrooms are spotless! The towels are so soft and large and the heated floors are wonderful. I will say that the train did keep me awake the first night for a couple hours, but then I got used to it. (We were on 5th floor.) The staff are so helpful with restaurant suggestions. The location couldn't be better with the metro station right outside the door. We used the Metro exclusively and it is easier to navigate than the tube in London. The gas station next door is a real convenience, especially with kids. Good place to grab large bottles of water and some fruit for the room. Tip: We hired a walking tour guide to show us the city through the internet "paris walking tours" and hired Daniel. He was amazing and made it so fun for the kids. It was to best way to connect with the city and learn much more than we would on our own.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dsloantx
Reviews.Content: The K + K Hotel Cayre was a perfect choice for our first visit to Paris. The hotel is in an excellent, central location, right across from the Rue du Bac metro stop. It is modern, attractive, clean and very comfortable. The staff is friendly and helpful, willing to recommend restaurants, give directions, or help you with any request. My favorite thing about our attractive and comfortable room was the bathroom. We loved the heated marble bathroom floor, of which I had read in other reviews. The tub is large and the water is hot - perfect for soaking away the pain and exhaustion of a hard day of sightseeing. We didn't partake of the breakfast - it looked great, but was expensive. Thanks to other reviewers, we checked out the Shell station for our morning coffee and croissants. I love French gas stations! We stocked up on water, cheese and pate here. Fresh baguettes and pastries are delivered first thing every morning. We plan on staying at this hotel on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A really great hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: DanCMidlands
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here over the weekend 17/18 March. When I booked I requested a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower as this was a wedding anniversary visit. When we arrived we were told that we had been upgraded to a room on the 7th floor. Being on the seventh floor means you're just above the surrounding six storey buildings and have an amazing view. The room was spacious and clean and it was easy to adjust room temperature. There were some nice attention to detail - welcome note etc. The staff were friendly and very helpful. Breakfast was great. There is good access to metro line 12 which was literally outside the front door. In the part of the hotel we were in you could hear the faint rumble of metro trains under the hotel but this wasn't a problem at all. I'd recommend this hotel to friends and family. We would love to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent location!!”
Reviews.Author: ellybell
Reviews.Content: I stayed at he hotel for 3 nights from the 12 March on a sightseeing trip with my husband. We both found the hotel excellent. This was the 3rd time that we have visited Paris and this was the best hotel by far. Our room was located on the 6th floor next to the lift. Inside the room was very spacious and modern. The room was very clean and decorated and furnished to a high standard. We both really enjoyed our stay and would suggest this hotel to anyone looking for a break in Paris. The Metro station really is just outside, although the station is not on a main line, we had no trouble getting around.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a excellent location”
Reviews.Author: mcnewton1968
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the K & K Hotel Cayre for one night on March 10, booking through the hotel web-site. I e-mailed the hotel asking for a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower and Les Invalides as it was my wife's birthday and the first time she has been to Paris. When we got to the hotel, check in was very smooth and the room was excellent: it was bigger than we expected, had the views I had hoped for, and a little balcony (Room 605 if you can get it!). Everything about the hotel was excellent: the room was clean, furniture was modern and stylish, the shower worked well, the safe was easy to operate and so on. Breakfast in the morning was a buffet but there was a good choice and teas and hot chocolate came quickly. The hotel is five minutes from the Musee D'Orsay and ten minutes from the Louvre over the Pont Royal. It's on top on Metro line 12 so you can get to the Place de la Concorde for the Champs Elysees very easily. The staff were polite and everything went perfectly. An excellent hotel which I highly recommend to other visitors to Paris

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the First Time Visit”
Reviews.Author: NorthwestGirlinATL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked our rooms at the K+K based on reviews we read on trip advisor. We stayed for 4 nights March 1-5. The location was pretty good. The Shell station next door has water, bread, wine, fruit, cheeses, snacks, etc. It's great to stock up or pick something up late at night when everything else is closed. The metro station is right across the street, but the metro line never seemed to get us where we wanted to go without 2-3 connections. Often, we felt it was just as easy to walk to the site or back to the hotel since it really is in the center of so many things, but not next door to anything in particular. I kept thinking it would be better to be next to (or a few blocks away from) one of the metro station hubs like Concorde. (However, I'm a maximizer and my husband thought I was in my 'the grass is always greener' mode.) There is a great brasserie on the corner of St. Germain and Raspail that we stopped at for breakfast and late night desserts (crepes with Grand Marnier) and several places to grab sandwiches and pastries for the day. The staff at the hotel were wonderful and very helpful. We felt the rooms were very spacious (compare to the rooms we stayed in during a trip to Italy - Rome, Florence, Venice). The bathroom was modern and suitable for one at a time. (We're average size people, but our parents are heavier set and older and we felt they would probably have had issues/complaints with the bathroom size). We had a room facing the courtyard, which was fine since we only spent time in our room getting ready in the morning, getting ready to sleep, sleeping and some.... There have been reviews that note the noise/vibrations of the metro can be bothersome. We were on the 3rd floor and neither of us ever noticed it. But, we were so exhausted after our 16 hour days of sight-seeing (and lounging at the cafes people watching), that we slept very well each night. There are two internet stations and a business office (which I used to print our boarding passes). Overall, we would recommend this hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect with one exception”
Reviews.Author: bddoughty
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the K+K Hotel Cayre for four nights beginning February 22, 2007. This is a wonderful property professionally managed by a devoted and enthusiastic staff. I would agree with all the positive comments in relation to accommodation, location and atmosphere. The morning buffet breakfast, free access to internet, attentiveness and friendliness of the staff were all notable. That said I consider myself a bit rude in stating that for me the vibration from the metro, though only noticeable late at night when things quieted down, was distracting. At my request I was accommodated a room change from the fourth to the sixth floor. Much better but still detectable. I managed by running the fan from the AC. If you are the type who can tune these things out, you will not be bothered.
