If you are the type who cannot, this distraction will impact your stay; however, all the wonderful things associated with the hotel will likely make up for it. Which is why even given my criticism I would rate my overall stay as excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FlyAndLearn
Reviews.Content: While on a business trip, I took my teenage son along with me to see Paris during the week of February, 6th 2007. We arrived late on a Tuesday evening and were met by the front desk manager, Jean-Pierre. Since we were tired and had read previous TA reviews, we knew to ask for a room on the upper floors for the rooftop views of the city. After making this request, the manager immediately accomodated our request and changed our room to a 7th floor location with awesome views. From that point on, our stay at the hotel was fantastic...our room was spotless, the morning breakfast perfect and even the small spa was excellent. This is clearly a well-managed hotel from top to bottom and I hope someday to return with my entire family. The location in the heart of St. Germain cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Arie-Mordejai
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel last week. This is our 7th trip to Paris, and so far this has been the best hotel we have stayed at. The location is wonderful, the hotel is the perfect size, not to big, not to small, the staff is extremely helpful. Rooms are small, but not smaller than most hotels in Paris we have stayed at. The are well furnished and comfortable. We found many guests that are repeat costumers of this hotel. This is the highest compliment you can give any establishment.

Reviews.Title: “K & K, The Best”
Reviews.Author: Katinthehat
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I stayed at the K & K for a week at the beginning of February. We stayed at the K & K after reading all the great reviews on Trip Advisor. This hotel was great! All of the staff was extremely helpful and pleasant. I had requested a high floor with a view. They gave us a beautiful room with a view of the Eiffel Tower. It doesn't get much better. The room was spotless. The maid had left robes for both of us to enjoy during our stay. The breakfast in the dining room was wonderful with fluffy eggs, fresh fruits and champagne! We used the Shell gas station next to the hotel for bottles of water, creme fraishe and a bottle of wine...ooo la la. The Metro station, Rue du Bac, being right across the street from the hotel was super convenient. Believe me after a day of touring Paris not having to walk far from the Metro to "home" was a delight. We loved walking around the area at night and looking in all the stores and cafes on St. Germain. We had a fantastic time at the K & K and we will definitely stay there again. Thank you K & K. Kathie from New York, NY

Reviews.Title: “Great location but watch the bill”
Reviews.Author: pcoppack
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a great location. The rooms aren’t exactly big but they are modern and well presented. The bathroom although very nice (black marble) is very small and closteraphobic. We were on one of the top floors which was a relieve as there is a tube running under the hotel that you could still feel. What really let the hotel down was when we left we were charged more than the rate we booked it for and when we asked for an explaining they said it was the conversion from £ to Euros’. When we question the exchange rate they used (as it was around £40 more for 2 nights) we were told there must also be a conversion charge of which they wouldn’t say what it was.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: e_vil_bili
Reviews.Content: K+K was recommended by a trusted friend. i have nothing negative to say. I got a very good room on the top floor; i attached a couple pictures of the view from my room. i booked using the hotel website. the room was always clean and well kept. same for the lobby, restaurant and fitness center. The hotel staff was kind, pleasant, helpful and never rude and their english was more than adequate. the bathroom in the room was very good, the shower had great pressure and a nice shower head. the bathroom floor is heated. the bed was firm but comfortable and the sheets and blankets were clean and warm. the television had a good selection of french, english and german stations. the closet space was ample. The Shell station next door is great as you can get food at reasonable prices. This is not artsy and atmospheric like a W or the Mercer in NYC but the decor is tasteful and unobtrusive. The location was very good, short walking distance to Louvre, Orsay, Orangerie, Seine and Champs-Elysees and upscale shopping. Farther walking distances to Notre Dame, Place Vendome and Pompidou but managable for people accustomed to traipsing around big cities. K+K has great access to subways. The two concierge restaurant recommendations were quite good. The neighborhood is on the left bank and very good in terms of safety and accessibility though a little quiet at night. i will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: threeamigas
Reviews.Content: My mother, my aunt, and I spend a great deal of time traveling through Western Europe. We were accustomed to the smaller size rooms and general lack of amenities - then we stayed at the K&K. It was terrific! We stayed in a large triple on one of the higher floors (we did not hear the subway as some other reviewers have commented). The staff was great and the rooms were extremely comfortable; decorated in a more modern style. The location is fantastic! You are within walking distance to the Louvre, the Musee d'Orsay and, if you don't tire too quickly, even Notre Dame. I will note that there is no need to eat in the hotel's restaurant if it is not part of your package. There are many lovely cafes around the area and, if you want a snack, just go to the petrol station next store. In addition, shopping in the neighborhood (St. Germain de Pres), while fun, is a bit expensive. The concierge gave us some tips on where the "average" Parisian shops and, after walking only a few blocks south, we spent a terric day shopping to our hearts content without feeling too much pain of the purse. One high recommendation if you are looking for nice original and not overdone costume jewelery - go to Saoya on the Rue de Rennes. Finally, everyone in Paris is nice and helpful - don't believe the rumors!

Reviews.Title: “Shockingly nice!”
Reviews.Author: VAINLA
Reviews.Content: Being a bit of a hotel snob, I was hesitant to stay at the k & k. I listened to a friends advice though and booked 4 nights there between Christmas and New Years and it was amazing! Granted it is quite basic...the lobby area is nothing to write home about but it was clean and roomy and offered 2 computers with internet access for use. They also served a nice compimentary breakfast. They said it was a "continental" breakfast but was so much more...Salmon, cheeses, pastries, yogurts, cereals, eggs, juice, champagne. It was such a treat. The room was roomy and quiet and clean. Nothing was worn looking. The heated floors in the bathroom were a treat. I've slept in more comfortable beds but it was fine. The guys at the front desk were super friendly and helpful. The location is wonderful too. We moved to a much more expensive hotel (Urban Murano) for a few days as a "treat" but it was horrible! We should have stayed at the K & K the whole time!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the K+K Cayre. Will definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: superyooch
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the K+K Cayre hotel for 4 nights in October 2006. I loved everything about this hotel. The location was great, the rooms were clean and modern and the service was excellent. English is no problem for the staff here, and the free internet in the lobby is very handy. The location – The hotel is located in St. Germain, right across the street from the Rue Du Bac metro station. The district is mostly known for its high end shops and various restaurants. It was a 10 minute walk to the Louvre and other landmarks. Having the metro station across the street was extremely convenient. There are tons of restaurants and shops around the area, but there is no nightlife. For more on late night restaurants and lounges, I think Latin Quarter would be a better pick. I liked coming home from a long day of walking to a nice quiet place. The hotel room – The room is decorated with extremely modern furniture and clean lines. Think a much higher end of Ikea. It was a decent size for European standards. The bathroom was very nice and modern as well. Marble countertops, glass showers and enough toiletries to last you for a week. My boyfriend and I aren’t too picky with rooms as long as it was clean and pleasant. We had a room on the 6th floor with a floor to ceiling window that opened up into a small balcony. We had a view of the Sacre Ceour, which was gorgeous at night when it was lit up. Ask for a room on the higher floors with views. I emailed the hotel before I went on the trip requesting for non-smoking room with a king size bed and a view. They emailed me back the next day and told me that they would accommodate me. It was nice that they were so responsive. Quite honestly, we did not spend a lot of time in the hotel since we were walking around for most of the day. Restaurants – There was only one restaurant in the hotel which we never ate at. I was not complaining since there were plenty of other places to choose from around the area and in Paris in general. My favorite place for breakfast was this bakery called Le Croissanterie. They had the most variety and most delicious pastries. It’s baked on premise so it was fresher than anything. The sandwiches are also worth trying. Service – When we checked in, the guy asked jokingly if we were on our honeymoon. We said no, but when we came back to our room after lunch, there was a bottle of champagne and 2 glasses for us anyway. We thought it was extremely nice of the staff. The room was always cleaned and well stocked every day. We spoke English to everyone in the hotel and was not snubbed or treated unfairly. Feel free to ask the guys at the front desk for restaurant recommendations. My boyfriend had a craving for mussels so they recommended a nearby restaurant that served only mussels. Not only did he tell us about the restaurant, he printed out a map and showed us how to walk there. All in all, I enjoyed my stayed with K+K Cayre immensely. It was a great hotel. Nothing beats the location. You will be thankful that the Metro is literally right across the street after a long day of walking. Tip – There is a gas station next door to the hotel. Buy water/beverages/snacks there. It will save you tons of money. The Catacombs is a must visit, as well as Versailles. If you plan on visiting Versailles, plan to spend a whole day there, there is a lot to see and well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A lot to love at this modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavidLau
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the K+K Hotel Cayre for a weekend in Paris. I booked through their website and got their internet winter special prices. I was very happy with the high quality room that we got for reasonable prices. I don't know how to give it higher praise then to say I think I found our regular hotel in Paris. Hopefully, we'll be returning through the years. Some travel websites rate this hotel as 3-stars, for me, it's definitely a 4-star property. So many things that are just right about the place: * classicly style building with up-to-date facilities * stylish modern decor throughout * friendly and professional service from the front desk staff * Good location in the eastern side of Arrondisement 7 - bordering St. German (Arr 6), metro station in front, Rue du Bac for shopping, close to Museum D'Orsay, 4 blocks away from Le Bon Marche department store. The Seine river is 5 blocks away in the other direction. * free broadband in the rooms, public computers and wifi in the lobby, free business center * down comforters, comfy beds * AC/heat was comfortable * QUIET location, good sound-proofing * good water pressure * good breakfast buffet that's served till 11am on weekdays and noon on weekends (for you late-raisers). The rooms were not gigantic, but large enough. The decor is modern with dark wood furnishings, high quality bedding, clean white walls. Again, the bathroom wasn't gigantic but it did have some empty glass shelves that are very useful for holding our travel toiletry bags. I didn't have time to check out their exercise room in the basement.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jolu40
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel in a great location. This hotel is within walking distance to all major sites in Paris. A five minute walk to the louvre and D'Orsay museuems surrounded by cafes and shops. The restaurant at the hotel is very over priced and we just went to the cafes around the corner or the convinence mart at the gas station. We had one problem however we booked the room on hotels.com and booked what we thought was an exectutive double. The room we were in was so tiny my husband And I couldnt fit to walk around the bed and we didnt have any space for our luggage. Our single friend booked thru another web site, a standard room ,and her room was much larger with a table and room to walk. She was paying alot less than we were. The problem is that all the rooms are standard or junior suites. We asked to switch to a larger room as we were very uncomfortable. After three days of trying to correct this and being told we had booked on line and they couldnt do anything they finally changed our room to the same type as our friend. A call to hotels. com gave us a refund on the difference so everthing finally was solved. Just make sure you book the correct room but I would return here as the location is fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Yet Another Satisfied K&K Cayre Guest”
Reviews.Author: Madfred
Reviews.Content: The K&K Cayre Hotel in Paris continues to gain accolades for it beautiful property, courteous and professional staff and wonderful atmosphere. After reading many reviews and with the final endorsement from our trusted travel agent, my husband and I were off on our first trip to Paris. We flew from New York City and arrived on Dec. 31st to celebrate the new year and our wedding anniversary and stayed for a week at the hotel. Upon arrival, we were able to store our luggage, as we were a bit early, and went exploring. Everything in the reviews were exactly as described, from the Shell station next door to the metro across the street. The lobby was very modern and cheerful, just as one would expect a boutique hotel to be. Our room had a king-size bed and and was quite large enough for two people with luggage. The heated bathroom floors were very much appreciated as well. We checked out the fitness center but didn't use it as we got a lot of walking in during the week! We did use the internet and was glad of its availability. Each morning we visited the cheerful breakfast room. Our package included breakfast, and even my husband, who is a health nut, appreciated the fluffy eggs, bacon and fresh fruit and breads, to accompany his bowl of granola each morning. We also spent time relaxing one evening in the bar area with other guests as we drank wine and planned our next day's activities. Hat's off to the the staff at K&K Hotel Cayre Paris! They are all the most professional, courteous and efficient group I have met in a hotel setting and they do it all with a sense of humor and lots of patience. They were always ready and able to provide us with any thing we needed. My husband and I both are looking forward to our next trip to Paris and we will definitely stay at this hotel. In fact, we've told all of our friends to stay there as well.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shirley12LosAngeles
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. My husband and I stayed here in September during the gorgeous fall weather. The K&K is very welcoming and located in the perfect St Germain Des Pres location. Our room was small as other reviews also state, but held our two suitcases and we could get to the bathroom and the door just fine. The bathrooms are updated and clean. The bed was the most comfortable on the entire two week trip in which we stayed in 5 hotels. The rooms also have air conditioning units which made the room extremely comfortable and quiet. The hotel offers two computer terminals which was extremely helpful. They were easy to access and available at any time. There is a restaurant in the hotel that we didn't eat in after reading the other reviews on this site. Plus, there are so many places within a block or two that are very good and less expensive. I would definitely return to the K&K the next time we are in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, expensive but worth it!”
Reviews.Author: bookaholic5
Reviews.Content: My friend and I traveled to Paris in October 2006 for 5 nights. We booked our stay through [----], which gave us a better price than most sites, though it was still more than we had planned to spend. However, it was totally worth it! We had reserved a standard room. About a week or so before our trip, I e-mailed the conceirge to request some help with a dinner reservation. In the course of these e-mails, I reconfirmed our room requests, adding that we would love to have a view of the Eiffel Tower. The conceirge responded that they could not guarantee anything, as they had limited rooms and they were in high demand (as I expected). However, we were pleasantly surprised when we got to our room (#704) and discovered a wonderful view of the Eiffel Tower! It was a definite bonus. The room was very nice, very clean, simple but comfortable. It had 2 twin beds and a couch, a desk, a table and two chairs and a cabinet with minibar. The complimentary high speed internet was wonderful and we had no problems at all with it. The bathroom was small but functional, though more counter space would have made things easier. The location is excellent...it's about as central as you can get. The Rue de Bac Metro station is literally steps away, right across the street. This is not a major line, but we had no problems transferring and getting around. I HIGHLY recommend the Carte Orange. Just make sure to take your own passport-sized picture. We had to get them taken there and it wasn't cheap. It was nice to have one pass that covered the Metro and bus, so we didn't have to worry about having exact change or about language barriers. The staff was exceptional...extremely polite and helpful with every request. There is a Shell gas station just up the street, which is nice and convenient for getting snacks and water for in the room. The French bread we got there was better than any bakery French bread here in the states! Needless to say that the French bread from the patisseries was out-of-this-world! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and would love to stay here again. The view definitely made the cost worthwhile. We loved coming back to the room after a long day, having wine, cheese, and bread, and watching "the show" of blinking lights on the Eiffel Tower. Wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Charming”
Reviews.Author: ob2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (both early 50s) stayed at the K+K in early December. We had never been to Europe and spoke minimal French. The hotel was perfect for us. It's located in a residential area with many very charming shops, cafes, etc. The front desk staff were all great. They helped out with restaurant ideas (loved la Petite Chaisse a couple blocks away), reservations and even gave me a french lesson for the metro. We had an all night flight and were given the option of checking in at 7:00AM if we took a room on a lower floor with a street view. We were so tired we went for it, even though we had requested a higher floor. After all my research on Trip Advisor, I had visions of the room shaking everytime the metro went by. We really didn't notice it at all. We even slept with the french doors open a couple nights and were not bothered by street noise. Loved that Shell Station next door (great cheap wine and snacks), the metro across the street and the breakfast (which was included in our package). I wouldn't hesitate to stay at the K+K again--I hope I get the chance!!.

Reviews.Title: “Another nice stay at a K+K Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lisampls
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend (Brian) and I traveled to London and Paris over our Thanksgiving holiday...staying at the K+K Hotel George in London from the 22nd to the 25th (I did a review for that as well) - then we headed to Paris to the K+K Hotel Cayre for the 25th - 28th.. We chose the K+K Hotels because Brian had stayed at the Cayre a few years ago and thought it was great. Here are my impressions... We got to the hotel around 4:00 - so no problem getting right into our room. The lobby was very clean and uncluttered...couches to sit on to the right and a little bar with more seating to the left. Just beyond the front desk to the left was the breakfast room which was bright and airy with again, plenty of seating (I'll get back to breakfast later.) Our room... We were on the 2nd floor (204 - non-smoking!!) overlooking one of the side streets with cute little shops (I'll try and find the name.) It wasn't views of the Eiffel Tower, but it was very Parisian and we spent some time out on our balcony people watching. When the balcony doors were closed we were impressed by how quiet it was - it made for good sleeping!! Furnishings were minimal but what you need - bed, nightstands, a table and chair, as well as a desk and chair. There is a flat-panel TV (which we never even turned on) and a mini fridge in the cabinet below. The room is small, but not THAT small. We utilized the closet and the suitcase stand and we were just fine. The room seemed to have been recently updated. We were pleased to find a "real" fullish-sized bed (not two pushed together) with very nice (and clean!) linens. The comforter is down and there is a blanket in the closet for those of you who get too warm with down. The pillows are very comfortable as well - not the typical paper thin, rock hard numbers we've all encountered! The room had free wi-fi which we made use of every day - but if you don't bring your laptop, there are two computers (free usage) just off the main lobby by the elevators. Nice touch. The bathroom was small. Very small actually, but again, it's not like you spend that much time in there. The counters are granite, the shower is tile and the granite floor is HEATED! That to me made up for the room being so small!! There was always hot water and the pressure was excellent. There is a hair dryer in the bath and they do provide products - though as I found with the hotel in London, I wasn't crazy about the products and the hair dryer was no match for my thick hair and I had to try it in stages for fear it would blow up! Okay, maybe not blow up, but it got very warm in my hand. I'm sure you ladies will understand... There is also a small fitness room and massage area on the lower level complete with a sauna and showers. If you are interested in getting a massage, you must book in advance as their hours are limited. You can get a massage on off-hours, but you will pay extra for it. We didn't utilize the fitness room, though one morning when we overslept, Brian went down there and showered so we could both get ready at the same time...so that was really convenient to have that option. The front desk staff were polite and helpful. They weren't quite as chatty as the crew in London, but they did they're jobs efficiently and were kind enough to help with directions and suggestions when asked. They did help us make reservations at the Buddha Bar our first evening - which we never thought we would be able to get on such short notice (it was excellent!!!) The location is ideal if you like to walk, take the bus, or prefer the metro..... We walked to the Louvre twice and the Eiffel Tower - so the sites are within comfortable walking range. We also bought a mulit-day metro pass which we utilized to get to Notre Dame (The Rue de Bac station is literally across the street from the hotel.) I must say that their metro isn't quite as easy to navigate say compared to London's. We weren't in any particular hurry so we got on the trains we THOUGHT we were supposed to get on and hoped for the best! Luckily we didn't have any major problems. I suggest if you want to use the metro take your time and study the maps in the station and don't be afraid to ask the metro employees for help - they are all over the place. Okay, back to the hotel... Breakfast was included in our rate (which was around 200 euro) so we did eat at the hotel every morning. We found it to be filling and they did replenish the items right up until 11:00. One morning we overslept and got down there at about 10:55 and the staff didn't seem bothered by it. There are eggs and sausages if you want something warm, or there is the traditional meats, cheeses, breads, pastries, cereals, etc that you typically see on European breakfast buffets. The coffee was strong and the juices seemed fresh squeezed. There is also complimentary champagne (a little to early for us!) There are plenty of great little restaurants close by, as well as the Shell station right down the street...you could grab breakfast or lunch in a flash for little $$. The location is ideal, the neighborhood is charming (i'm sad we didn't have more time to explore the great stores nearby!) and we felt very safe walking even late at night. Oh, and to address the metro rumblings below...I remember reading about it in some reviews before we left, but I never thought about it (or felt it for that matter) until we were having breakfast on our 2nd morning. To me it almost felt like a really big semi was driving down the street in front of the hotel - less the noise. It passed quickly and it really wasn't a big deal. Overall I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and I'm pretty confident that we'll be back someday - hopefully sooner than later!! If you have any questions, please feel free to send me a note at lisajla@hotmail.com. HAPPY TRAVELS!! Lisa Minneapolis

Reviews.Title: “Perfect family hotel”
Reviews.Author: itsasmallworld
Reviews.Content: Our family of eight booked 3 rooms (2 triples and 1 double) for our 5-night stay in Paris during Christmas week. We were so pleased with K+K Cayre and feel that we couldn’t have picked a better place for the price. I asked for the 3 rooms to be as close as possible. Sure enough, we had the three corner rooms on the 4th floor. Our triple rooms had different floor plans but each was spacious. The down blankets were so soft and warm. We loved the in-room coffee/tea service and the heated bathroom floor. The staff was friendly and helpful. They offered great restaurant suggestions and answered questions cheerfully. I requested wake-up calls on most mornings and it worked out well. I wrote the hotel prior to our arrival to request tickets to Disney Paris. When we arrived, the tickets were waiting for us upon check in. I saw the lines for tickets once we arrived at the park and was so thankful that Franck at the reception desk had arranged the tickets for us - this saved us a tremendous amount of time. The breakfast was included in our rate, so that worked nicely. The breakfast room to the left of the lobby is cheery and bright – such a nice way to start the morning. The coffee was terrific and the hot and cold breakfast selection was quite good. The mini baguettes and the sugar bread were baked fresh daily, eggs and bacon were hot, and the fruit, cheese and pate selection were good. As many reviewers had commented before: The metro is across the street, the convenience store is next to the hotel, two computers with internet access are in the lobby, many restaurants and cafes are within close proximity to the hotel – what more can you ask for? As far as the comments on the rumbling of the metro, I did feel a mild rumbling as the train passed underground when I was in the breakfast room on the ground floor. However, we had rooms on the 4th floor, so it was not a problem for us. I would definitely stay here again and highly recommend this hotel for families. Thank you to all the previous reviewers for your comments which helped us decide to stay at this wonderful hotel. One more thing – we used Private Tours Paris [--] for all our transportation and touring needs. They were excellent! I will post a separate review under tours, Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...but higher floors are better”
Reviews.Author: Lady_Beancounter
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel the weekend before Christmas 2006. We booked this particular hotel based on the reviews of TripAdvisor and agree with the previous comments posted. We had booked via Expedia ("special rate") so I wasn't too surprised to be given room 114 - I suspect the higher floors were given to guests paying a higher rate! The room was on the small side but no worse, and compared to some, a lot larger than other Paris hotel rooms I've stayed in. The decor was clean and I liked the flat screen TV. The marble bathroom underfloor heating was delightful and a nice little touch was a nail file amongst the toiletries in the bathroom. My husband, loath to be parted from his laptop, found the free internet connection in the rooms very useful and also the wifi in the hotel lobby. We tend to be the sort of guests who don't use much of the hotel services so can't comment on those but the staff were welcoming on arrival and checkout. For breakfast we walked down Boulevard St Germain - there are no shortages of restaurants and cafes a few minutes walk away. My only niggle was that the first floor (and lobby), were subject to rumbles every few minutes from the metro. I am not sure how high up you would have to be to escape it. Having said that, having the metro a few steps away from the hotel door, was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & Comfortable - BEST shower.”
Reviews.Author: kmuffins7
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the K+K Cayre on my trip to Paris last week, and it was a lovely stay. The room was quite small, but it was comfortable and always quiet. The bathroom tiles heat up beneath your feet, and the shower is exceptionally powerful & relaxing. I ended up taking 3 showers a day, just for the relaxation aspect... Major bonus : The Rue de Bac metro station is right across the street, which made for super-easy transportation all over the city. Another bonus - there's a Shell station located just next door where you can get all convenience store items, and they even have a pretty good selection of wines. Overall, I enjoyed the K+K Cayre, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Juilletdix
Reviews.Content: My decision to book this hotel was largely based on input from Trip Advisor and most of what I'd read was completely accurate! I booked the room through the American Express website at an average rate of $279/night, but I got to apply some Membership Miles to the total cost. We booked a Classic room that did not include breakfast because we knew that we'd prefer getting coffee and croissants in the neighborhood to spending $30/each on breakfast. Thanks to TA, we already knew about the Shell station next door and this was a great "amenity" alllowing us to purchase cheap snacks and bottled water. When we arrived at the hotel on Thursday (4 hours after arriving at CDG due to some "incident" on the RER B). We were lucky enough to be able to check in early, but I was disappointed to find out we were in room 114. Having seen pictures posted on TA, I was hoping for a higher floor. I asked if we could wait and get a better room and was told emphatically "No!", so we had to make due. While our room overlooked Blvd Raspail, it wasn't really that bad. And we got to use the stairs instead of the extremely slow elevator. Personally, I would consider the K+K to be a 3 - 3.5 star hotel rather than a 4. Most of the staff were helpful, but we are pretty self-sufficient travelers. The most I asked for were some dinner reservations. The location is fantastic and I would definitely stay here again, if I could get a similarly good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: dantoon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our "babymoon". Upon arrival a bottle of champagne was delivered to our room and the staff could not have been more pleasant and helpful. They gladly answered all of our questions and assisted us whenever we needed help. The maid cleaned the room to perfection everyday. The location was perfect for a 7 month pregnant woman to be able to walk to so mnay places and use the metro/buses for so many more. The room was a bit smaller than we are use to, but was very nice. It was very quiet as well. Overall this hotel was an amazing part to our stay. The ability to use the internet was also very helpful. The breakfast though expensive was really good also. We can't say enough about the staff at the hotel. They went above and beyond for our every need. They truly made the stay wonderful. We would highly recommend this hotel. It was the perfect location with the perfect staff.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem for Value, Service, Comfort and Convenience”
Reviews.Author: HelloThereAgain
Reviews.Content: My wife and I agree with the vast majority of fellow travelers that this property is terrific for its location, helpful front desk, excellent breakfast buffet, clean rooms, attentive maids, comfortable beds, noise-proof windows, and warm marble bathroom floors. We add some other observations that might be helpful. First, we recommend booking the room through a travel agent or part of a package and checking for promotions. We were able to get a fantastic rate well below the rack rate. Second, this property has the distinction of lacking the ever present odor and stain of cigarettes so common to hotels in France. Whether owing to some policy, great ventilation or the general lack of smokers, the lobby, breakfast room and rooms were refreshingly free of smoke and smokers. Also, there is a nice, small workout/relaxation/sauna room downstairs with direct elevator access that offers complimentary terry cloth robes and slippers. Speaking of which, the bath towels in the sauna area, as well as in the room, must be the whitist, fluffiest, softist towels we have ever had the pleasure to use. This property does lack a certain...je ne sais quoi...there is no luxury, pomp and circumstance, bells and whistles, freebies, extravagant decor, or fancy furniture. The lobby is small but adequate, the rooms lack storage drawers and space for luggage, and the bathrooms cannot hold two persons at once. Nevertheless, we were greatly impressed with the K & K Cayre for its value, service, comfort and convenience. This is an ideal resting spot for tourists seeking to explore this amazing city, but be sure to bring good walking shoes, a French dictionary, a portable umbrella, patience for the inevitable encounter or two (or more) with the haughty Parisien, lots of money and a sense of adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: cilo
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at Hotel K+K Cayre in November. We chose this hotel based on other tripadvisor reviews, the hotel rating, and location. This is a nice but fairly small boutique hotel. If you require a lot of assistance being your first time in Paris, this is a great place to stay. It has the personal touch that you don't see in bigger hotels. The staffs seemed nice and helpful. We were upgraded from an executive room to a suite upon arrival. However, we booked the hotel directly from the hotel's own website, kkhotels.com, and paid 295 euros a night including breakfast and a welcome gift (a box of chocolate). The breakfast is the same everyday during our stay. Quality of the food is fine if you don't mind eating the same thing everyday. If all you want is coffee and a croissant in the morning, the next door Shell station/grocery store has those as well. However, if you want a proper breakfast and you like to eat late, breakfast is served until 11 am! The suite is large by Paris standard. Our room was on the 6th floor facing the courtyard. It is very quite but the walls are thin. You can hear your next door neighbors talking and doing whatever else they are doing...The quality of the bedding is down/feather filled but the bed itself was rather soft. If you have a laptop, each room has free highspeed internet connection. The bathroom is very modern with good water pressure for a nice hot shower. It also has heated floor and a decent blow dryer. The location is ideal, easy access to multiple subway stations on different train lines. It is right in front of the small Rue Du Bac Metro station but within walking distance (10-15 minutes) to St. Germain des-Pres and Sevres Babylone stations. If you are in the market to shop for high-end goods and furniture, you are in the right area. There is a Monoprix (general merchandise), Le Bon Marche (chic French department store), small Louis Vuitton store next to the Cafe De Flore (excellent French Onion soup at 17 euros a bowl) and more shoe shops in the area than you can imagine. If you want to go sightseeing, Cityrama Office (it offers all kinds of bus tours) is a 15 to 20 minute walk (5 euros by taxi) away. Overall, we had a pleasant stay but the price we paid was a bit on the expensive side for such a small boutique hotel. It lacks the ''luxury'' part of hotel services, such as a fully equipped gym, a swimming pool, restaurants, and full spa services. The hotel offers massages but the massage bed is inside the gym and I don't find that setup to be relaxing at all. It does offer free internet connection, it also has nice and helpful staffs, and best of all, a great location! The hotel helped us arranged for a taxi on the day of departure. The ride turned out to be 66 Euros with no traffic on an early Sunday morning! ! If you are not in a huge rush to get to the airport, try the Air France Bus (11.50 euros one way) from Gare Montparnasse, or called for a pick up with a shared ride door-to-door shuttle bus service, such as Parishuttle.com at 19 euros a person. Keep in mind to book early because there are limited vans available.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality non-luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: Miro586
Reviews.Content: The K+K Hotel Cayre is an entirely adequate 3/4 star hotel. It is situated on the busy boulevard Raspail close to the Rue de Bac metro station in the 7th arrondisment. It is in the pleasant Rue de Bac neighbourhood with picture galleries, furniture and speciality antiques shops as well as upmarket clothes and food shops. It is close to the Bonne Marche department store at Sevres et Babylone. The Muse d' Orsay is within easy walking distance. Finally the Hotel Matingon (the prime minister's residence) is nearby which means that there is a 24 hour police presence in the neighbourhood. Rooms vary in size. Some are on the small side. However there are some good sized rooms so if room size is important ask for one. (You may also need to pay slightly more.) Furnishings, bathrooms and facilities are modern, clean and comfortable but not exceptional. Beds are comfortable but not super comfortable. The staff are most helpful and efficient. The hotel has effective double glazing which is necessary to exclude the noise of the boulevard Raspail. There is also effective air conditioning/heating/ventilation which is necessary as you need to keep the windows closed. The hotel serves a buffet breakfast for a nominal €23. This is very comprehensive and of unusually high quality. It includes well cooked scrambled eggs and bacon, cereals, fruit salad, croisants and rolls and cold meat, smoked salmon and cheese. In short all the elements for an English, French and German breakfast and every thing good quality. Overall the K+K is, behind its 19th century facade, a well run modern businessman's hotel with a very helpful and efficient staff. On the other hand it is not a 'luxury' hotel. This leads to the value question. Booking over the internet I paid a rate of €210 per night including breakfast. However it was clear that if you paid 'list' prices you could pay much more (and breakfast would be extra). In my view €210 including breakfast is good value. List prices are likely not.

Reviews.Title: “***Beautiful modern hotel in a stylish area of Paris***”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Forever
Reviews.Content: I selected the K+K Hotel after extensively researching Trip Advisor, other websites and friends. I was overjoyed with having selected this beautiful hotel for my stay in early June. It was located in my opinion, the best part of Paris, that is, the Saint Germain area on the Left Bank. It was close to great shopping such as the department store Bon Marche, great cafes such as Cafe Le Deux Magot, and more. The subway station was right outside the hotel and it was a short stroll to the Seine. I used to walk to and from the Cityrama office for my tours - about 10-15 minutes. As a female traveller on her own, I felt very safe in this hotel and in this area. The breakfast was one of the best I have had in any hotel. It offered a wide range of cereals, yoghurt, bacon, eggs, fresh fruit and drinks - even smoked salmon etc.... The rooms were beautifully appointed, clean and super comfortable. I can't forget the free internet access in the lobby which was very useful. The staff were exceptional!!!!!! They were always friendly, polite and happy to assist with any questions. This was my first trip to Paris and the Hotel K+K Cayre certainly made my stay a most enjoyable one and one that I will always treasure!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel in a great area”
Reviews.Author: DCJDMBA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Cayre last week while on our honeymoon in Paris. The hotel is superb and in centrally located. The contemporary styled room is adequate in size (est. 150 sq. ft.) and is impeccably clean. The hotel makes great efforts to facilitate your stay. Included in the room is a coffee maker with instant coffee which according to my wife puts Starbucks to shame. Each room has free internet access. Even if you don't have a computer, there are three in the lobby for free use. The staff is polite and indulged me as I spoke broken French to them, even though they are all fluent in English. When we arrived the first day the desk clerk promptly gave us a map of Paris and pointed out where the hotel was located, which is perhaps the best aspect of the hotel. The hotel is walking distance to just about every major site in Paris. It is about a half mile to the Place de la Concorde, Tuileries Gardens, the Louvre and the Musee D'Orsay. It is under a mile to the Notre Dame and the Centre Pompidou and about a mile to the Eiffel Tower and the Arc de Triomphe. There are also scores of cafes, bistros and brasseries nearby, as well as shops of every nature. We would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Librarian7667
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 7 days (October 22 - 30) and felt so fortunate that we had chosen this hotel. It was my first time in Paris. The location is perfect - having the metro stop right outside the door of the hotel is so convenient. Riding the metro system is cheap and easy and after a long day of walking and sightseeing it was great to step off the metro, cross the street and enter our hotel. It's a short walk to the Seine and there are so many lovely cafes and bistros to choose from. The staff was very helpful and the room was exceptionally clean - comfortable beds, heated tile bathroom floor, cute little balcony, etc. If you stay over a weekend I highly recommend taking the metro up to Porte Clingnancourt for the flea market. We had lots of fun bargaining with the sellers in the different stalls - and got some pretty good deals.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: javadoc
Reviews.Content: We booked our hotel after reading the tripadvisor reviews. We were not disappointed. Our trip to Paris was an amazing experience!! The K+K was in ideal location for all the wonderful sights. We were able to walk to so many places and the weather was perfect. The staff at the hotel were exceptional and always helpful. It was truly appreciated. The room was clean, comfortable and had an amazing view. We loved the ambiance of the hotel and its convenience to so many restaurants (especially Cafe Flore and Les Deux Magots) along St. Germain Boulevard after long days of touring. My husband has a medical condition and we requested directly to the hotel for a non-smoking, non-pet, large bed room. The hotel was so prompt at confirming the reservation and guaranteeing our preferences. We would recommend this hotel to any of our friends in a heartbeat and will be returning again in future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect all around!”
Reviews.Author: mysgyn
Reviews.Content: We chose this place partially because of the wonderful reviews here and they were right! We wanted the "perfect" place for our honeymoon and first trip to Europe. The location was perfect. It wasn't too close to too much chaos but having the Metro right outside the door made everything convenient. Our room was on the back of the hotel. At first we were hoping for a "view" thinking the Eiffel Tower or something similar but we had a view of a street. Only after our first night there, having the french doors open and hearing the locals laughing and getting ready for a night on the town...waking up to the baker and chocolatier making their goods...listening to the students coming down the street ...did we realize we had an incredible view. The staff was incredibly helpful with us getting around and recommending excellent restaurants (le petite chaise). The room was a good size and the french doors were beautiful. Then add on the heated marble floors in the bathroom and you felt like you were in heaven. Oh, and who could forget the extremely convenient Shell Station next door where you can buy the most inexpensive milk and soda and other small things there. There is also a supermarket around the back along with a photo shop, bakery, chocolatier, rotisserie (great chicken), and a few wine shops. We actually spent a few days just on the block eating and taking food and wine back to our room! I would absolutely go to this hotel, recommend it to anyone traveling, and also try out the K & K chain just because of this one good experience. There's so much more but I'll let you just experience the greatness for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location, Clean,Comfortable and non-smoking floors!!”
Reviews.Author: savvytraveler
Reviews.Content: We are very particular in our travels. The quality is just as important as the price. However, there were 3 of us , couple and 18 year old daughter, which is a tough combination for our criterias: good location, clean, modern bathrooms, real non-smoking rooms, (not just sprayed with freshener) and enough room for 3. I booked directly with the hotel so the rate was a special of 190Euros for 2 and 48 Euros for the extra person. This rate did include 2 breakfasts that was worth it !(The Austrians and Germans are well known for excellent breakfasts.) We were lucky to be upgraded to their triple room on the 5th floor,though no view it was quiet. The surroundings are not elegant or plush, but the great bed with down pillows and comforters, fully supplied marble baths, and service are as good as any luxury hotel. They were very helpful with other people's needs and questons I noticed. The location is the best for walking anywhere or using the subway. Even if the price is higher, I would highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KMPTraveler
Reviews.Content: My mother and I recently spent 5 days in Paris. The K + K Cayre is a great hotel! It is in a wonderful location, and it is right across the street from a Metro stop (Rue de Bac). After traveling all over the city, it was always a pleasure to be able to walk right across the street after getting off the Metro. The room was small, but not as small as I expected. The rooms are very clean and everyone working in the hotel was friendly and responsive to our needs. In fact, I found them to be organized, professional, and they can speak English if your French is weak. Breakfast was not included with our trip, but at 23 Euros per person, it was too expensive. There are wonderful cafes in the area and a Shell station next door where you can buy water, sandwiches, bread, etc. The hotel is in a safe and upscale area, and you can walk to many sites and stores from its location. I would recommed this hotel to anyone, and I will stay there again when I return to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fab breakfasts!”
Reviews.Author: Gleavey
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Paris once before at a small budget B&B but as this occassion was a milestone birthday (and as it turned out an engagement!)I wanted somethng a bit special - and it was. As I wanted to pay a bit more than usual I was expecting expense, but the value for money was more than worth it - and it wasn't really that expensive as we got a 3rd night free deal. The hotel is in a great location, 5 mins walk from the Seine and Louvre and right outside a Metro station. The staff were all helpful and friendly and immediatly recognised that our French was basic so accommodated us with perfect English! (When my sister arrived a day later they helped her organise a surprise bottle of champange for us).The double room wasn't too large but as we were hardly there it didn't matter - it was immaculate, stylish and very comfortable (lovely bathroom and toiletries). The breakfasts were fabulous, buffet style, eat as much as you like with everything you could think of - cereal, fruit, pastries, yoghurts, cooked breakfast items and best of all chilled, open bottles of champagne that you could help yourself too for Bucks Fizz etc, as well as waiter service for tea and coffee and complimentary international newspapers. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel and would defintiely go back. Since staying at the K&K, when booking a city break now I always check to see if they have a K&K hotel as I wouldn't hesitate to book.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection and did I mention the location!!!”
Reviews.Author: DAVID_310
Reviews.Content: After reading the reivews posted on Trip Advisor and checking out the hotel web site I booked a 4 night stay during a recent business trip. I must say that the hotel was excellent; friendly staff, great location, clean and comfortable room etc. I would not hesitate staying at this hotel again for either personal or business travel.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, utilitarian hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: RZC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the K+K for 8 nights around the end of April in two classic double rooms: first two nights on a lower floor with a somewhat cramped view of neighboring buildings, and the rest on a higher floor overlooking a tiny courtyard/garden within the hotel. Pros: * The location is even better than I had thought. Many on this site have cited the metro station right in front of the hotel and its proximity to Orsay and Louvre museums; to me St Germain des Pres is a great neighborhood in its own right that's worth exploring. Around Place St-Germain-des-Pres (10 minutes' walk on Bld St Germain) are many nice boutiques where Parisians like to shop; great cafes for people-watching; great restaurants; and a street full of art galleries (Rue de Seine). * The hotel was renovated fairly recently, so the facilities are in great condition: Good water pressure, comfortable bed, powerful hair dryer, Internet jack next to the bed... * The hotel is very clean, and the staff were quite accommodating toward our requests for changing floors, restaurant recommendations, and so on. * The windows have great sound-proofing. Cons: * Noise. Other reviewers are right: the noise of trains passing almost right under the hotel is quite noticeable, especially on the lower floors. In fact, with trains coming into and leaving from the station you can physically feel the vibration when down in the lobby. Thankfully it didn't bother us too much as we would return to our room late and very sleepy and shortly before the trains stop running altogether. Also, one of the rooms we stayed in was right next to an elevator shaft, which was very noisy. Again, however, we were mostly too tired to be bothered. * Room size. It initially didn't bother us--we've seen plenty of hotels all over the world with rooms smaller than these. However, as time went on and dirty laundry and shopping bags began to pile up, it started to feel cramped. So I think you need to be better organized if two people are to stay in a classic double room for more than a couple of days. Travel tips: * If you are going to stay for more than a couple of days in Paris, try to get the Carte Orange metro pass. It's the best and most convenient option for the Paris metro. Bring a passport-sized photo with you--you'll need it on the Carte. The weekly carte is valid from Monday to Sunday, so it'd make sense to get it on or shortly after Monday. Also, there are different zones with different coverages and prices; if you are going to Versaille, for example, you should consider a zone covering Versaille. * You don't need to bring your power adapter: the hotel has plenty to loan out. As mentioned above, the hair dryer is also fairly powerful, so you don't really need to bring your own, either. * Taking public transportation between Charles de Gaulle airport and the hotel is not really a viable option, especially with suitcases--you'd have to make a couple of transfers between trains, and dragging your luggage through the crowded underground labryinth is no fun. * Try to get a musem pass--it saves money AND time as there's usually a shorter queue for pass holders at museums. Why I scored the hotel the way I did: * When in Paris, the most beautiful and happening city in the world, one does not want to stay in the hotel a lot. One just needs a place to clean oneself, rest, and store things. To me, K+K Hotel Cayre serves this purpose reasonably well--it's a hotel of basic comfort. * However, this is not a resort hotel of beauty, culture, inspiration, or luxury. The hotel stay itself won't bring you lots of fond memories, and I wouldn't really describe it as "lovely". The hotel is just a building with no real garden, the rooms are pretty small, the amenities are thoughtfully provided but fairly common, and there are noise issues with the train and the elevator. In the end, its great location pushed my score into "above average".

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is Absolutely Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: M Hagan
Reviews.Content: My sister and I just returned from a week at the K+K in Paris and could not have been any happier. I booked an Executive Twin room which was large by Parisian standards; there was room for a small table and a chair and plenty of room for our rather large suitcases. In the hall was a large closet with shelves and a safe. There was a small step up to a large balcony which offered a splendid view of Sacre Coeur. The room number was 610 ("Donnez-moi la clef pour six-dix, svp ?"), which in the hotel photos is the one with the large arch over the french door on the 6th floor. The beds were very comfortable and had down comforters and a feather matress topper. There were slippers, a mini-bar, free internet access and a flat-panel TV. The bathtub was deep and the bathroom in general was very nice. Being so high up, the noise from the traffic below was not a problem except for a couple of nights when we left the balcony doors open to provide a breeze. The hotel staff was wonderful and crisply efficient in answering all of our questions. We did not eat our petit dejeuner in the hotel as the cafe next door was considerably less expensive. I loved this hotel and would not hesitate booking a stay again!

Reviews.Title: “nasty little room for the price”
Reviews.Author: Vagabond20
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights in July '06. Booked (And paid $60 extra per night for!) an "Executive" (supposedly an upgraded), quiet room and requested a high floor. Got a twelve by twelve room on the 2nd floor with a lot of metro noise and vibration. Made daily requests for a room change to no avail. Unfortunately we always got the single most supercillious desk agent when we presented with our daily request. Some of the other desk clerks seemed perfectly pleasant and helpful however. Breakfast is a breathtaking 23 Euros (and not nearly worth it) per person but there are plenty of decent cafes and bakeries within a very easy walk. Had problems with the wireless internet connection supposedly available in each room but could not endure our friend at the desk's smirking/sneering long enough to get any help on the matter so was grateful for internet lobby access. I have definitely stayed in worse places but I haven't paid quite as much for the privilege!

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at K+K Sept. 20-26 - Two Thumbs Up”
Reviews.Author: Hman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent six nights at the K+K, which we chose primarily because of favorable Trip Advisor reviews. We found the reviews accurate, in that the rooms are a bit small for the price, but are very clean and comfortable. We did not include breakfast in our package due to several comments about the excessive price, but found it unnecessary with the very good Cafe St. Germain on the corner and an excellent patisserie a half block north on Bd. Raspail. We also recommend Cafe St. Germain for a nearby dinner, but skip the Cafe Flores around the corner on Rue du Bac. Both the steak and veal were so tough to be nearly inedible. St. Germain des Pres is a quiet, upscale residential neighborhood. Take a short walk down Bd. St. Germain toward the Latin Quarter and dine at the Cafe de Flore and Les Deux Magots, a bit pricey but good food at both and essential for Sartre followers. The nearby metro station was very convenient, but light sleepers should be aware that the rumbling trains could be heard, even in our 5th floor room. The front desk acknowledged that metro noise is a problem in some rooms, but seemed surprised we could hear the trains in our room. The trains do not run between midnight and six a.m., but having not seen any mention of the metro noise in recent reviews thought to mention it. Sound sleepers should not find the metro noise to be a problem, and overall we recommend the K+K.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: We-Travel-Now
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 4 days at the hotel in mid-September. Our fifth floor room was modern and stylish, very clean, comfortable and quiet. A travel companion originally booked into the first floor requested another room because of the noise -- she was quickly accommodated and moved to the 4th floor. The hotel's location is excellent. We enjoyed the easy access to the metro, along with the short walks to Musee d'Orsay, the Louvre, and Notre-Dame. We found the english-speaking staff very helpful. The breakfast buffet is extensive and quite good. We selected this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews and our excellent experience at the K&K Hotel Central in Prague last October. We would definitely return to either of these properties and can highly recommend them.

Reviews.Title: “Plesant weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: kaquamarine
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Sat 26th - Mon 28th Aug 06. Arrived at CdG airport, got the train to St Michel station and the K&K was about a 15min walk away. All very convenient. Although we arrived at around 10am, we were given our room straight away. Our room on the 7th floor was modern very comfortable and very clean. I couldn't fault the room. Some might say that the standard room is on the small side but I think it's ideal for a weekend stay and with all the usual conveniences in the room – tea/coffee facilities, mini bar, ample wardrobe space, tv, etc. The reception desk staff were most pleasant. Across the road is Rue Du Bac Metro station which was very handy for getting to all the sights. Having said that, if you're keen on walking, some of the sights are accessible on foot. But I did love the efficiency of the metro which is great when you want to fit a lot into a weekend. There is also a Shell petrol station adjacent which has a well stocked shop. The immediate area is quite tidy with all the restaurants along boulevard St Germain within easy reach. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel. There will be plenty of cheaper places to stay but this one does have the comforts.

Reviews.Title: “I Really Enjoyed this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelGalBoston
Reviews.Content: I travelled solo to Paris in late August and I chose this hotel because of its location (I didn't want to be in a very touristy area) and because of the reviews on this site. I must say that I really enjoyed this hotel. The location is excellent -- at the intersection with St. Germain des Pres, the Seine is a couple of blocks away, as is the Orsay Museum. There is a metro station just outside the hotel which was very convenient. I booked a double room and stayed in room 614 which overlooked Blvd Raspail and had a beautiful view (both left and right) and you could also see Sacre Coeur. Although the room was a little small (even though it was a double, but hey, that's how it is in many European hotels), it was very clean. 24 hour internet access in the lobby was great (they even have a connection in the rooms if you bring a laptop) I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “location + style”
Reviews.Author: steve62
Reviews.Content: booked by Venere-would recommend as your out no money until you actually show up Hotel was very nice rooms clean and fresh-overall modern functional windows opened for fresh air bathroom was small but clean and newer staff was helpful and made restaurant reservations for us parking was a half block away and stopping in front of the hotel not easy breakfast not included but expensive so we ate breakfast at a couple of places next door would recommend but your on a less busy strech adjacent to St. Germain, 5 min. walk puts you in the heart of the action.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Concierge could do better”
Reviews.Author: wilson1208
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with two other people -was able to book a room for 3, with 3 twin beds -not cots! -room was great, clean, fair size for 3 people. Small bathroom, but recenlty renovatoed and sleek modern look. concierge was disapointing -we only had one night in Paris -long layover back to US, and wanted a good place to go to dinner. -Had hair blown out at salon down the street, all dressed up, wanted great night out. Initally had a reservation at Caspia Caviar, but decided more in the mood for steak. Hotel sent us to latin Quarter where everyone in the place spoke english. we had a bad feeling about it from the start, but went ahead with it bc afterall, the concierge must know something, right? Night was salvaged -we were in Paris, afterall -but I would not stay here again bc of this. Location was fabulous -close to Luxumberg gardens, and amazing shopping all around Overall, hotel was above average -but concierge was lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Location great, staff typically parisian”
Reviews.Author: Oilbert
Reviews.Content: I wanted to go to the new Musee du Quai Branly & Eiffel Tower, so this hotel was in a good location. It's also just a short walk to the Seine and across into the Tulleries Gardens. Room service is typically Parisan ("You want what?"), but apart from that it was a pleasant stay. The gym is a joke, but there is good jogging along the Seine very close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: mojo1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in August for a week. Before my arrival, I had emailed the hotel a few times asking for a non-smoking room, a room on a higher floor, w/a balcony, and with a view of the Eiffel Tower. My first two requests were granted, but the other two were not. I was not given an explanation to why my other two requests were not granted, which I would have appreciated. If you want a particular type of room, I still think that is it worth making the request. The lobby and rooms are nicely decorated in a modern style. It is in a very convenient location; all the major sites are walking distance and the metro stop is right across the street. There is a mini-mart right next door, so we could get water bottles and fruit from there. Also, there is a little bakery right around the corner, which is great for breakfast. The staff is very helpful. They made restaurant recommendations and reservations for us many nights. All of the restaurants were wonderful. Overall, I was happy with my experience at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandbager
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 4 nights in August. Hotel is in a great location - walking distance to nice up scale shopping, restaurants, museums, Eiffel tower, Notre Dame and the Latin Quarter. Across from Metro station. Hotel was spotless, rooms were modern, staff was very polite and friendly. Free breakfast was very good - including eggs. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location and service”
Reviews.Author: First-Timers-canada
Reviews.Content: From Toronto ,Canada We only spent four days . But the service was excellent ,first we did miss the 1o"clock check -in. There are no room reservations so first come ,first served. But listening from other reviews .The 7th floor facing the street was a delight .We reguested the following night. The breakfest was great but expensive. The location was excellent from the Air France bus to montpasse. There you proceed to the metro on the bottem floor. Two stops ,up the steps and you are there .What a delight . You are in the heart of nice restaurants and a short walk to any tourist location. Another tip is to shop for drinks next door at the shell gas bar. Everything from water to bread is a third of the price. I'm usually very negative and generally sway from internet opinions. But I must say for first timers to Paris this was a great hotel experience. I will without a hesitation listen to other people's suggestions o the travel review. Will stay there again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: chicagoboy23
Reviews.Content: nice new room great a/c it was 100 F out great breakfast buffet good location - can walk to Louvre and central Quiet street attentive staff right next to metro station not many TV stations (is this all Paris?) not many restaurants nearby hard to catch taxi since it was sidestreet nice airy room with big windows and balcony

Reviews.Title: “Another thumbs up for the K and K Cayre!!”
Reviews.Author: skimama74
Reviews.Content: We chose the K and K Hotel Cayre based on reviews on this site and have to add our compliments for this wonderful hotel. We loved the neighborhood, St. Germain is a wonderful place to be, with plenty of restaurants and shops and a metro station across the street from the hotel, and it is also very convenient to all of the Paris landmarks. We had an executive room with a king bed, not large but fine with tons of closet room. The bathroom was spotless and had all the amenities, hair dryer, toiletries, etc. The front desk was quite helpful and nice. We had breakfast included with our room rate and found it excellent, fresh fruit, yogurt, pastries, ham, smoked salmon, eggs, etc. One of my requirements was a hotel with a/c, and as we were in Paris during a heat wave I was glad I'd made it a priority. The a/c in our room worked extremely well and it was such a treat to return to our cool and comfortable room. The bed was extremely comfortable. I'd return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “just lovely”
Reviews.Author: sair
Reviews.Content: We had a very good rate for this hotel through expedia, and i loved it here. The location is fantastic, you can walk anywhere from here. The hotel is clean,and elegant without being over the top. We had a room with a balcony, which i could sit on with a glass of wine after a day of roaming the streets - i could see the eiffel tower and all the parisian roof tops. There are lots of local cafes that are better value than the hotel breakfasts, you will also feel more of local by doing this! I will always stay here when i come to Paris again

Reviews.Title: “If it's in budget then pcik this one”
Reviews.Author: 102810l
Reviews.Content: I've always picked the 3rd/4th quarter of Paris as I avoid the larger hotels and like the area's vibe. This time I decided to go a bit upmarket, but didn't want to go too far over £120. In fact I went to £135 per night for this hotel but chose it on the basis of tripadvisor. The hotel is fantastic: clean, modern, excellent service and our room had a little balcony where we could sit and watch the world go by with the Eiffel Tower in our view. Mind you, not all rooms have this. In addition this is a perfect location (7th quarter)...you can walk anywhere you want, but the Metro is also right by the hotel and Gare du Nord is under €10 by taxi. If it's in budget, then go for it...also the rack rate is over €330 per night, so if you get a good deal then you're onto a winner.

Reviews.Title: “23rd Just Back !! Very Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: viperroom_112
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay in the hotel !! Very enjoyable, the staff were super efficient and friendly! They were happy to give advice aswell, The hotel is situated in a more original parisian location i.e minus thousands of tourists and shops to match. Although it is still only 500metres to the d'orsay. If it is shopping that you like then look 500metres in the other direction for the likes of armani, paul smith, kenzo and small boutiques selling antiques and rare books! .. The surrounding architcture is phenominal ! The room is very practical yet compact by american standards, with very high ceilings, ours had a floor to ceiling window with a balcony overlooking the street and the sacru couer in the distance. It had a well stocked mini bar which was priced well and a nice clean bathroom! Beds were comfortable, I was in a twin standard room! I advise you get the open top bus which stops nearby and allows you to see so much of paris in a short time! and use the METRO it is fun safe and quick! Breakfasts were also very good and bar drinks were well priced too! P.S there is a very nice sunday street market down the road outside the lutecia hotel and the shell garage next door is a good way to purchase bottledwater and quick snacks

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely a great experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned yesterday from an eight day trip to London and Paris to celebrate my wife's (significant number) birthday. I want to give the K & K Hotel in Paris the credit they deserve for making our stay in Paris a wonderful experience. I made the reservation based on the reviews at this website and I can honestly say that they were absolutely accurate and some of the best advice received regarding our planned vacation. The location is in a great area, with a train stop in front of the hotel. The location seems very safe and upscale. The neighborhood is full of shops, restaurants, and cafes; and is centrally located to most of the traditional sightseeing attractions. The hotel has been recently remodeled and is absolutely spotless; you can tell that they take pride in this. The staff is very helpful, polite, and accomodating. I would not have a concern recommending this hotel to anyone. Great job K & K! Thank - you.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with hotel - value overall for Paris”
Reviews.Author: OEK
Reviews.Content: After spending weeks of researching Paris Hotels, I concluded that a decent hotel in the middle of the summer was going to be at least $300 or more. When I say decent, I mean a hotel similar to the Holiday Inn Express or Courtyards by Marriott standards in the US. Specifically, clean, well located, AIR CONDITIONED, and roomy. Online websites found me lower priced hotels, only to later learn there was no air conditioning, or said hotel ratings were such that only a 50% or less rating was given when asked if previous guests would recommend said hotel to their friends and family. This was the third hotel we stayed at during our travels this trip, and by far, the best. Sharing the room was my husband, our 19 yr old son, and myself. It was perfect for a number of reasons: the room was very cleaned and spacious, the air conditioner worked perfectly, the facilities downstairs were all we needed, and there were three computers providing free internet access so we could catch up on our emails. The hotel itself is centrally located within blocks of the Seine River, and there is a metro stop right outside the hotel entrance. Once you have seen the main tourist attractions, the neighborhood is an excellent place to explore and the prices much more reasonable. I was concerned about the metro vibrations that I read about on trip advisor, but did not even notice it. We had a first floor room which was suppose to be the worst. The rooms were easily accessed by both centralized elevators and by stairs. The breakfast was very good, but I would not have paid more than 10 euros each if it had not been included in our rate (there's a great bakery across the street). The staff was very friendly and assisted us in many ways. And finally, it was in a residential area with lots of little shops and restaurants. Overall, none of us had any complaints and we would not hesitate to stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “position and class”
Reviews.Author: aussieking
Reviews.Content: We started our tour of France and the K&K was a great kickoff! We didn't stint so it wasn't cheap but it is beautifully situated in St Germain and the room and service were first class. Management heeded our call for the quietest room, and the service was excellent. We will go back to K&K.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Stonerman
Reviews.Content: This was the most mixed of the experiences I've had with hotels chosen on the basis of other TA reviews. The good part was that the room was clean with modern appointments and an ingenious design that made the most of what space there was. It was adequate in size by European city standards at least for one. As other reviewers have noted, the shower is hard to use but this is quite common in Europe; some have no enclosure at all. The room was on the "courtyard," really an airshaft, which meant no noise (it's a very noisy city overall), but it also meant it was impossible to tell the weather in the morning without going down to the lobby. The location is good. There are nice cafes and shops in the immediate vicinity, St. Germain, which seems to be an upscale commercial neighborhood within (long) walking distance of the Latin Quarter, Luxembourg Gardens, the Seine and even the Louvre. The facilities are minimal to nonexistent. The business center is just a couple of internet terminals, which share the lobby with a tiny bar. In Paris you're really not expected to spend much time in the hotel. Some staff are helpful and fluent in English; others are neither. The big issue about this place is the cost: almost $300/nite on web special. Adequate as the place is, coming from the US it's just hard to see this as a good value. Then again TA reviews of so much of the competition are uniformly miserable. One alternative that might be worth exploring next time would be to stay in a more residential area less centrally located, as long as it's near a Metro stop. You can get everywhere you care to go very quickly by Metro, and while not particularly pleasant it's quite safe. The city is awesome. Your main goal is to avoid things frequented by tourists like yourself. Of course all the tourists have that same goal which just adds to the endless entertainment there.

Reviews.Title: “loved the k k cayre”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my mother and me stayed at the k k cayre from may24-may 29. we absolutely loved it. the rooms were very clean, the beds comfortable, loved the heated floors in the bathroom. but the best part of the stay was the staff. jean-pierre and serge were so nice and helpful to us they made our stay so much fun! can't wait to go back to paris and i will definitely stay at the k k cayre. also, we stayed on the 2nd floor and did not hear the subway that alot of people seem to complain about. i would definitely recommend the k k cayre.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: lovetobeinparis
Reviews.Content: We stayed there from may 2nd through the 9th. We loved the location. Our small room was on the second flloor and they failed to tell us it was a smoking room. By the time I realized I didn't want to pack and move. We were facing bd raspail (asked for a view)and you could hear the subway's vibration. You could also hear some noise from the other rooms. They don't have lotion,so make sure you bring your own. Overall a good experience,but if i return I would request a higher floor in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Wexler
Reviews.Content: This review will be redundant of the many very positive reviews you have already read. The staff was very friendly and very helpful. The room was small-er, but none the less very nice. The location was, in my opinion, outstanding. We took an overnight flight from the States to CDG, then the train with 2 different connections to the Rue Du Bac Metro stop on line 12...lugging our bags up the steps...looking up and seeing green trees as we climb...get to the top of the steps, and to our right just across the street - the K&K! I cannot express how happy I was to see the hotel. Very understated yet classy look from the street. Automatic sliding double glass doors as you walk in. Wasn't sure what to expect as we walked up to the front desk. Greeted by a very friendly gentleman (sorry don't exactly remember his name, maybe Michele - glasses, dark hair). We check in, and he tells us "you will be staying in room 719, and I think you will enjoy the view". What an understatement. (see picture). Never get a second chance to make a first impression. We met a family friend in Paris, and they stayed in the K&K as well, did not book with us and recieved an equally impressive view, on the other side of the building (Sacre-Coeur / Raspail side)...room #612 - another incredible view (see pic). What I loved about the K&K location - convenience (Metro stop) and the vibe of the neighborhood. If you like the hustle and bustle of a very touristy area, with thousands of people where there are mega stores and McDonalds I would suggest the Champs-Elysees area...but if you want an escape from all that, and you like strolling boutique high-end shopping and pretty-people watching from a cafe'...and you are not opposed to using the Metro with great frequency (I must add that the Paris metro is the nicest public transit system I have ever experienced) then the K&K is for you.
