Armed with a Fodor's and a Street Wise map, we used the K&K as our home base to an incredible 3 day stop in Paris...and the K&K was key to making our trip great.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: suzq22
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 6-night stay at the K+K. We booked this hotel through our travel agency having read the reviews and were not disappointed. The location was great, the rue du Bac Metro stop was right outside the hotel. Check in was easy; the front desk staff let us see the room (since it was a smoking room) before we took it which was fine. The doorman even aired it out with air freshener spray. We had a double room on the fourth floor facing Blvd Raspail. Our room was a good size for a Parisian room was clean and modern; the bathroom was well proportioned with heated marble floor and a full bathtub. The bathroom was immaculate after maid service everyday. The Reception staff was not only great but fun (especially Jean Pierre). The internet in the lobby was easy to use. We did not ask the front desk for restaurant recommendations because we already had a list of places to go. We had breakfast included in our package (otherwise not have paid the 23 Euros) and always had a fresh array of fruit, croissants, bread, cold meats, cheeses, etc. There was never a morning where the food ran out and we got to breakfast pretty late each morning. The waiters were polite and all spoke English. The reviews of the Shell Minimart next door did not fail us. It was great; it sold water, wine (cheap prices), cookies, bread, etc all at good prices. The hotel is within a 10 to 15 minute walk of the Louvre, Orsay, and Rodin museums. Bring a small umbrella as we experienced light showers for a few minutes most of our days. The Chapon chocolate shop around the corner had the best chocolate we’ve tasted. The bakery on the corner of Rue de Bellechase and St. Germain-des-Pres (near Orsay) was excellent as well. Paris was just wonderful and our hotel stay at the K & K Cayre helped to make this a positive experience. Overall the K+K was a very pleasant hotel in a good location and we would go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Yes, it's really that good!”
Reviews.Author: greenfeet
Reviews.Content: Thanks to all the previous reviews, this was an easy choice for our stay in Paris; and everything they've said is true. The room was terrific: the beds were great, the rooms bright and airy, bathrooms reasonably large enough. Most noticably, the staff was more than pleasant -- they were fun. The gave us great recommendations on nearby restaurants (we enjoyed La Petite Chaise) while the gas station market provided an extensive array of snacks and drinks. The Rue le Bac metro stop is right across the street from the front door, so even with rain you won't get soaked; while the Rue St Germain de Pres is great for strolling. This place really got our week's vacation started right and I'll probably stay here next time I have the chance. (Thanks to all those that steered us here with your reviews.)

Reviews.Title: “Paris K&K - Loved it! No complaints...”
Reviews.Author: HuskerGator
Reviews.Content: We loved the K&K. The location was superb, great shopping and dining everywhere (L'Atelier de Joël Robuchon down the street was unbelievably good, wonderful chocolate shop around the corner, close to Bon Marche and lots of boutiques). The staff of the hotel were so friendly and helpful. Our room had a view of the Sacre Coeur and a small balcony. It was new looking, modern and very clean; the bed was extremely comfortable; absolutely no street noise at night. Our rate included breakfast and it was really, really good. It filled us up and we usually didn't need to eat again until dinner time (too busy experiencing the wonderful city). The internet in the lobby was nice to keep in touch with the kids. We really had no complaints whatsoever with this hotel. I would recommend it highly to all my friends and family and hope to stay there again as soon as possible!

Reviews.Title: “We Loved the Cayre”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for six nights at the K & K (our girl trip to Paris!). We had the most perfect room on the 6th floor with view ( and porch with table and chairs) of the Eiffel Tower, Invalides Dome and in the distance La Defense. WOW - especially the light show at night from the Eiffel. Don't know how we got the room - luck I guess! We had our cocktail hour (or two) on the porch everynight and I began to feel like Jimmy Stewart in Rear Window! Very polite and proper staff. Restaurant suggestions were good - but then, is there a bad meal in Paris???? Mais NON!! Internet connection in lobby was a bonus ( after a while, I got used to the keyboard - however, I found out too late there is a way to change it to English ). This is a classy hotel - booked as a package through travelocity. I miss Paris! One of the most wonderful cities in the world!

Reviews.Title: “great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for one night at the Hotel Cayre and thought it was a great location for accessing sites through the Rue du Bac Metro stop, as well as shopping down St. Germain-de-pres and Raspail streets. Reading the first 40 or so reviews, I'm surprised that nobody mentioned the metro vibrations. The trains come through every four minutes or so until 1 am. My wife was woken by the vibrations in the morning. We could clearly feel each train in our second floor room as well as in the lobby. I'd equate the sound of the Metro to that of some very low-grade earthquakes I've experienced in California. We also had issues with sound-proofing in the rooms -- not from outside noise (other than the Metro) but from the water pipes. We could hear each flush and shower from a couple different rooms. The better rooms must be higher and maybe are smoking rooms. The view from our room window was of a concrete wall, but we were so busy all day that the lack of view didn't matter. The free wireless Internet and free printing from the business center computer was helpful. The staff all spoke english and were incredibly gracious hosts. The Shell station next door was a great source of cheap snacks. There is a bakery across the Rue du Bac that had some wonderful baked goods (I had a yummy mini-quiche frommage that they heated for me). We would stay here again, especially for a short stay, with a discounted rate.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale treatment and Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed four nights for a wedding anniversary. We had no problem with communication. The staff spoke English and were very gracious and helpful to us. They directed us to wonderful restaurants and a jazz bar. They directed us away from any areas of civil unrest (there was a legislative matter causing riots). We loved the old style and the smaller size of the hotel. It was very charming, and the service was personal. They have done a nice job making the facility very updated without losing the unique appeal. The breakfasts were all delicious. The location was next to a subway entry, which made it easy for us to get around the city. We hope to return there soon.

Reviews.Title: “K + K Cayre Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first trip to Paris. We chose this hotel based on the reviews and the location - WOW - it worked out great. Hotel Staff - Willing to help with all requests Location - Great location - quiet but still in the heart of Paris Rooms - Clean and bigger than I had expected Bathrooms - Heated floors and full tub We did not spend a great deal of time in the hotel but we found this hotel to be very comfortable after a long day of walking the city. One night we ordered room service and it was excellent. I would definitly recommend this hotel to others and would stay there again myself.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the K & K”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our Honeymoon for 8 nights in the second half of April. The hotel was the best I have stayed at in Europe; the rooms as documented are small by US standards but great by Europe’s. This hotel is the cleanest place I have ever stayed anywhere. The staff was wonderful and fulfilled our every request. The Metro stop is with in just a few yards from the door. The much talked about Shell station has some really good tasting wine at excellent prices, plus all the snacks/drinks you could want. We stayed on the 7th floor overlooking the Blvd Raspail, NO noise at night and a very nice view. The free Internet in the lobby was great, we used this several times. The French keyboard did take a few minutes to operate. This hotel is a great bargin for the price. Its not the Ritz, but its a better than 95% of most hotels. I would stay there again anytime, this a great place!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the K+K for 10 days. The rooms were very clean and were very well maintained throughout our trip. The front desk people were very courteous and helpful. One of the things we liked about this location was the subway being right across the street from the hotel - after a long day of walking around the city, knowing you're just across the street from the subway made it all that much easier. We found the gas station beside the hotel very handy for picking up bottled water and bread for evening snacks. We would definately come back to this hotel and we definately recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “trip to paris”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms were very clean and the view from my blacony was amazing. The shopping,resturants, and metro location was extremely conventient. I could not have picked a better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this immaculate contemporary small hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a fancy hotel with lots of old rickety "Louis XIV" type furniture, this is not the place for you - But, if you are looking for a super-clean, well-run, place for a good night's sleep in a fantastic corner of Paris (who can beat the intersection of Blvd St Germain, Rue du Bac and Blvd Raspail???), then Hotel Cayre' is a good choice. I got a rate of 220 Euro which included a very large breakfast with many many choices and a very pleasant staff. For the heart of the Faubourg St Germain, that is a great rate. True, there are no statues or gold-laced lamps around. True, once inside the hotel, you could be in any European city...so what? What I need after a long day of tourism is a very comfortable bed, a very strong hot shower and an accomadating concierge, who has millions of suggestions about where to eat etc. The location and cleanliness of this hotel are its most important attributes in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: WorldExperienced
Reviews.Content: Great, clean, comfortable hotel --- minimal no frills modern rooms. Room rates are on the expensive side since the rooms are not luxurious– so try to get good room rates with breakfast included. Looks new on inside. Well renovated. Very comfortable beds. Nice modern bathrooms but very small (one person length). Shower fixtures a little on cheap side, half-shower doors therefore, water sprays into bathroom. Toiletries are not luxurious. Towels are very soft. If you are light sleeper, do not stay on 1st floor --- can hear the subway trains. Very helpful and friendly staff speaking English. Metro Station just across the street. 2 free internet access PCs. Small but very modern/bright buffet breakfast room --- very good food and great selection (fruits, hot foods, cold cuts/pate, cereals etc.). We had a junior suite room which was spacious (for Europe) and great for triples – 3 regular single beds.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: It's Travel Time
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Cayre on March 28 to 31 2006 Staff at front desk were most helpful answering questions about Paris and getting around. Roon was very poor as there was no space to put two suitcases. Breakfast was very expensive at hotel. They wanted 23 euros per person. For price I expected more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: rynskie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice. We upgraded to what I think is called an executive double and it was worth the relatively nominal fee as it was a bigger room than the standard ones. The bathroom is excellent & the bed very comfortable. There is a digital safe in room that you choose the access code for. There is a little used sauna in the fitness center that is great for tired jet lagged bodies. The area is excellent and close to many of the major sites. The street behind the hotel had a cafe, bakery, grocery store, Italian market, butcher, camera shop & tailor & we used them all - just about everything you need is on that street. The Shell station next to hotel is a good place to get snacks and drinks. We never turned our key in as requested and nobody seemed to mind. We had room service breakfast once and it was mediocre - you do much better for food outside of the hotel. Try nearby Joel Robuchon's restaurant - we got a seat without any waiting at 9 p.m. and it was worth the splurge.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: nanciface
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 6-night stay at the K+K. We chose this hotel based on reviews from this website and were not disappointed. Check-in was easy, the front desk staff, which also serves as concierge, were friendly and knowledgeable. Our room was small with a very comfortable double bed (we slept great every night), wireless internet access for our laptop (plus two computers in lobby connected to the internet for use by the hotel guests), a very nice bathroom with heated floor and a very hot, strong shower. We had a window which looked onto a courtyard and the room was very quiet. We rarely heard any outside noises at all. This hotel is next door to a Shell gas station, which is invisible from the street. The minimart sells everything from water to wine and beer, chocolates, croissants, etc... It is a great little stop just to pick up something for your room. An ATM was just steps away from the hotel door and the metro stop (Rue de Bac) is literally steps away. The hotel has umbrellas for your use, although I recommend a mini umbrella to keep with you all day. There were wonderful restaurants within walking distance as well as cafes and bakeries. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel as we thought it was a bit expensive and were very happy with a coffee and croissant from a neighboring cafe. All in all, we would definitely stay at the K+K again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful front desk people”
Reviews.Author: gene4655
Reviews.Content: Funny how perspectives differ! We stayed at the Cayre apparently the same week the guy from Tel Aviv did, and found just the reverse. The front desk was helpful in every respect, going out of the way to help us get reservations at a restaurant, and through a ParisVision tour. Having stayed at a half dozen "boutique" hotels on the left bank, we found the Cayre's rooms top notch. The amenities included were above average. Our room looked out over the Rue du Bac metro station and Raspail street, and we enjoyed both the view and the relative quietness of a Paris street front room. The views out over this typical Paris street were very attractive to us Yankees. Can't help but wonder whether one's attitude gets reflected in the conduct of the front desk people. Arrogant requests often elicit arrogant responses. Arrogant people usually find that wherever they go. In short, because of location, rooms, staff, amenities, we enjoyed our stay, and already have another reservation there for August.

Reviews.Title: “Very dissapointed, alhtough reviews were great”
Reviews.Author: Eti
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for a business trip based on the reviews in Tripadvisor. I was very disappointed with the room, which, although it was large, had no charm whatsoever and was lacking the most basic amenities a business traveler can expect when paying around 200 Euros a night (even in Paris). The most unpleasant thing was the noise level. I could hear people actually speaking in the hallway, although I had double checked with the reception before arriving and was GUARANTEED the rooms were soundproof. This is most definitely not the case. Moreover, the night receptionist was arrogant and unwilling to give me another room, or be understanding of my problem. The lobby and breakfast were mediocre. The service overall (reception, breakfast room, waiters etc..) was way below average. I moved to another (lovely) hotel immediately the next day. I do NOT recommend this hotel and would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best options in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Estadounidense
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel located in one of the best districts in Paris. The service staff was very accomodating and while there was not a concierge, the front desk offered themselves for any questions or needs. The rooms were large enough, the beds were comfortable and the view of the inner courtyard was excellent. The beds could have been spaced out a bit further (I could easily roll over into the other twin bed where my friend was sleeping). Fully stocked mini fridge with all sorts of drinks and snacks were available. Careful of the prices though! The bathroom was great! Hot water, very nice toiletries, and a heated (or so it seemed) floor, excellent lighting, and overall a super facility. The hotel is almost on top of a subway station which makes it very convienently located hotel. The lobby was excellent and if you have a lower floor room, it is worth taking the stairs every day just to get the view going up and down. Very nice. Some down points: The breakfast cost of 23 Euros per person turned me off even before I saw what would have been offered. That is just WAY to expensive. For that price we could have eaten in a very quaint cafe, visited a museum, and gotten a taxi back. The toilets aren't the best at flushing. Lots of water flows, but not a lot of flushing action means you may have to flush a few extra times to dispose of everything. Check out is at noon and the staff wants you out right at noon. If you have not checked out, they start calling immediately. You have to turn in your key upon leaving and pick it up upon entering. A little inconvenient for those who like to come and go as they please.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel having read the reviews on Tripadvisor, and we weren't disappointed. The location is excellent, the hotel has a metro stop right outside and we used the metro throughout the duration of our stay - it is safe and clean and easy to use. We had a double room on the sixth floor which was very quiet and a good size for a Parisian room, the bathroom was fairly small but well appointed, and the underfloor heating is a nice touch. Reception staff were nice and helpful, the breakfast was very good and fresh and the waiting staff were particularly pleasant. It is not a luxury hotel as another reviewer pointed out, but it is a very pleasant hotel in a good location and well worth a visit!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: PS234
Reviews.Content: The previous reviews on trip advisor were very helpful to me in choosing this hotel. I agree with all the positives. I just want to add a couple of small things that I didn't see. 1. the internet cable in the room hooks up to the phone jack, not the ethernet jack?? 2. Buffet breakfast is 23 euro, or coffee for 4 euro, no choice in between, such as coffee and a croissant. 3. Only a block and a half to the Joel Robuchon place. Gaya is also close, but just go to JR every night. As other guests, I'm also a fan of the gas station convenience store. I would definitely stay at the Cayre again.

Reviews.Title: “Tre manifique”
Reviews.Author: cvillian
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went on our honeymoon and found this hotel thanks to trip advisor. It was better then the reviews implied. The service was exquisite and the rooms large for European standards. We moved to another part of town for the end of our stay and we were sad to leave. We were there over the New Year so the radiant flooring was wonderful to come home to and the down comforters so cozy at night. We ordered room service for breakfast one day and both of us could have had our fill on one portion. I miss it already

Reviews.Title: “a warm quiet retreat”
Reviews.Author: mrstempyst
Reviews.Content: I went to Paris for the first time a week ago. The hotel was in a perfect location both for Metro access and for being within walking distance for many attractions such as the Musee Orsay and Musee Louvre. It was clean and quiet and the bed was very comfortable. I was on the courtyard side of the 3rd floor and it was very quiet there. It was large enough considering I was mostly there to sleep anyways. The room key was a little different but easy to use. The staff were very nice, and helpful with directions and reservations. My French is limited to a few cds in the car and my high school French from 25 years ago, but most of the staff spoke English quite well. There was a nice little bar on one side of the lobby, and 2 internet access stations on the other side. It seemed to be available whenever I needed to send a quick email home. There is a post office across the street, and many cute little sidewalk cafes within walking distance. It seemed to be a very safe area as well. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - quiet, comfortable, convenient”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am on a 10-day business trip - London, Paris, Dublin, Istanbul. Four nights at the K&K, my first time in Paris. A lovely hotel with polite, attentive staff who exhibit great patience as I try to recall my French. Room service is adequate and the location is wonderful. I did a 7 km stroll this evening to the Eiffel Tower and past several landmarks. The room is small (of course), but clean, bright, and warm. The bed is comfortable enough with good pillows. It is quiet, as well - rarely hear anyone adjacent or above. My room is not set up for the business traveler (e.g. internet connection cable next to bed, not chair/table). I travel quite a bit, though, and would certainly return here again.

Reviews.Title: “K&K is fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The K&K was a great hotel and I would highly recommend it. The rooms had a modern look and were very clean, especially the bathroom. It was right by a metro stop and in a nice, quiet area of Paris. I would stay there again definitely.

Reviews.Title: “K&K Cayre -- great location”
Reviews.Author: tennismom710
Reviews.Content: I have been thinking since we left Paris yesterday about this review, since there have been so many raves about this hotel. In part, I agree. The K&K Cayre is in the best possible location -- bridging the 6th and 7th arrondissements. Everything is accessible, and the neighborhood is a treasure trove of wonderful shops, restaurants, museums, etc. I am not sure about the "value" of this hotel, since we had a triple rather than a double. For a triple, it was very reasonably priced. One thing that does not come through in most of the other reviews, is that this hotel is not a top tier hotel -- not by any stretch a luxury hotel nor a charming left bank retreat. It is immaculately clean, with serviceable modern bathrooms (but no bathroom fan), but the interior looks more like a Comfort Inn than a Parisian hotel. I don't mean to suggest that it is comparable to a Comfort Inn -- it clearly has a few more amenities, including wonderful bed linens -- but no one should go here expecting the Montalembert. The staff at the desk was very helpful and accommodating, particularly Cedric, who made all our dinner reservations for us. All in all, a very good hotel experience. We would definitely stay at the Cayre again if the price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights with a 1 yr old baby and had a great time. The room was spacious enough for the cot and everything was spotless. Breakfast was excellent. Hotel is right in the centre and easy walking access to main attractions. We stayed off the tube and used the open top bus where you jump on and off. There are plenty of resturants nearby in the evenings. I would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Ticks all the Boxes”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent a lovely 4 nights at this hotel.The rooms are small but clean, functional and stylishly designed.The small but important things have been taken care of.The location of the hotel is superb. The staff were very friendly and the free internet access keeps you in touch with news at home. top marks!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Location-Exceptional-5 mins to Louvre etc, metro station across the road (rue de bac), 3 mins walk to the best cheese shop in Paris (where F. Mitterrand used to get his cheese) Surrounded by excellent boulangeries etc. Staff- Very pleasant, speak excellent English. Happy to go out of their way if asked. Although we never had to use them they seemed very good at organising clubs/restaurants etc for other people. Hotel: - Well designed and modern, rooms well equipped and comfortable, if a little small-in our room you couldn’t open the bathroom door without hitting the bed! Heated bathroom floor which is always a good thing in middle of night! Lobby has free high speed internet access for guest use and if you bring your laptop then each room has free high-speed internet access. Didn’t eat breakfast for several reasons a) it costs 23 euros per head. No matter how much you can eat I don’t think you can eat enough to justify almost £20 on breakfast! b) This is France, the land of amazing food. The hotel has excellent boulangeries in surrounding streets where a really special breakfast, eaten where ever you choose in one of the most romantic and beautiful cities in the world can be yours for 5 or 6 euros a head! This hotel doesn’t get 5/5 as it is expensive for what it is. (Rack rate on our room would have been 350 euro/night +breakfast!) If you can get it cheaper or with b-fast thrown in then this is the place to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: OTG
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the K & K in St. Germain de Pres on business and was pleasantly surprised by the rooms and staff. I am a frequent traveler. The rooms are small but not the smallest I've stayed in when visiting Paris. The heated bathroom floors are a treat. The staff is helpful and pleasant. The hotel is in a great location -- within walking distance to the Louvre, the Musee d'Orsay and exceptional boutique shopping in St. Germain de Pres. The Bon Marche department store (a more French experience than those found near the Opera) is a five minute walk. Breakfast is available in the hotel -- usually as part of the room booking and includes eggs, meat, cereals, and various breads. The fitness center is the one negative but most European hotels haven't yet figured out that treadmill does not make a fitness center. There is high speed Internet in the rooms at no extra charge -- a plus over larger chains. I would stay at the hotel again and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Cayre is tres fabulous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I celebrated my birthday with three of my closest friends in Paris. This was our first time visiting Paris and we had a wonderful time. Hotel Cayre is tres fabulous. The hotel location is perfect: The Metro Station- Rue de Bac, post office, and HSBC ATM are conveniently located across the street. There is even a Shell station- mini mart on the same block. Everything is in close proximity-you can walk to the Notre Dame, Latin Quarters and Seine River. The staff were so helpful, especially our friendly concierge- Jean Pierre. Paris is truly a beautiful and special place and I am already planning my second trip.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further -- this is the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Gramercy1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the K+K Cayre in January on business. Rooms are immaculate, well-decorated and extremely functional. Staff are quite welcoming and friendly. Free wifi in the lobby and high speed internet access in the rooms is another plus. Above all, the location (about 40 yards from Rue de Bac metro station) is the best! You can get anywhere in Paris from here. Shopping and patisseries are all within an easy walk. This is my second time at K+K Cayre, and I will absolutely come back again. Book here, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “K+K is a wonderful hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: JFTD
Reviews.Content: Stayed here January 6-11, 2006 and found everything about this hotel to be fabulous. All of the staff speak english and were extremely helpful. The room, while a little small by american standards but probably normal for european hotels, was impeccably clean. The whole hotel is furnished in a modern, minimalist style and everything seemed new, looked stylish, and functioned well. Little things like a heated tile floor in the bathroom, a box of chocolates waiting for us the first night we returned to our room, and huge, soft towels really made a difference. Free high speed internet access was provided in the room, and there was free wireless access and several internet terminals in the lobby. The breakfast (included in our low room rate) was outstanding with both hot (eggs, bacon) and cold (french bread, pastries, cheeses, pates, cold cuts, fruit) items. Juices, coffee, and unlimited champagne were also included. The hotel also has a great location: the metro is right outside your door, you are within walking distance of several popular attractions, and there are excellent bakeries and a 24 hour convenience store within one block. Our experience was so good that we are going to seek out other K+K hotels in our future travels!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect small hotel with great service!”
Reviews.Author: LesleySusan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the K+K Cayre for New Year's Eve and very much enjoyed it. I had a junior suite for myself, my son and my niece (3 single beds). My sister and her husband had a double room. The rooms were nicely decorated and the furnishings looked new. Bathrooms small but nice details like heated tile floors. We had a nice quiet view of the inner garden. The standard of service is high, the concierge was extremely helpful and the breakfast buffet offered something for everyone (it is quite expensive at €22 if you don't get it with your room rate). There are several nice bakeries near by if you don't eat breakfast at the hotel. We walked everywhere, although the Rue Du Bac (yellow line) metro stop is about 10 feet from the hotel door. I'm choosy about hotels and would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the K &K.”
Reviews.Author: FORHILL
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the K&K. The room was relatively large and very clean. The Hotel staff was extremely helpful (ask for Cedric). We had a fabulous view of the Eiffel Tower (you need to ask). It was a convenient location with the Metro right across the street. While the service was excellent, the room and its bathroom needed more drawers, hooks and shelves. We found the breakfast delicious but expensive if you don't get a deal from your travel agent. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel and staff, but can't beat the location!”
Reviews.Author: mkreese
Reviews.Content: Thank you Trip Advisor for helping me find this gem! In appreciation, I just had to add my raves to the reviews: Modern hotel with wonderful amenities including fine linens, towels, and heated bathroom floor. Nice size room with large comfortable beds. Would recommend staying in a room facing the street (instead of the inner courtyard)which include small balconies. No worries about noise as the hotel has been renovated with insulated windows. Our room (#611) overlooked the roofs with a terrific view of Sacre Coeur. Everyone on staff was incredibly helpful and friendly. All this was wonderful, but it was the location that won our hearts! Walked EVERYWHERE - Eiffel Tower, Louvre, D'Orsy, Isle St. Louis, Notre Dame, Champs-Elysee, and our new favorite - Musee Rodin...the list goes on. Just a few blocks from the Latin Quarter and Sorbonne. Rue de Bac metro stop outside the front door with a direct line (#12) to Gare Saint-Lazare provided easy travel to Normandy. My husband and I both agreed that we will stay here on each visit!

Reviews.Title: “Book here!!! You won't regret it!”
Reviews.Author: bella_farfalla28
Reviews.Content: I travel often in Europe and this was the best hotel I have stayed at. It is a modern, ultra-clean, top-notch-service hotel in a fabulous St. Germain des Pres neighborhood with the Rue du Bac metro stop just a hop from your doorstep (literally, it's in the 'median' on the hotel's boulevard...right there). Sure, it's a bit pricey, but it was well worth the money. The neighborhood is lovely to walk around (and a close walk to Musee D'Orsay and the Seine), as well as safe (I was alone on this trip). Staff is bilingual & polite. Even an American friend living in Paris came to admire the hotel. Go for it. It may not be the artsy-charming hotel with Amelie-esque types, but it's small, modern & fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many different hotels in Paris and the K&K was the best. The room and bed were large and comfy, and the Metro station right outside the door was convenient. Or you could walk in any direction and find great sites, shopping and restaurants. The staff was friendly and helpful. We even had an employee refuse a tip from us silly Americans.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: guateguyo
Reviews.Content: My wife and had a great one week stay at the K and K. The rooms were ample in size, quiet, and clean. The staff were great and the desk clerks speak 5 different languages and are very helpful. The neighborhood near Musee D'Orsey is great with lots of stores, restaurants, and typical parisian streets. The negative features are that if you are on the lower floors you can hear and feel the subway. I would not recommend it as a place for small children either. I would definately come back here due to the proximity to the great museums (D'Orsey, Louve, and Roden Museums are all 5 to 10 minutes by walking,) and the good restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: John R
Reviews.Content: With the Rue De Bac Metro right outside the door and the Louvre and Museum D'Orsay within walking distance, this proved to be an excellent choice. Service was superb, room was clean and modern and the breakfast made for a great start to the day. There is a gas station shop nearby for snacks etc and the hotel is close by boulangeries and supermarkets so there is always the option of a bed picnic if you don't fancy one of the (many) excellent local restaurants. Do take your laptop as they have free broadband in the rooms. Alternatively there are two systems in the lobby. Makes getting Paris info very easy. The real win though is the metro on the doorstep. Get a multiday pass and the city belongs to you!! We'll be back :-) Also, have to mention a fab restaurant, Le Rousseau at 45 Rue Du Cherche-Midi. It's walking distance from the hotel, the food is fab and the service superb. The place was full of locals the night we dined, but they could not have been more welcoming. Service in English or they let you try your French language skills if you so wish. Great night out. $60 for two, with a great bottle of wine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a great staff!”
Reviews.Author: DGKAtlanta_GA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the K+K Cayre for 4 nights from November 24th to 28th. We loved our stay. The hotel's location is perfect, right across the street from a Metro station (Rue du Bac) and walkable distance from the Louvre, Orsay, Notre Dame and Siene. The metro system was easy to use to get to some of the other places like the Eiffel tower and Invalides. The staff was really friendly, all of them spoke good English and were very helpful with giving restaurant recommendations and directions to various tourist attractions. Breakfast is expensive at the hotel if not included in the price of your stay, but there are a lot of cafes around the hotel where we found cheaper eating options. The room was small, but clean and confortable. Loved the bathroom with the heated floor! We would definitely stay at the K+K Cayre again if we went to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were just there over thanksgiving. The weather outside was frightful but the hotel was so delightful, so if you've no place to go try the K & K. It was our first trip to Paris and it couldn't have been better. The decor is very contemporary and chic. The rooms can be kind of small, but we expected that in an European hotel. Despite being French, the staff was really helpful. They gave us great restaurant recommendations every night and were just in general helpful and friendly. The location of the hotel can't be beat. The St. Germain neighborhood is beautiful with great restaurants and shopping. Paris is one of the most beautiful cities on the earth.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Great Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. The staff was friendly and spoke English very well. We didn't use them for much other than to arrange a car ride to the airport. The hotel is conveniently located across the street from a subway station which the only drawback of the hotel is hearing a light rumble if you are on one of the lower floors. This didn't bother us in the least but be aware of it. This and the fact that the bed was just two singles pushed together is why we didn't give it this hotel a 5. And when I say beds pushed together I mean that made two beds and tucked the comforter under each of the mattresses and then pushed them together. The breakfast is pretty good and the bathrooms have heated floors, good showers, and really big bath towels. If you are the adventurous type, the train ride from the airport is not bad at all. The subway stop is Rue du Bac and from it you can get to the Louve, Latin Quarter, Notre Dame area, Muse de Orsey, and Versailles fairly easily, We booked using their online site and it was easy and had some good deals. We paid 200 Euros a night including breakfast from November 19 - 21. We would definitely stay here again if the price was good, but for the stadard 380 Euro a night during high season, I may consider other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Cayre”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife and daughter for 3 nights in August. This was our first stay in Paris and we were delighted with the hotel - modern, clean and efficient.The only (really minor) problem we had was that the hotel had no electrical socket converters for Australian plugs (not a huge surprise I would suggest!) so I went to the department store down the road and bought my own (this store,incidentally, was the only place where the staff appeared to have absolutely no understanding of English). We booked direct with the hotel and found them very good to deal with. Our request for a room on the higher floors was met (previous reviewers had commented on the potential noise of the Metro on the lower floors but I would think this was not a real problem). Rooms are not huge but the 3 of us had no problem sharing a Family Room and we also had a balcony to sit out on. Breakfast was included in the rate and was adequate for our needs. You may well be able to eat cheaper in local cafes but that's a personal choice.Location was good being near the Seine and D'Orsay as well as a few steps from a Metro station. Plenty of good Coffee shops and restaurants nearby. We found the staff very friendly and helpful and all spoke good English. Paris is a breathtaking city in many ways and, despite their reputation, we found the Parisiens generally very welcoming and friendly. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Unknown Paris Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel K&K Cayre in Paris France from September 26 - October 3, 2005. It was our first visit to Paris and our travel agent found this hotel for us. I would highly recommend the K&K Cayre primarily because of the location. We walked to many attractions, including the Louvre, Orsay, and Rodin Museums, and the Invalides. We were also in walking distance to the Seine, where we used the Batobus boat to travel up and down the river to get to other places. There is also a Metro stop on the corner from the hotel. The staff at the hotel were extremely courteous and accommodating. We celebrated our 32nd anniversary while there. The staff made reservations at the Bilboquet Jazz Supper club, which was also walking distance from the hotel. The breakfast buffet was part of our package. We enjoyed the convenience and the food was good. There are two computers in the lobby that enabled me to communicate with family at home via the Internet. We had a standard double room. It was small, but very nice. The bathroom was very modern, with a full tub and shower and heated marble floors. The bed was one of the most comfortable I've slept in. The mini mart in the Shell station next door was very convenient and saved us lots of money! I would definitely stay at this hotel again and highly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Ouiparis
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at K&K for four nights last week. We were very impressed and satisfied with the hotel. We found the staff very courteous and helpful (and all spoke fluent English). The free internet access in the hotel lobby was an added bonus. Our room was located on the third floor with a view of Blvd Raspail. We loved watching the morning hustle and bustle of Parisians getting to work.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the K + K”
Reviews.Author: Noirc'estnoir
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the K+k hotel in St. Germain from wed. 12th to sat 15 th october 2005. I booked through the hotels website and specified a room with best view. We stayed on the top floor (7th) room 704. We had a great view of the eiffel tower and we could also see the arc de triomphe. At night the view was spectacular. The room was small the en-suite tiny for an executive room. The staff were excellent. Most seemed to speak english especially after my 'Je parle tres pous le francais' in an irish accent Overall the french people were very friendly and helpful with the exception being the waiters in minims cafe on rue royale. Beer at 9 euro in bars but only 2 euro in supermarkets. Overall the K + K highly recommended. Paris beatiful in autumn. Too much to see in short time.

Reviews.Title: “Overly Priced”
Reviews.Author: ABD119
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine but doesn't deserve the pricing nor the title "Boutique". Rooms are Parisienly small. There's no sense of intimacy but of a chain hotel.

Reviews.Title: “5 star service”
Reviews.Author: sina78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the K & k for 2 nights during mid September and had a very pleasant stay. We arrived around 10am in the hotel and even the hotel was fully booked the night before the staff at the reception had promptly arranged a room to be ready for us for only around 15 minutes wait. The room was quitely modern though on the small side but it didn't bother us at all. The most impressive aspect of the hotel is the service we had received from the staff from the very start, every request was very promptly attended to, staff at the front desk named Cedric and another one who works at night (can't remember his name) were both extremely helpful and polite. The location of the hotel is excellent being right across from the metro station, we stayed on the 2nd floor where we could hear faint rumbling of the subway but caused absolutely no troubles to a good night sleep. There are quite a few restaurants around the area, we ate at a restaurant called Aux Fins Gourmets one night and the food was quite good, it was jammed pack with locals. And there is also a restaurant which we had read good reviews earlier called the Ferme Saint-Simon 2 blocks walk from the hotel but we didn't get around to eat there. There are also some very nice boutiques around the area. We would definitely recommend the K & K to everyone who comes to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the K&K Cayre for a few days earliest this month as part of our honeymoon. It is in a great location literally just over the road from Rue de Bac Metro station and is very modern and funky. The staff are very friendly and helpful (they sorted out booking some tickets for us for a show + had an iron and ironing board sent up to our room very prompty when asked etc etc). They have free internet acces in the hotel lobby and the restaurant, whilst not huge, is very nice too. We paid around £170 i night (including breakfast) i recall for a double room at the back of the hotel which we thought was pretty reasonable for Paris in this location etc. It was not a huge room but i understand that is fairly normal for Paris. I would be very surprised if anyone who stayed here did not really enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value with modern touches”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location with the metro line right across the street (expect a number of transfers from the airport) and a convenient store at the gas station next to the hotel was big plus. The best amenity of the hotel is the high speed internet, a nice gym, and the breakfast buffet. A con would be the staff at the front desk, they were somewhat helpful so don’t expect them to go the extra mile for you. I also found returning/requesting the key at the front desk every time you left the hotel a little inconvenient. Overall, the great value with modern amenities compensates the cons at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good clean Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: ParisSept2005
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was small (that's expected in Paris) but very clean and the staff is very helpful and friendly. The metro is close by. If you hang your clothes up you can store your suitcase and have enough room. It was only two of us in the room and we had a balcony. Air conditioning works well.

Reviews.Title: “quite a find!”
Reviews.Author: Happyhubby&Daddy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights while in Paris on business..Most reviews are written from the "in Paris on holiday" perspective but I was here on business. The in room internet was great..the breakfast was very good..the service was friendly..however I did sniff a bit of attitude from the night desk staff when I first checked in. I have stayed at the Lutetia for the past 3 years and got fed up with an extrememley over priced, dirty, dingy room. Tried the K&K based on the reviews and was very happy. I would most certainly recommend this hotel for business and travel!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Disappointing. Our 2 Classic Double rooms were sparsely furnished. No bedside drawer. No desk drawer. Just 3 drawers, barely enough for 1 person. My clothes had to remain in my suitcase for 5 days. The breakfast, at 22 euros each, must have been amongst the dearest in Paris. It was too expensive to try. We saw cheaper breakfasts at top Paris restaurants. Location good. Staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, cozy hotel”
Reviews.Author: zeppgirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really great. It's centrally located (when you get off the metro, you can see the hotel from the stop), and right next to a gas station (very nice for buying snacks and water). The front desk was fairly helpful and did book tickets for the Lido for me the night I called to ask. The rooms aren't big, but are clean and modern. Ours had a nice balcony. I was pleased that the room service brought us up an iron to keep during our stay. We had been trying to get an iron to use other places, but this was first that actually let us keep on (instead of charging us 5 euros per item to steam iron). There is free internet downstairs, and a buffet every morning. I don't think the buffet is worth the price (something like 16 euros per person), but maybe it is if you go early enough. We went half an hour before it was ending and there was nothing good to eat. All of the cheese and lox was gone, and even after someone else asked them to bring out more food, the staff did not. We told the manager this when we checked out and they took it off our bill. However they did kind of grill us first, asking us if we had first asked the staff to bring out more food. Anyway, great hotel, but very expensive for what you get. I think anywhere in Paris this is the case, though, so if you're just going on the basis of how much I recommend this hotel, it's up there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: anushka
Reviews.Content: The K+K is in a great location with lovely rooms that are clean, modern and well furnished. Breakfast is very good, offering a lot of choice and is available until late morning. The only downside to a very good stay was the reception staff. While the majority of the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, the reception staff made every question seem like we were causing them hardship because we were interrupting them from their conversation with each other. After getting the same reaction four times we didn't bother asking them anything further and organised our own cabs, restaurants and sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “The K+K is Better than OK!”
Reviews.Author: Tackle
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel in St. Germain. Location: Excellent: easy walking distance to many sights. Check-in: Fast and efficient. Room: Large by European standards, modern, quiet, clean, well maintained, with a very comfortable bed. Lots and lots of storage space. Bath: Good-sized and very nice. Breakfast: EXCELLENT choice of eggs, vegetables, fruit, yogurt, pastries, cheese, cold meats, coffee, tea, and juices. Check-out: Efficient and fast. You can't go wrong staying here. The hotel staff is efficient but not the friendliest in the world. FREE INTERNET access. Plus the hotel has computer terminals available in the lobby if you don't have a laptop.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SB-202
Reviews.Content: This is a very modern looking hotel. The rooms were very clean! The washroom tiles were heated! The free internet access was a bonus, considering my husband brought his laptop and we were able to email our family and friends from our room. We had complimentary breakfast which was very good...great variety and excellent service. It is within walking distance to almost everything...Eiffel Tower, Arc de Triompe, Louvre...and if you don't want to walk, the Metro is across the street! We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “concierge chose very well”
Reviews.Author: medalie
Reviews.Content: My daughter and i have just come back from the cayre. The location was fantastic with the metro not even a 2 minute walk away. The concierge who was on duty at 7pm each night gave us the most wonderful ideas to spend our evenings. The rooms are small but the beds very comfortable and clean and decorated in a modern way. They could not have been more helpful ie with adaptors and chargers. I would have loved a turndown service but that would make the hotel more expensive I am sure. We would love to return which is high praise from an 11 year old and a mum in her 30's.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Parisian 4*; ideal location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For $200/night (Expedia), this is a superb value for the traveler who wants to sleep well in the center of Paris at a solid 4*. Admittedly, I spent little time in the hotel proper, but I was pleased with a tastefully appointed room of the modern variety, and a balcony overlooking a typical, elegant side street in St. Germain. My limited interactions with the staff in both French and English were pleasant, and I observed the desk staff effectively helping other guests. Other reviews comment on the gas station next door, which put me off a bit prior to staying at the hotel. Realize that this is a little Parisian gas station with a few pumps beneath an unrelated building whose facade blends into the scene. The gas station could just as easily be a patisserie instead. In all respects, the neighborhood is typical St. Germain, not some marginalized area. Fine dining options abound nearby. For example, we strolled to l'Arpege, but that's a topic for another review...

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: anthonyuk
Reviews.Content: Having in stayed in Paris many times before, I know there are many dud places to stay there. Thankfully, this is not one of them. We got a great internet deal on the hotel website. The hotel itself is right next to a metro station which is very convenient. I have seen some reviews complain about the noise from the station. I was on the first floor and although you got the occasional rumble sound, only the lightest sleepers would be affected. The rooms are very clean and fresh looking. They are not huge (but this is Paris!) by any means but they are well appointed. The bathrooms are also very pretty and the underfloor heating would be great in winter. Service was very efficient and friendly. Also try to get a deal including breakfast which is great - eggs/bacon/cheeses as well as pate, smoked salmon etc etc. There was even sparkling wine on offer and the coffee was strong enough to wake you out of the worst jet lag. A lot of the attractions are also within walking distance but even where they are not, the metro is very easy to use. My only slight hesitation on this place is the price. We got a good internet deal (180 euros per night) but given the size of the rooms, much more than this price would have been a little hard to swallow.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again...!”
Reviews.Author: bambi
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor and were not disappointed. We arrived a few hours prior to the check in time but were immediately checked in which was a bonus. We requested a quiet room (after reading that the metro can be heard on the lower floors) and were given a room on the 5th floor. It was very quiet, a good size and extremely clean. I loved the heated floors in the bathroom! the bed was a good size, the sheets white and crisp and pillows comfy! The location was fantastic. The area not touristy and the metro on the doorstep. However, it is within a short walking distance of the seine and other tourist attractions. We bought a carnet which is a book of 10 tickets which i believe is cheaper than buying 10 individual tickets. We didn't have breakfast in our package. However, I believe if you can find the K+K website and book online there, rather than with an agent you get cheaper room rates and breakfast included. We did eat at the La Petite Chaise after reading the reviews on here but were very disappointed. It was very bland and I wouldn't recommend it. We ate at the L'Avenue which apparently is where the french rich and famous go! It was very nice and very pricey (for us anyway!). The shell garage next door to the hotel was also extremely handy and we stocked up on snacks and some english teabags and milk as the hotel only provided green tea and creme in the room. On our departure day our train wasn't leaving til late afternoon. the hotel had no problems with looking after our bags. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. It was just what we were looking for to make our stay in Paris enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel - you cant go wrong here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: K and K Cayre is excellent in every way. you cant go wrong here. the breakfast was excellent (complete with champagne). the staff is excellent - friendly - helpful - and are amazed at any American that can speak evern a few words of French. the looks on their faces was comical when we spoke French to them! the Metro outside the front door is so nice. ride the metro line (number 12 - green line) straight to Montmartre north and two stops south (toward the Eiffel Tower) to some great shopping streets. we have stayed in Paris twice - on the right and left banks. this hotel on the left bank is better in every way. convenience, cleanliness, location, metro availability, close to museums - shopping - nice safe area too. we had our daughter with us in a triple room and the size was very nice. beds were comfortable and clean. cant say enough good things about k and k! we will definitely go back someday and are looking forward to it!

Reviews.Title: “K + K Cayre Good Left Bank Location”
Reviews.Author: KirkandMimi
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and helpful. We arrived hours before check-in, and they offered to keep our bags so we could go explore with the maps they provided and come back to check in at our leisure. Once we returned a few hours later, the rooms (2 of them adjoining) were waiting. The rooms were large and well appointed. We had wi-fi available in the rooms which allowed us internet access at all times free of charge on our own laptop. Had we not brought our own laptop, we could have used the free business center in the lobby. There was a little coffee area in the lobby which had delicious coffee at reasonable prices. Our rooms included a daily breakfast. The scrambled eggs were not quite cooked enough, nor the bacon, but it did taste very good and we were able to fill up on meats, breads, pastries, fruit, juices, coffee and (eggs and bacon - very tasty even though under cooked) before each day of sightseeing. The location of our hotel was great. We could walk to the Seine within 5-6 minutes or we could hop on the metro which had the entrance right outside of our hotel. If you decide to use the metro, it is very cost effective to purchase the visite pass which allows unlimited use for 1, 2, 3, 4 or 5 days. It is a great idea and saves miles of walking. The metros are very easy to use. They must be safe since we were taking them at all hours, and there were many single parisian women using the metro by themselves late at night. There were several cafe's near our hotel. But we most enjoyed using the convenience store at the Shell station next door - you have to look for it, it is underground - just turn right when you exit the hotel. They close at 10:00PM, but they run out of the delicious french bread by 8:00pm, so get there early to pick up meats and french bread at a very reasonable price. Be careful of purchasing the cheeses though, they tasted great, but they stunk up our room when we would open our refrigerator. We finally had to throw away the cheese. Had we purchased a smaller amount to eat in one seating, we would have been fine. The staff of the hotel was kind to us and admitted (unlike a lot of the French) that they spoke English. This made it nice for us so we were able to go on a lot of excursions from the hotel and find restaurants with their help.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location!”
Reviews.Author: CA_Foodie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this wonderful hotel the weekend the Tour de France ended in Paris. We selected this hotel based on the reviews on TripAdvisor, and we were very happy that we decided to stay here. We booked a room on the hotel's website, and got the best deal that I've seen: 180 Euros including breakfast! The breakfast was the best that we had on our European trip. (We had also stayed at hotels in Rome and Florence.) There were fresh grapefruit halves, as well as other fresh fruit every morning. The croissants, breads, cheese, smoked salmon and meats were all very tasty. The service was also very professional and courteous. I did not have any problems requesting soft boiled eggs every morning. I would definitely book a hotel rate that includes breakfast, because the regular charge for breakfast is 22 Euros per person, which is a bit much! We had also written to the hotel management to request a room with a view of the Eiffel Tower prior to our arrival, with the understanding that this was a request only. We were not disappointed when we arrived. We were given a top floor room with a large picture window with a lovely view of the Eiffel Tower, the Hotel des Invalides, and city roof tops. We could also see Sacre Coeur when we looked out the window to our right. The only caveat is that the top floor rooms are not non-smoking. Luckily the weather was not too hot, so we were able to air out the room by leaving the window open. The bellman was also extremely helpful, and delivered an air freshener spray. Did I mention the box of chocolates in the room with a welcome note when we arrived? The location of the hotel is very convenient. We loved being able to walk to the St. Germain des Pres area, but not being right in the middle of the touristy scene. With the metro station right in front of the hotel, and a taxi stand on the Rue du Bac, it was very easy to travel to any location. It was also great to have free internet connection. We did not have a computer with us. We used one of the three free internet stations in the lobby and business center. There was never much of a wait, even though the hotel was full. I only have one small complaint about the hotel. The front desk personnel do not really know the restaurants in the area. I would definitely not rely on them for restaurant recommendations. Do your own research before you go, and have the hotel make dinner reservations for you. For example, we ate at La Petite Chaise on the hotel staff's recommendation. The food was okay, not great. In a city with so many great choices, okay is not acceptable, especially if you only have limited time in Paris. One of the restaurants that we wanted to try on this trip was L'Atelier de Joel Robuchon. The front desk was able to make a dinner reservation for us. (The restaurant only accepts lunch reservations, and 6:30 PM dinner reservations.) Then we found out that the restaurant is only a two minute walk from the hotel! Definitely go to this restaurant. It is every bit as wonderful as the New York Times review claims. The small tasting plates are more interesting than the regular sized entrees. There is also a 98 Euro tasting menu, but you have to ask for it. Another restaurant we tried is a bistrot on l'Ile-St.-Louis called Mon Vieil Ami. The decor is modern, chic. The food is really delicious. The lunch only plat du jour are usually the best deals. The restaurant has a prix fixe menu of 39 Euros at lunch time. We highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again. We have already recommended this hotel to friends who will be visiting Paris soon. Bon voyage!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Clean and Modern”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the "K" in late April and found it to be very clean and accomodating. It was a short juant to the D'Orsay and we could walk and take the metro to all of the major attractions. It's great value for the money, staff helpful, and we found it to be all that we expected and more and loved the modern decor. Taking my husband there next month.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. The room was small, but that's normal for Europe. The front desk was helpful (and spoke English well). They helped me book reservations for dinner a few times (some of desk clerks accepted a tip, others did not, but I always offered). There is a computer free of charge to check the internet. Only complaint was that the breakfast was expensive, and the room/bathroom was small. The location is walking distance to all the sites and there is a grocery store and cafes close by. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great and classy location!”
Reviews.Author: AndBeyond
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in early July 2005 based upon the reviews posted here and was not disappointed. I booked an executive upper floor room through a special that is only found on the hotels chain's website and got a good deal - 250 Euros, breakfast for 2 was included and it supposedly included a drink at the bar (although I never got a voucher or went to the bar to claim this). The room is modern, large and the furniture very Ikea-like with a comfortable king bed (no 2 twins) and fridge (minibar). The view from our 5th floor room (w/tiny stepout ledge) included the Eiffel Tower and the Invalides dome - very Paris! We had moved from another hotel near the Opera House and found this location much more tourist-friendly since there were markets and bakeries nearby that were great for snacks and drinks. The Shell station right next door was really convenient (had fresh bread, sandwiches, fruit, everything)! We walked down to St. Germain and had awesome cheese, caramel and chocolate souffles at Le Recamier! Go to the Le Petit Chaise nearby too - very reasonable and good food. The Musee d'Orsay/Seine is a few blocks away. It is a nice, relatively quiet, upscale, residential area so conveniences and restaurants abound. A good place to be based while seeing Paris!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location... Classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location. My brother and I spent a total of 4 nights at this hotel. We found it be be very comfortable. The staff very helpful and you could not ask for a better location. You can walk to the Latin quarter, the Louvre, Musee D'Orsey all within 5-10 mins. The Metro is across the street. We would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Adoredthe K+K”
Reviews.Author: Raleigh
Reviews.Content: Loved, loved, loved this hotel! We just got married and decided on a honeymoon in Paris. I have traveled overseas and know that many hotels aren't the same as American. I read a lot of reviews and became frustrated and then came upon the K+K reviews. Everyone had such nice things to say. When we got there it was exactly how we had hoped. The front desk were helpful and kind, the rooms were adorable (small with an IKEA look), the maid was fantastic, bathroom was cute with heated floors and our view was great! I have never stayed in a nicer hotel in Europe. You simply can't do much better! You will love Paris! Everyone was so nice (we weren't epecting that), there is so much to do, and the hotel is so close to everything!!! There's the gas station right next door (sounds weird, I know) but it's great to pick up late nite snack, water etc. And the nicest, yummiest bakery right behind the hotel. I hope you will stay here! We cannot wait to go back! Have a wonderful tim! Au Revior!

Reviews.Title: “very clean & spacious; great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room is spacious, very clean & quiet. I love the calm contemporary unpretentious decor. Heated maple floor in the bathroom is a nice touch. The top floor has view of the Eiffel Tower. Subway station is just steps from its front door. Kenzo and Paul Smith shops are just down the street. Mid-to-high-end shopping, e.g. LV, Cartier, at St. Germaine is within walking distance. 10 min. walk to D'osay museum; 20 min. to Notre Dame; 30 min. to Louvre. Convenience store next door has cheap bottled water (from 0.4 euro for 1.5L), beer & wines (from 2 euro for 750ml!). I could not ask for more at this price. One last tip: it was actually cheaper to book the hotel by calling directly. They gave me a lower price (~CAD350@ for city-view top floor with queen-size bed) and include breakfasts and welcoming cocktails.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at K+K Hotel Cayre in Paris. Rooms were small but clean and modern. Very central. Great location for exploring Paris on foot. Internet access in the lobby was very convenient. Les Flores Brasserie on Rue du Bac (just around the corner) was great for coffee and pastries in the morning. We will stay here again on our next visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: kamcc12
Reviews.Content: The staff was very pleasant and helpful. The neighborhood was lovely with plenty of great specialy shops and the Metro station was invaluable. Highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Paris on May 1, 2005. This hotel is in a great location and very clean. The rooms are small but comfortable. The bathroom and sheets were very clean (white sheets with white duvet covers). The staff is very helpful. I would stay here again and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday visit, first time in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are a couple from New York, celebrating my wife's birthday. We spoke very little French, but were warmly welcomed by the staff at this charming hotel. The room was typically small, but cozy, with a mini-bar, modern design with hot shower and heated marble floor. The Metro was right at our door step, a most convient aspect, as it was our primary mode of transportation during our trip. We found charming restaurants in the area, especially Maxoff's on rue de Verneuil, just off rue de Bac. We are planning our return visit to this hotel as we very pleased and treated very well by all. Au revoir.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern, and convenient”
Reviews.Author: TraderRick
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay at the K & K Hotel Cayre. I selected this hotel based on the numerous favorable reviews and the location. We were not disappointed. We arrived in the immaculate, modern lobby around 10:00 am, but were able to check right in. Matthieu was manning the front desk and was efficient and polite. Our request for a non-smoking room was honored and we were led to room 208, which was an interior view of a small garden courtyard. I was a little concerned about being right next to the service elevator but we never heard a peep from it. Like most rooms in Paris, this too was small, but quite adequate. We had a full closet with plenty of hangers, a small set of drawers in the closet with a small room safe on top of the drawers. The TV was on a stand that doubled as the mini-bar (a dorm style fridge) and a drawer containing a coffee maker and a supply of teas and coffees. The decor was sparse (one small, unique picture). The bed was a double and low to the ground, but comfortable. The overall feel was sort of a danish modern meets Asian style. The bathroom was very modern, with Grohe fixtures. GREAT shower water pressure! The half-door on the tub/shower was a little tricky to keep from splashing water out on the floor, but otherwise it was great. Speaking of the floors, yes, they are heated and look/feel like marble. A nice treat for the feet, to be sure! Ok, as for the noise level we only had two issues. An adjacent building was doing some remodeling and jack-hammer work and you could hear it anywhere in the building, but it was only during the day and didn't start until around 9:00 am, so as long as you weren't trying to sleep during the day, it was no problem. As for the sounds of the metro running underground, we were on the 2nd floor (by American standards, the 3rd floor -- the ground floor is considered floor zero) and you could notice the sound on a regular basis, but it was a low steady rumble, and not bad at all. We sleep with ear plugs when we stay in hotels anyway, and were not bothered by the Metro at all. It's worth it just to have the metro so convenient and close by! Right out the front door! The Post Office is directly across the street as are several bank ATM's. A short walk gets you to a fine selection of cafe's and restaurants, including the oft recommended La Petite Chaise. We celebrated my wife's birthday there, and were very please with the meal and the service. The waiters were attentive, polite, understood our english and halting attempts at French, and never acted condscending. We passed on the breakfast buffet, as it was not included in our room package and they were charging 22 euros per person. We opted for the Cafe St. Germain a few doors down. Yes, the Shell station next door is a great convenience for snacks and drinks. You can buy everything from wine/beer/liquor to TicTacs to Cheese there. Also close by is a great bakery, and the GO20 Supermarche (sort of like a small grocery store) just around the corner has a great selection of VERY reasonably priced wines. We also enjoyed a bike tour to Versailles on Fat Tire Bike tours -- an American owned/operated tour company that also does night tours. We would definitely stay at Hotel Cayre again!

Reviews.Title: “K+K Cayre - Pleasantly satisfied”
Reviews.Author: pearlsandivy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at the K + K. The hotel was magnificent and I must say the reviews here on tripadvisor were accurate. We were a group of 16 and all parties were satisfied. LOCATION: Rue de Bac - after all the walking during the day, it was so refreshing to resurface from the underground train and see the front door of your hotel right in front of you. Cafes,shops,monoprix - all within walking distance and it was always a pleasant environment ROOMS: This concerned me the most, but I have not one complaint. I was spoiled by the heated marble floors in the bathroom. And the beds, felt SOOO good after those long days in the city BREAKFAST: It was included in our room package and was well worth it, especially for the large group, because it was an excellent meeting point before starting the day. I truly fell in love with the city of Paris and with this hotel. Whenever, I return and I will return. K+K will definitely be my choice of accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: jeanneo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderfully located in a not-so-touristy area of Paris. I cannot remember if it is Left Bank or Right Bank, but it is near the Latin Quarter and within walking distance of the Musee d'Orsay. The building is beautiful, and you would not expect the very modern interior. We had a nice balcony overlooking the Boulevard. It was a great view. The room was tight, but well-equipped. The buffet breakfast that was included with the rate was fantastic! We ate so much there that we would usually skip lunch during the day. There is a Metro station directly outside of the hotel. My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights at the end of our honeymoon in France. We enjoyed the lack of tourist crowds and the higher-end stores in this area. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: geechiegirl
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at the K+K. While not on par with the Ritz or Four Seasons, the hotel has nice amenties and the rooms were very attractive. The staff spoke english and they were extremely helpful. The breakfast was delightful. On one occasion I noticed a slight vibration from the metro running below the hotel, but it only lasted for a minute. I'd suggest a room on an upper floor if possible. What truly makes the K+K such a great stay has to be the location. The K+K is centrally located with numerous shops and cafes nearby. We walked to all of the attractions when the weather permitted and took the metro located across the street when it rained.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great, great, great! Just got back yesterday (April 1) from 5 days in Paris. We had a triple room and it was large, extremely well furbished, and obviously top-of-the line. The heated bathroom floor and exquisite duvets were amazing. We searched this site for 2 months before making a decision on a hotel. The staff was very helpful in suggesting restaurants, cafes, and brasseries. Like everyone else says about K & K, skip the breakfast, and go to the Shell mini-mart next store for fresh bread, cheeses, milk, etc. Bravo K & K!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: dosha3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited for Valentines Day. We thought it was perfect occasion for a great price. We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived. KK was very stylish and laid back. The service was good, I'd say the day crew was better then the night crew. Location is great you have the metro right across the street. You can walk to shop if you like. We really enjoyed ourselves, considering it was extremely cold. We definitely plan on visiting again when its warmer. Paris is a beautiful city!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: carorab
Reviews.Content: We have been to Paris many times and have always found gems to stay at. As we prefer European style hotels, we look for style, atmosphere and service. This hotel excelled at all three. It is a modern redo of an old building so expect modern rooms. The service was excellent but not overly knowledgable about restaurants. The location is perfect. Subway at the front door, a few block walk to fantastic restaurants and shopping, steps to the Louvre and Seine. We would definitely stay there again. Ask for a room with a balcony. If you get a corner room ask to be moved as they are very small. It is always a good idea in Europe to ask to look at your room before you take it. If you like the Holiday Inn this is not for you. The breakfast buffet is excellent and definitely worth the $$$. We usually just grab a coffee and croissant somewhere but loved starting our day with this spread. Beds are comfy, bathrooms marble and beautifully appointed, cherry wood cabinets, free internet access in a business centre and the lobby is a great way to keep in touch with home. Don't tell too many people about it as you may find it hard to get in soon.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful K+K Hotel Cayre”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the K+K Hotel Cayre from July 28th to August 3rd, 2004. It was our first trip to Paris so I was already in awe of the city but I was very impressed with the hotel. The location was fantastic. It is across the street from the Rue de Bac Metro which we took almost everywhere and a 10 minute walk to the Louvre or to the main area of St. German du Pres. The hotel rooms are tiny as everywhere in Paris but we had a big bed with a down comforter and down pillows which were very comfortable. Big fluffy towels in the marble bathroom too! The breakfast offered everything from bacon to croissants and it was included in our rate.
