There was a convenience store next door at the Shell station that is practically hidden away in there and we stocked up on water and snacks there to enjoy in the early evening when we came back from touring. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: bluesealover
Reviews.Content: We stayed at K&K from 2/20 to 2/26. Overall, it is a very good hotel. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet is good - scrambled eggs, bacon, bread, croissants (even chocolate croissants!), cereal, fruit. There is a Shell station next door if you need snacks, water, or anything. The Rue du Bac station is right out the door of the hotel; post office is across the street, several ATMs are available (there's a HSBC bank ATM down the street, named CCF). Our room was on the third floor facing the side street. No problems at all with the room, shower had great water pressure. The bathroom floor had radiant heat, which was so enjoyable on these cold February mornings! The bathtub is great; hot water is plentiful. Bed was comfy and clean. I hated the hair dryer because it was too weak for me (I use a diffuser at home), but pretty much every hotel in the world has the worst hair dryers. The hotel is within walking distance of Invalides, Orsay, Louvre, Notre Dame. We were there six nights and didn't bother buying a Paris Visite pass (for Metro) because it was overpriced at 28 euros per person. We bought three carnets (one carnet is 10 tickets, about 10.50 euros) plus about six to eight additional individual tickets. We saved more that way than buying the Visite. A word of warning if you bring kids - there are a couple pay per view porn channels on tv in the hotel room and you can get about 15 to 25 seconds worth of explicit images before the payment screen pops up.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean, and classy”
Reviews.Author: Sonicthehedge1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a six night stay, loved the K+K. Booked through expedia (worked out to about 180 US$ per night, tax/fees included), made contact with the hotel through e-mail before we arrived and they were very prompt in replying and accomodated our request for an upper level, non-smoking room. The location is excellent, just across the street from the metro, boulangeries/patisseries/grocery all within 1 block. Excellent neighborhoods - St. Germain de Pres and the latin quarter within walking distance, great for walking around, cafes, and restaurants. Generally an excellent central location for Paris as well, could walk easily to the Louvre, Musee d'Orsay, Ile de la Cite. The lobby was well lit, modern appearing, and had computers for free use. The staff were helpful in making restaurant reservations for us and were courteous. We were given a room on the 5th floor. I could faintly hear the metro when my ear was pressed against the pillow. It wasn't too bothersome but I could imagine it to be louder on lower floors. The room was nice, probably average size for Europe, but with nice wood paneled walls, bright lighting, and fresh/clean linens. There was adequate storage space and a mini-bar refrigerator into which we could just squeeze in a few of our own things from the market. The beds were covered solely with a crisp white duvet which was reassuring because they must wash them between guests. No dirty top bedcover to deal with. The bathroom was nice, modern, clean, with heated flooring. Always had hot water and the shower pressure was good. Oddly, the shower door only covered half the length of the tub (our guess was an attempt at modern design and trying to make the space seem more open). Daily room cleaning was prompt and thorough, the room was always cleaned by the time we got tired of museums for the day ~3-5PM. Our room rate did not include breakfast but from other reviews it sounds nice. If not included in your room rate it is 22 Euro per person (ouch). Wasn't a problem for us though since we would pop across the street to pick up pastries and drinks before heading out. The pictures on their website are an accurate reflection of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MBNative
Reviews.Content: We just visited Paris on 2/11/05 and we stayed at the K&K. The lobby is impressive, modern and extremely clean. The front desk clerks were extremely knowledgeable and helpful. Our nice-sized room faced a courtyard and was extraordinarily clean. The bathroom had heated ceramic floor tiles and was also very clean. We left for Geneva and when we arrived (see my horrid review of the Hotel Le Richemond in Geneva) we promptly returned to Paris and changed our plans and returned to the K&K. We were given a room facing the street, however, the street noise was not a factor. The executive double is much larger than the standard room, but both were quite comfortable. I would not hesitate to return to this hotel in the future and would recommend it anybody looking for a smartly located (right in front of the Rue de Bac metro station), modern hotel for their trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need right outside your door”
Reviews.Author: Erzengel
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the K+K Hotel Cayre in December '04, and we were very pleased with the hotel. It's tucked away on a quiet street, but literally, everything a traveler needs is right outside the front door. Need some snacks, something to drink? A Shell mini mart is right next door. Post office is across the street for sending those promised postcards. An ATM machine is right around the corner, and the metro station (Rue du Bac) is right out front, just a few steps away. For dinner, you have several choices. We were very happy with the room service, but if you felt like Chinese, there is an excellent Chinese restaurant a block away, not to mention several bistros and patisseries. I think we gained about 10 pounds just from this leg of our trip. As for the hotel amenities, our rooms were clean and cozy. Not too chic, but just a regular room with everything you need. The hotel also provided free internet in our rooms and 2 PCs in the lobby. The front desk/concierge was very helpful in arranging airport transfers and transportation to Versailles. All in all, I really liked this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Fault this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and my girlfriend stayed in this hotel in mid-January 2005, and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We had looked at many hotels previously and had been put off a lot of them due to negative reviews, however having finally decided on the Hotel Cayre, we were not disappointed. The room was modern, clean and of a high standard. The concierge was friendly and very helpful (he recommended and booked a restaurant, gave us advice on where and when to go etc). The location, though not very close to any particular sight, is a good central point from which to visit all of the major landmarks (Notre Dame, Louvre, Arc de Triomphe, Eiffel Tower). Don't let a negative review put you off this high quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: champsmom
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel K and K from 1/6/05 - 1/10/05 with my two teenage daughters. The hotel was very clean. We arrived at around 8:00 AM, exhausted from our flight, and we had our room within an hour. The staff was very nice...in fact everyone in Paris that we encountered was nice and helpful. We did not encounter any negative attitudes, etc. The hotel is in a great location - we walked everywhere. The neighborhood was nice and seemed safe. I would definitely recommend this hotel to my friends and I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Take my Advice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited this fixed-up dump in Dec. 04 for our honeymoon. I was told our room would be on the 5th floor when we arrived the room was on the 3rd floor in a corner with hardly usable facilties. We told the front desk it was unacceptable-the hotel was full so they agreed to change us the following morning. We woke to housekeeping pushing carts and other guests talking outside our room the walls are paper thin. we went down to find out what was taking so long with the new room we were told I'm sorry it became available but we already rented it to another guest!! Mind you this was noon. finally we were able to move to a more accomodating room (after we waited and lost a day of our vacation) though the room was bigger- the water in the shower was hot cold hot cold you have to constantly adjust. we still woke up early every day to the sound of people. We could even understand the guests next doors conversation! Last but not least when the toilets flushed above its sounded like someone was pouring water on the carpet. Awful experience- please do not stay there- there are far too many hotels in Paris to be dissappointed. This hotel made us not want to go to the room even to relax! Karrie & Stephen Rose

Reviews.Title: “Ask for a non-smoking room!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the K&K after reading about it on the TripAdviser page. We stayed there from the 18th -22nd Oct 2004. We found it hard to get a hotel in Paris during that week due to a trade fair but luckily the K&K had a room. A few weeks earlier we had been in Paris and had stayed at the La Defence Sofitel, but found it was a little too far out of Paris. On our return to Paris and the K&K our driver from the airport said that the hotel was really nice and we would like it. It is in a great location!!!! Metro acroos the street, 5 min walk to the Seine River, 5 mins to the Musee D'Orsay, 7 mins to the Louvre!!!!! FANTASTIC!!!! We had a great room on the 6th floor with a view of the Eiffel Tower, Very Nice!!! The rooms are very ultra modern, however the room stunk of cigarette smoke. We are both smokers ( however we don't smoke indoors) and we noticed the smell as soon as we walked in. The smell was in the carpet and drapes. We loved the view so much that we didn't ask to change our room( most rooms look into an inside courtyard. BEWARE!!!) Instead we went and bought room freshener and incense and tried to cover the smell. Three nights later the room still stunk of cigarette smoke!!!! Staff were the usual French. Pleasant but stuck up. Typical french!! Breakfast was include in our rate, but it wasn't anything special. I would walk 5 mins to Saint Germain and have brekkie in a cafe.

Reviews.Title: “good value great locatiion”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girl friends and I stayed at the Cayre for a get-away long weekend. The location was fabulous and the rooms and lobby seemed brand spanking new. We were so glad we chose the left bank, and this hotel was on a quiet patch of the Rue Raspail but close walking to many sights and restaurants. One of our friends whose room was on the first floor, did mention the noise and vibration of the subway when they were sleeping (but it was not noticible on our higher floor or when we were in the lobby.) By the second night they were used to it, one bought ear plugs. The street sounds were quieted by the sound proofing of the windows. There were two computers in the lobby for internet access, and a small gym (which is unusual for Paris) but who needs it with all the walking? All of the employees were cordial and spoke far better English than we did French!

Reviews.Title: “Room With A View”
Reviews.Author: outofthekitchen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel mid October with my family. We had 3 rooms on the 6th floor, 2 twins and an executive double were booked unfortunately the executive double although very spacious only had a view of the inner court yard and on checking out the rooms my sons were allocated my husband and I decided to forgo the double bed for their room which had the most charming view of the Eiffel tower, Parisian roof tops and roof top gardens – it even had a small balcony with decking, 2 chairs and a table. The reception staff were very helpful and re allocated the rooms so all the family were satisfied.. My daughters were given the room next to ours and had the same view – no balcony – but a bathroom with French windows and with modern facilities – they were in their element. The sons unfortunately got the raw deal a room without a view – but being boys were still happy to be in such a lovely hotel and they took full advantage of the internet access in the reception area and the gym. All these winging reviews about the price of the breakfast – if you are content in paying the rate for the room do you think that a breakfast should come at a reduced price – why do people always want something for nothing. I was glad to pay that price for the breakfast which was served in spotless surroundings and was plentiful and it was a bonus that you could be served up to midday – great it you wanted a lie in after a day of sight seeing. As for underground vibrations previously mentioned? Wouldn’t all these positive reviewers notice this? Wouldn’t we all be hanging on to grab rails in the reception area if the hotel location to the underground gave this bizarre effect to a bedroom on the second floor? I can honestly say as an unbiased traveller that there was no vibration from the underground. Would this hotel be given an official 4 star rating if this was the case? The K & K is a lovely hotel – smart – modern – clean – good service (yes there is miserable bloke on the reception at night – but who cares there is always one person that you have to talk about on holiday - lol) – fantastic location for all the sights – surrounded by lovely shops – restaurants etc etc, This hotel made our stay in Paris very special – I also could lie in my bed and see the twinkling of the Eiffel Tower at night – wonderful - I would return in a flash.

Reviews.Title: “K & K Cayre 'the real deal'”
Reviews.Author: bigspenderllou
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 6 days in Paris...took my sister for her 40th. It was a return visit for me, and after a ton of research (much on this website) I decided to book the K &K Cayre for our stay. It had a 4ish-star rating (sometimes 3 sometimes 3 1/2???). I believe much of the rating to be due to added business travel-related amenities like a Business lounge and computer internet access etc.. I liked the idea that it had a restaurant (no one ever even spotted eating there...and breakfast...for $32 American dollars, you can have 8 breakfasts anywhere on the block). The Good: The hotel had recently been updated and renovated, I LOOOVE a clean carpet and duvet!!! The design was mod deco/scandanavian chic and the bathrooms immaculate and new! The Bad: Even though we checked in to a mostly empty hotel and payed extra for an upgreaded "executive" double...the room was on the first floor (right over the lobby) where the elevators and stairs met!!!. When I glanced at the floor "evacuation map" it also became clear it was one of the smallest. The ugly...Why didn't any of the hundreds of other reviewers mention that a major subway line runs under the hotel???????At least from our fine upgraded room on the 1st (read, 2nd) floor....we went down for a short nap after a red-eye flight, and found ourselves in that bad episode of "I Love Lucy" with the room shaking and vibrating under our bodies!!!!!!!! who writes these reviews???? employees?. Staff was plenty nice, location was outstanding (on the edge of the hopping 6th but slightly more residential). The shell station next door is your favorite place....with hot coffee, baguetts, cheeses, groceries and cheap wine and beer!!!! you'll stop there every day! The mini-bar is considerbaly cheaper than the bar downstairs...so grab your Heinekin BEFORE heading down to check you e-mails. LOved the "petite chaise" resatuarant around corner, and the food store at the "bon Marche" ( Gucci and unplucked chickens what a trip!!!) and great for gifts. I WOULD recommend this hotel, but only off-season at the reduced rate....and ONLY if you insist on a higher floor. Don't worry about bringing extra euros for French fashion purchases...with the Globalization of fashion ( Gap there...zara Here) there really isn't anything a fashion-savy shopper couldn't get here cheaper and nicer. Boutiques are VERY intimidating ( make shopping on 57th street feel like Target) with a VERY limited selection a "frowning on browers policy". save your money for food and wine (which is cheaper than diet coke!!!) Bon Voyage!!!!

HotelInfo.Name: K+K Hotel Cayre
HotelInfo.Address: 4 boulevard Raspail | 7th Arr., 75007 Paris, France
